﻿THE [GRAND BABYLON H"TEL

Arnold Bennett Chapter One THE MILLIONAIRE AND THE WAITER]250-grand babylon h"tel arnold bennett chapter one the millionaire and the waiter

' YES , [sir]2479-sir ? '[147-jules]

[Jules]147-jules , [the celebrated head waiter of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]251-the celebrated head waiter of the grand babylon , was bending formally towards [the alert , middle - aged man who had just entered [the smoking - room]254-the smoking - room and dropped into a basket - chair in the corner by [the conservatory]255-the conservatory]253-the alert , middle - aged man who had just entered the smoking - room and dropped into a basket - chair in the corner by the conservatory . It was 7.45 on a particularly sultry June night , and dinner was about to be served at [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon . [Men of all sizes , ages , and nationalities]257-men of all sizes , ages , and nationalities , but [every one alike arrayed in faultless evening dress]258-every one alike arrayed in faultless evening dress , were dotted about [the large , dim apartment]259-the large , dim apartment . A faint odour of flowers came from [the conservatory]255-the conservatory , and the tinkle of a fountain . [The waiters]261-the waiters , commanded by [Jules]147-jules , moved softly across the thick Oriental rugs , balancing [their]261-the waiters trays with the dexterity of [jugglers]262-jugglers , and receiving and executing orders with that air of profound importance of which only really [first - class waiters]263-first - class waiters have the secret . The atmosphere was an atmosphere of serenity and repose , characteristic of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon . It seemed impossible that anything could occur to mar the peaceful , aristocratic monotony of existence in [that perfectly - managed establishment]265-that perfectly - managed establishment . Yet on that night was to happen the mightiest upheaval that [the Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon had ever known .

' Yes , [sir]2479-sir ? '[147-jules] repeated [Jules]147-jules , and this time there was a shade of august disapproval in [his]147-jules voice : it was not usual for [him]147-jules to have to address [a customer]266-a customer twice .

' Oh ! '[267-the alert , middle - aged man] said [the alert , middle - aged man]267-the alert , middle - aged man , looking up at length . Beautifully ignorant of the identity of [the great Jules]147-jules , [he]267-the alert , middle - aged man allowed [his]267-the alert , middle - aged man grey eyes to twinkle as [he]267-the alert , middle - aged man caught sight of the expression on [the waiter]268-the waiter 's face . ' Bring [me]267-the alert , middle - aged man [an Angel Kiss]2481-an angel kiss . '[267-the alert , middle - aged man]

' Pardon , [sir]2479-sir ? '[267-the alert , middle - aged man]

' Bring [me]267-the alert , middle - aged man an Angel Kiss , and be good enough to lose no time . '[267-the alert , middle - aged man]

' If it 's an American drink , [I]267-the alert , middle - aged man fear [we]2483-we do n't keep it , [sir]2479-sir . '[267-the alert , middle - aged man] The voice of [Jules]147-jules fell icily distinct , and [several men]269-several men glanced round uneasily , as if to deprecate the slightest disturbance of [their]269-several men calm . The appearance of [the person to whom [Jules]147-jules was speaking]270-the person to whom jules was speaking , however , reassured [them]269-several men somewhat , for [he]147-jules had all the look of [that expert]271-that expert , [the travelled Englishman , who can differentiate between [one h"tel]273-one h"tel and another by instinct , and who knows at once where [he]147-jules may make a fuss with propriety , and where it is advisable to behave exactly as at [the club]274-the club]272-the travelled englishman , who can differentiate between one h"tel and another by instinct , and who knows at once where he may make a fuss with propriety , and where it is advisable to behave exactly as at the club . [The Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon was [a h"tel in whose smoking - room]276-a h"tel in whose smoking - room one behaved as though [one]277-one was at [one 's club]278-one 's club .

' [I]147-jules did n't suppose [you]267-the alert , middle - aged man did keep it , but [you]267-the alert , middle - aged man can mix it , [I]147-jules guess , even in [this h"tel]2485-this h"tel . '[147-jules]

' This is n't [an American h"tel]2486-an american h"tel , [sir]2479-sir . '[147-jules] The calculated insolence of the words was cleverly masked beneath an accent of humble submission .

[The alert , middle - aged man]267-the alert , middle - aged man sat up straight , and gazed placidly at [Jules]147-jules , who was pulling [his]147-jules famous red side - whiskers .

' Get a liqueur glass , '[147-jules] [he]147-jules said , half curtly and half with good - humoured tolerance , ' pour into it equal quantities of maraschino , cream , and creme de menthe . Do n't stir it ; do n't shake it . Bring it to [me]147-jules . And , [I]147-jules say , tell [the bar - tender]2488-the bar - tender - '[147-jules]

' Bar - tender , [sir]2479-sir ? '[147-jules]

' Tell [the bar - tender]2488-the bar - tender to make a note of the recipe , as [I]147-jules shall probably want an Angel Kiss every evening before dinner so long as this weather lasts . '[147-jules]

' [I]147-jules will send the drink to [you]2479-sir , [sir]2479-sir , '[147-jules] said [Jules]147-jules distantly . That was [his]147-jules parting shot , by which [he]147-jules indicated that [he]147-jules was not as [other waiters]280-other waiters are , and that [any person who treated [him]147-jules with disrespect]281-any person who treated him with disrespect did so at [his]281-any person who treated him with disrespect own peril .

A few minutes later , while [the alert , middle - aged man]267-the alert , middle - aged man was tasting the Angel Kiss , [Jules]147-jules sat in conclave with [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer , who had charge of [the bureau of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]283-the bureau of the grand babylon . [This bureau]285-this bureau was [a fairly large chamber , with two sliding glass partitions which overlooked [the entrance - hall]287-the entrance - hall and [the smoking - room]254-the smoking - room]286-a fairly large chamber , with two sliding glass partitions which overlooked the entrance - hall and the smoking - room . Only a small portion of the clerical work of [the great h"tel]289-the great h"tel was performed [there]290-there . [The place]291-the place served chiefly as [the lair of [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer , who was as well known and as important as [Jules]147-jules [himself]147-jules]292-the lair of miss spencer , who was as well known and as important as jules himself . [Most modern h"tels]293-most modern h"tels have [a male clerk to superintend [the bureau]295-the bureau]294-a male clerk to superintend the bureau . But [the Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon went its own way . [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer had been [bureau clerk]296-bureau clerk almost since [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon had first raised [its]252-the grand babylon massive chimneys to heaven , and [she]149-miss spencer remained in [her]149-miss spencer place despite the vagaries of [other h"tels]298-other h"tels . Always admirably dressed in plain black silk , with a small diamond brooch , immaculate wrist - bands , and frizzed yellow hair , [she]149-miss spencer looked now just as [she]149-miss spencer had looked an indefinite number of years ago . [Her]149-miss spencer age - none knew it , save [herself]149-miss spencer and perhaps [one other]299-one other , and [none]300-none cared . The gracious and alluring contours of [her]149-miss spencer figure were irreproachable ; and in the evenings [she]149-miss spencer was a useful ornament of which [any h"tel]301-any h"tel might be innocently proud . [Her]149-miss spencer knowledge of [Bradshaw]150-bradshaw , of steamship services , and the programmes of theatres and music - halls was unrivalled ; yet [she]149-miss spencer never travelled , [she]149-miss spencer never went to [a theatre]302-a theatre or [a music - hall]303-a music - hall . [She]149-miss spencer seemed to spend the whole of [her]149-miss spencer life in [that official lair of [hers]149-miss spencer]304-that official lair of hers , imparting information to [guests]305-guests , telephoning to the various departments , or engaged in intimate conversations with [[her]149-miss spencer special friends on [the staff]307-the staff]306-her special friends on the staff , as at present .

' Who 's Number 107 ? '[147-jules] [Jules]147-jules asked [this black - robed lady]308-this black - robed lady .

[Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer examined [her]149-miss spencer ledgers .

' [Mr Theodore Racksole]151-racksole , [New York]1-new york . '[149-miss spencer]

' [I]147-jules thought [he]151-racksole must be [a New Yorker]2492-a new yorker , '[147-jules] said [Jules]147-jules , after a brief , significant pause , ' but [he]151-racksole talks as good English as [you]149-miss spencer or [me]147-jules . Says [he]151-racksole wants an " Angel Kiss " - maraschino and cream , if [you]149-miss spencer please - every night . [I]147-jules 'll see [he]151-racksole does n't stop [here]2493-here too long . '[147-jules]

[Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer smiled grimly in response . The notion of referring to [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole as [a ' New Yorker]2494-a ' new yorker '[2494-a ' new yorker] appealed to [her]149-miss spencer sense of humour , a sense in which [she]149-miss spencer was not entirely deficient . [She]149-miss spencer knew , of course , and [she]149-miss spencer knew that [Jules]147-jules knew , that this [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole must be the unique and only [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole , [the third richest man in [the United States]310-the united states]309-the third richest man in the united states , and therefore probably in [the world]311-the world . Nevertheless [she]149-miss spencer ranged [herself]149-miss spencer at once on the side of [Jules]147-jules .

Just as there was only one [Racksole]151-racksole , so there was only one [Jules]147-jules , and [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer instinctively shared [the latter]312-the latter 's indignation at the spectacle of [any person whatsoever]313-any person whatsoever , [millionaire or Emperor]314-millionaire or emperor , presuming to demand an ' Angel Kiss '[147-jules] , that unrespectable concoction of maraschino and cream , within [the precincts of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]315-the precincts of the grand babylon . In [the world of h"tels]317-the world of h"tels it was currently stated that , next to [the proprietor]318-the proprietor , there were [three gods at [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]319-three gods at the grand babylon - [Jules]147-jules , [the head waiter]321-the head waiter , [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer , and , most powerful of all , [Rocco]152-rocco , [the renowned chef , who earned two thousand a year]322-the renowned chef , who earned two thousand a year , and had a chalet on [the Lake of [Lucerne]2-lucerne]323-the lake of lucerne . [All the great h"tels in [Northumberland Avenue]3-northumberland avenue and on [the Thames Embankment]325-the thames embankment]324-all the great h"tels in northumberland avenue and on the thames embankment had tried to get [Rocco]152-rocco away from [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon , but without success . [Rocco]152-rocco was well aware that even [he]152-rocco could rise no higher than the maître h"tel of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon , which , though [it]252-the grand babylon never advertised [itself]252-the grand babylon , and did n't belong to [a limited company]328-a limited company , stood an easy first among [the h"tels of [Europe]4-europe]329-the h"tels of europe - first in expensiveness , first in exclusiveness , first in that mysterious quality known as ' style '[332-several colossal neighbours] .

Situated on [the Embankment]330-the embankment , [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon , despite [its]252-the grand babylon noble proportions , was somewhat dwarfed by [several colossal neighbours]332-several colossal neighbours . [It]252-the grand babylon had but [three hundred and fifty rooms]333-three hundred and fifty rooms , whereas there are two h"tels within a quarter of a mile with [six hundred and four hundred rooms respectively]334-six hundred and four hundred rooms respectively . On the other hand , [the Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon was [the only h"tel in [London]6-london with a genuine separate entrance for [Royal visitors]336-royal visitors constantly in use]335-the only h"tel in london with a genuine separate entrance for royal visitors constantly in use . [The Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon counted that day wasted on which [it]5-the grand babylon did not entertain , at the lowest , [a German prince]337-a german prince or [the Maharajah of [some Indian State]339-some indian state]338-the maharajah of some indian state . When [Felix Babylon]153-babylon - after whom , and not with any reference to [London]6-london 's nickname , [the h"tel]340-the h"tel was christened - when [Felix Babylon]153-babylon founded [the h"tel]340-the h"tel in 1869 [he]153-babylon had set [himself]153-babylon to cater for [Royalty]342-royalty , and that was the secret of [his]153-babylon triumphant eminence .

[The son of [a rich Swiss h"tel proprietor and financier]344-a rich swiss h"tel proprietor and financier]343-the son of a rich swiss h"tel proprietor and financier , [he]153-babylon had contrived to established a connection with [the officials of [several European Courts]346-several european courts]345-the officials of several european courts , and [he]153-babylon had not spared money in that respect . [Sundry kings]347-sundry kings and [not a few princesses]348-not a few princesses called [him]153-babylon [Felix]153-babylon , and spoke familiarly of [the h"tel]340-the h"tel as ' [Felix]153-babylon 's '[340-the h"tel] ; and [Felix]153-babylon had found that this was very good for trade . [The Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon was managed accordingly . The ' note '[340-the h"tel] of [its]252-the grand babylon policy was discretion , always discretion , and quietude , simplicity , remoteness . [The place]291-the place was like [a palace incognito]352-a palace incognito . There was no gold sign over the roof , not even an explanatory word at the entrance . [You]353-you walked down [a small side street off [the Strand]355-the strand]354-a small side street off the strand , [you]353-you saw [a plain brown building in front of [you]353-you , with two mahogany swing doors , and [an official behind each]357-an official behind each]356-a plain brown building in front of you , with two mahogany swing doors , and an official behind each ; the doors opened noiselessly ; [you]353-you entered ; [you]353-you were in [Felix]153-babylon 's . If [you]353-you meant to be [a guest]358-a guest , [you]353-you , or [[your]353-you courier]359-your courier , gave [your]353-you card to [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer . Upon no consideration did [you]353-you ask for the tariff . It was not good form to mention prices at [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon ; the prices were enormous , but [you]353-you never mentioned them . At the conclusion of [your]353-you stay a bill was presented , brief and void of dry details , and [you]353-you paid it without a word . [You]353-you met with a stately civility , that was all . [No one]361-no one had originally asked [you]353-you to come ; [no one]361-no one expressed the hope that [you]353-you would come again . [The Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon was far above such manoeuvres ; it defied competition by ignoring it ; and consequently was nearly always full during the season .

If there was one thing more than another that annoyed [the Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon - put its back up , so to speak - it was to be compared with , or to be mistaken for , [an American h"tel]2486-an american h"tel . [The Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon was resolutely opposed to American methods of eating , drinking , and lodging - but especially American methods of drinking . The resentment of [Jules]147-jules , on being requested to supply [Mr Theodore Racksole]151-racksole with an [Angel Kiss]154-angel kiss , will therefore be appreciated .

' Anybody with [Mr Theodore Racksole]151-racksole ? '[147-jules] asked [Jules]147-jules , continuing [his]147-jules conversation with [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer . [He]147-jules put a scornful stress on every syllable of [the guest]365-the guest 's name .

' [Miss Racksole]155-nella - [she]155-nella 's in No . 111 . '[147-jules]

[Jules]147-jules paused , and stroked [his]147-jules left whisker as it lay on [his]147-jules gleaming white collar .

' [She]155-nella 's where ? '[147-jules] [he]147-jules queried , with a peculiar emphasis .

' No . 111 . [I]149-miss spencer could n't help it . There was [no other room]2495-no other room with [[a bathroom]2496-a bathroom and dressing - room on that floor]2497-a bathroom and dressing - room on that floor . '[149-miss spencer] [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer 's voice had an appealing tone of excuse .

' Why did n't [you]147-jules tell [Mr Theodore Racksole]151-racksole and [Miss Racksole]155-nella that [we]2498-we were unable to accommodate [them]366-only three people in the wide world ? '[147-jules]

' Because [Babs]153-babylon was within hearing . '[149-miss spencer]

[Only three people in [the wide world]367-the wide world]366-only three people in the wide world ever dreamt of applying to [Mr Felix Babylon the playful but mean abbreviation - Babs]153-babylon : those three were [Jules]147-jules , [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer , and [Rocco]152-rocco . [Jules]147-jules had invented it . [No one]361-no one but [he]147-jules would have had either the wit or the audacity to do so .

' [You]149-miss spencer 'd better see that [Miss Racksole]155-nella changes [[her]155-nella room]2499-her room to - night , '[147-jules] [Jules]147-jules said after another pause . ' Leave it to [me]147-jules : [I]147-jules 'll fix it . [Au revoir]2500-au revoir ! It 's three minutes to eight . [I]147-jules shall take charge of [the dining - room]2501-the dining - room [myself]147-jules to - night . '[147-jules]

And [Jules]147-jules departed , rubbing [his]147-jules fine white hands slowly and meditatively . It was a trick of [his]147-jules , to rub [his]147-jules hands with a strange , roundabout motion , and the action denoted that some unusual excitement was in the air .

At eight o'clock precisely dinner was served in [the immense salle manger]369-the immense salle manger , [that chaste yet splendid apartment of white and gold]370-that chaste yet splendid apartment of white and gold . At a small table near one of the windows [a young lady]371-a young lady sat alone . [Her]371-a young lady frocks said [Paris]7-paris , but [her]371-a young lady face unmistakably said [New York]1-new york . [The young lady by the window]380-the young lady by the window glanced disapprovingly at the menu card . Chapter Two HOW [MR RACKSOLE]151-racksole OBTAINED [HIS]151-racksole DINNER

' [I]151-racksole never regret . '[151-racksole]

Chapter Three AT THREE A.M.

[MR REGINALD DIMMOCK]166-dimmock proved [himself]166-dimmock , despite [his]166-dimmock extreme youth , to be [a man of [the world]311-the world and of experiences]490-a man of the world and of experiences , and [a practised talker]492-a practised talker . [They]493-they chattered about [St Petersburg]14-st petersburg , and the ice on [the Neva]15-the neva , and [the tenor at the opera who had been exiled to [Siberia]16-siberia , and the quality of Russian tea , and the sweetness of Russian champagne , and various other aspects of Muscovite existence]494-the tenor at the opera who had been exiled to siberia , and the quality of russian tea , and the sweetness of russian champagne , and various other aspects of muscovite existence . [Nella]155-nella and [Mr Dimmock]166-dimmock sat together on [the terrace]2616-the terrace , sipping iced drinks . [Jules]147-jules [himself]147-jules served the liquids , and at ten o'clock [he]147-jules brought another note . Just then [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole had found [his]151-racksole way once more into [[Mr Babylon]153-babylon 's private room]444-mr babylon 's private room . [The corridors]531-the corridors hummed with it , and [even under - servants]532-even under - servants were to be seen discussing the thing , just as though it mattered to [them]532-even under - servants .

' Have a cigar , [Mr Racksole]151-racksole , '[153-babylon] said [the urbane Mr Babylon]153-babylon , ' and a mouthful of the oldest cognac in all [Europe]4-europe . '[153-babylon]

In a few minutes [these two]533-these two were talking eagerly , rapidly . [Felix Babylon]153-babylon was astonished at [Racksole]151-racksole 's capacity for absorbing the details of h"tel management . And as for [Racksole]151-racksole [he]153-babylon soon realized that [Felix Babylon]153-babylon must be [a prince of [h"tel managers]535-h"tel managers]534-a prince of h"tel managers . It had never occurred to [Racksole]151-racksole before that to manage [an h"tel]536-an h"tel , even a large h"tel , could be a specially interesting affair , or that it could make any excessive demands upon the brains of [the manager]537-the manager ; but [he]151-racksole came to see that [he]151-racksole had underrated the possibilities of an h"tel . The business of [the Grand Babylon]162-the grand babylon was enormous . It took [Racksole]151-racksole , with all [his]151-racksole genius for organization , exactly half an hour to master the details of the h"tel laundry - work . And the laundry - work was but one branch of activity amid scores , and not a very large one at that . The machinery of checking supplies , and of establishing a mean ratio between the raw stuff received in [the kitchen]538-the kitchen and the number of meals served in [the salle a manger]539-the salle a manger and [the private rooms]540-the private rooms , was very complicated and delicate . When [Racksole]151-racksole had grasped it , [he]151-racksole at once suggested some improvements , and this led to a long theoretical discussion , and the discussion led to digressions , and then [Felix Babylon]153-babylon , in a moment of absent - mindedness , yawned .

[Racksole]151-racksole looked at the gilt clock on the high mantelpiece .

' [Great Scott]170-great scott ! '[151-racksole] [he]151-racksole said . ' It 's three o'clock . [Mr Babylon]153-babylon , accept [my]151-racksole apologies for having kept [you]153-babylon up to such an absurd hour . '[151-racksole]

' [I]541-i have not spent so pleasant an evening for many years . [You]153-babylon have let [me]541-i ride [my]541-i hobby to [my]541-i heart 's content . It is [I]541-i who should apologize . '[541-i]

[Racksole]151-racksole rose .

' [I]153-babylon should like to ask [you]153-babylon one question , '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon . ' Have [you]153-babylon ever had anything to do with h"tels before ? '[153-babylon]

' Then [you]153-babylon have missed [your]153-babylon vocation . ' That is so . '[153-babylon]

' Not necessarily . Not unless [one]277-one wishes . [The modern h"tel proprietor]2637-the modern h"tel proprietor is not like [an innkeeper of the Middle Ages]2638-an innkeeper of the middle ages , and [even princes]2639-even princes do not expect to see [him]2637-the modern h"tel proprietor unless something should happen to go wrong . [They]541-i talked a little longer , and then [Racksole]151-racksole said good night . ' Let [me]151-racksole see [you]151-racksole to [[your]151-racksole room]2641-your room . [The lifts]2642-the lifts will be closed and [the place]291-the place will be deserted .[151-racksole]

' No , thanks , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole ; ' let [me]151-racksole explore [[my]151-racksole own h"tel]2644-my own h"tel unaccompanied . [I]151-racksole believe [I]151-racksole can discover [[my]151-racksole room]2645-my room . '[151-racksole] When [he]151-racksole got fairly into [the passages]543-the passages , [Racksole]151-racksole was not so sure that [he]151-racksole could discover [[his]151-racksole own room]544-his own room . The number was 107 , but [he]151-racksole had forgotten whether it was on [the first or second floor]545-the first or second floor .

Travelling in a lift , one is unconscious of [floors]546-floors . [He]151-racksole passed several lift - doorways , but [he]151-racksole could see no glint of a staircase ; in all self - respecting h"tels staircases have gone out of fashion , and though [h"tel architects]547-h"tel architects still continue , for old sakes ' sake , to build staircases , they are tucked away in remote corners where [their]547-h"tel architects presence is not likely to offend the eye of [a spoiled and cosmopolitan public]2646-a spoiled and cosmopolitan public . [The h"tel]340-the h"tel seemed vast , uncanny , deserted . An electric light glowed here and there at long intervals . [He]151-racksole soon discovered that the numbers of [the rooms on this floor]2652-the rooms on this floor did not get beyond seventy . [He]151-racksole did hear a step . Chapter Four ENTRANCE OF [THE PRINCE]2578-the prince

Chapter Five WHAT OCCURRED TO [REGINALD DIMMOCK]166-dimmock

' Go right in , '[2578-the prince] said a voice sharply . It was [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole 's . [Two men]662-two men entered , bearing a prone form on a stretcher , and [Racksole]151-racksole followed [them]662-two men .

[Nella]155-nella sprang up . [Racksole]151-racksole stared to see [[his]151-racksole daughter]425-his daughter .

Chapter Six IN [THE GOLD ROOM]692-the gold room

AT [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon a great ball was given that night in [the Gold Room]692-the gold room , [a huge saloon attached to [the h"tel]340-the h"tel , though scarcely part of [it]692-the gold room]695-a huge saloon attached to the h"tel , though scarcely part of it , and certainly less exclusive than [the h"tel itself]697-the h"tel itself . Who [Mr]701-mr and [Mrs Sampson Levi]183-mrs sampson levi were [he]151-racksole did not know , nor could [anyone]415-anyone tell [him]151-racksole anything about [them]699-them except that [Mr Sampson Levi]184-mr sampson levi was [a prominent member of that part of [the Stock Exchange]32-the stock exchange familiarly called [the Kaffir Circus]33-the kaffir circus , and that [[his]184-mr sampson levi wife]704-his wife was [a stout lady with an aquiline nose and many diamonds]705-a stout lady with an aquiline nose and many diamonds , and that [they]699-them were very rich and very hospitable]703-a prominent member of that part of the stock exchange familiarly called the kaffir circus , and that his wife was a stout lady with an aquiline nose and many diamonds , and that they were very rich and very hospitable . [His]151-racksole reasons for such a course were threefold - first , [he]151-racksole felt depressed and uneasy ; second , [he]151-racksole did n't like the name of [Sampson Levi]184-mr sampson levi ; and , third , [he]151-racksole had a desire to show [these so - called plutocrats]709-these so - called plutocrats that [their]709-these so - called plutocrats wealth was nothing to [him]151-racksole , that [they]709-these so - called plutocrats could not do what [they]709-these so - called plutocrats chose with [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole , and that for two pins [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole would buy [them]699-them up , and the whole [Kaffir Circus]33-the kaffir circus to boot . [He]151-racksole felt instinctively that in [England]22-england there are things [you]711-you ca n't do , and that this particular thing was one of them . [The Gold Room of the Grand Babylon]715-the gold room of the grand babylon was built for [a ballroom]717-a ballroom . [Everyone]722-everyone knew this , and [most people]723-most people took advantage of it . Yet so it was . Strange matters and unexpected faces had been descried from the little window , and [more than one European detective]733-more than one european detective had kept vigil [there]290-there with the most eminently satisfactory results .

At eleven o'clock [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole , afflicted by vexation of spirit , found [himself]151-racksole gazing idly through the little barred window . [Nella]155-nella was with [him]151-racksole .

The sound of violins and a confused murmur of voices rose gently up to [them]735-they .

[He]151-racksole sat up very late . To be precise , [he]151-racksole sat up all night . [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole walked away , and breakfasted upon one cup of tea and half a slice of toast .

Chapter Seven [NELLA AND THE PRINCE]187-nella

IT appeared impossible to [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole that so cumbrous an article as a corpse could be removed out of [[his]166-dimmock h"tel]706-his h"tel , with no trace , no hint , no clue as to the time or the manner of the performance of the deed . After the first feeling of surprise , [Racksole]151-racksole grew coldly and severely angry . [He]151-racksole had a mind to dismiss [the entire staff of [the h"tel]340-the h"tel]794-the entire staff of the h"tel . [He]151-racksole personally examined [the night - watchman]796-the night - watchman , [the chambermaids]797-the chambermaids and [all other persons who by chance might or ought to know something of the affair]798-all other persons who by chance might or ought to know something of the affair ; but without avail . The corpse of [Reginald Dimmock]166-dimmock had vanished utterly - disappeared like a fleshless spirit .

Of course there were [the police]673-the police . But [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole held [the police]673-the police in sorry esteem . [He]151-racksole acquainted [them]673-the police with the facts , answered [their]673-the police queries with a patient weariness , and expected , nothing whatever from that quarter . [He]151-racksole also had several interviews with [Prince Aribert of Posen]167-aribert , but though [the Prince]2578-the prince was suavity itself and beyond doubt genuinely concerned about the fate of [[his]2578-the prince dead attendant]802-his dead attendant , yet it seemed to [Racksole]151-racksole that [he]2578-the prince was keeping something back , that [he]2578-the prince hesitated to say all [he]2578-the prince knew . [Racksole]151-racksole , with characteristic insight , decided that the death of [Reginald Dimmock]166-dimmock was only a minor event , which had occurred , as it were , on the fringe of some far more profound mystery . And , therefore , [he]151-racksole decided to wait , with [his]151-racksole eyes very wide open , until something else happened that would throw light on the business . At the moment [he]151-racksole took only one measure - [he]151-racksole arranged that the theft of [Dimmock]166-dimmock 's body should not appear in the newspapers . It is astonishing how well a secret can be kept , when [the possessors of the secret]803-the possessors of the secret are handled with the proper mixture of firmness and persuasion . [Racksole]151-racksole managed this very neatly . It was a complicated job , and [his]151-racksole success in it rather pleased [him]151-racksole .

At the same time [he]151-racksole was conscious of being temporarily worsted by [an unknown group of schemers]804-an unknown group of schemers , in which [he]151-racksole felt convinced that [Jules]147-jules was an important item . [He]151-racksole could scarcely look [Nella]187-nella in the eyes . [The girl]577-the girl had evidently expected [him]151-racksole to unmask this conspiracy at once , with a single stroke of [the millionaire]414-the millionaire 's magic wand . [She]577-the girl was thoroughly accustomed , in [the land of]807-the land of [her]577-the girl birth , to seeing [him]151-racksole achieve impossible feats . Over there [he]151-racksole was [a ' boss]2888-a ' boss '[151-racksole] ; [men]719-men trembled before [his]151-racksole name ; when [he]151-racksole wished a thing to happen - well , it happened ; if [he]151-racksole desired to know a thing , [he]151-racksole just knew it . But here , in [London]6-london , [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole was not quite the same [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole . [He]151-racksole dominated [New York]1-new york ; but [London]6-london , for the most part , seemed not to take much interest in [him]151-racksole ; and there were certainly [various persons in [London]6-london who were capable of snapping [their]809-various persons in london who were capable of snapping their fingers at him fingers at [him]151-racksole]809-various persons in london who were capable of snapping their fingers at him - at [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole . Neither [he]151-racksole nor [[his]151-racksole daughter]425-his daughter could get used to that fact .

As for [Nella]187-nella , [she]425-his daughter concerned [herself]425-his daughter for a little with the ordinary business of [the bureau]295-the bureau , and watched the incomings and outgoings of [Prince Aribert]167-aribert with a kindly interest . [She]425-his daughter perceived , what [[her]425-his daughter father]386-her father had failed to perceive , that [[His]151-racksole Highness]2573-his highness had assumed an attitude of reserve merely to hide the secret distraction and dismay which consumed [him]151-racksole . [She]425-his daughter saw that [the poor fellow]667-the poor fellow had no settled plan in [his]151-racksole head , and that [he]151-racksole was troubled by something which , so far , [he]151-racksole had confided to [nobody]2714-nobody . It came to [her]425-his daughter knowledge that each morning [he]151-racksole walked to and fro on [the Victoria Embankment]816-the victoria embankment , alone , and apparently with no object . On the third morning [she]425-his daughter decided that driving exercise on [the Embankment]330-the embankment would be good for [her]425-his daughter health , and thereupon ordered [a carriage]818-a carriage and issued forth , arrayed in a miraculous putty - coloured gown . [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen , [the hereditary Grand Duke of Posen]2904-the hereditary grand duke of posen , has disappeared . Chapter Eight ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE OF [THE BARONESS]837-the baroness

ON the following morning , just before lunch , [a lady]838-a lady , accompanied by [a maid and a considerable quantity of luggage]839-a maid and a considerable quantity of luggage , came to [the Grand Babylon H"tel]840-the grand babylon h"tel . [She]838-a lady was [a plump , little old lady , with white hair and an old - fashioned bonnet]841-a plump , little old lady , with white hair and an old - fashioned bonnet , and [she]838-a lady had a quaint , simple smile of surprise at everything in general .

Nevertheless , [she]838-a lady gave the impression of belonging to [some aristocracy]842-some aristocracy , though not [the English aristocracy]843-the english aristocracy . [Her]838-a lady tone to [[her]838-a lady maid]566-her maid , whom [she]838-a lady addressed in broken English - [the girl being apparently English]845-the girl being apparently english - was distinctly insolent , with the calm , unconscious insolence peculiar to [a certain type of Continental nobility]846-a certain type of continental nobility . The name on [the lady]847-the lady 's card ran thus : ' [Baroness Zerlinski]188-the baroness zerlinski '[847-the lady] . [She]847-the lady desired [rooms on [the third floor]849-the third floor]848-rooms on the third floor . It happened that [Nella]155-nella was in [the bureau]295-the bureau .

' On [the third floor]849-the third floor , [madam]2949-madam ? '[155-nella] questioned [Nella]155-nella , in [her]155-nella best clerkly manner .

' [I]851-the plump little old lady did say on [de tird floor]2950-de tird floor , '[851-the plump little old lady] said [the plump little old lady]851-the plump little old lady .

' [We]2951-we have accommodation on [the second floor]2653-the second floor . '[155-nella]

' [I]837-the baroness wish to be high up , out of de dust and in de light , '[837-the baroness] explained [the Baroness]837-the baroness .

' [We]2951-we have [no suites on [the third floor]849-the third floor]2953-no suites on the third floor , [madam]2949-madam . '[155-nella]

' Never mind , [no mattaire]2956-no mattaire ! Have [you]2949-madam not [two rooms that communicate]2957-two rooms that communicate ? '[155-nella]

[Nella]155-nella consulted [her]155-nella books , rather awkwardly .

' Numbers 122 and 123 communicate . '[155-nella]

' Or is it 121 and 122 ? [the little old lady]2958-the little old lady remarked quickly , and then bit [her]2958-the little old lady lip .[155-nella]

' [I]155-nella beg [your]155-nella pardon . [I]155-nella should have said 121 and 122 . '[155-nella]

At the moment [Nella]155-nella regarded [the Baroness]837-the baroness 's correction of [her]155-nella figures as a curious chance , but afterwards , when [the Baroness]837-the baroness had ascended in [the lift]855-the lift , the thing struck [her]155-nella as somewhat strange . Perhaps [the Baroness Zerlinski]188-the baroness zerlinski had stayed at [the h"tel]340-the h"tel before . For the sake of convenience an index of [visitors to the h"tel]857-visitors to the h"tel was kept and the index extended back for thirty years . [Nella]155-nella examined it , but it did not contain the name of [Zerlinski]188-the baroness zerlinski . Then it was that [Nella]155-nella began to imagine , what had swiftly crossed [her]155-nella mind when first [the Baroness]837-the baroness presented [herself]837-the baroness at [the bureau]295-the bureau , that the features of [the Baroness]837-the baroness were remotely familiar to [her]155-nella . [She]155-nella thought , not that [she]155-nella had seen [the old lady]861-the old lady 's face before , but that [she]155-nella had seen somewhere , some time , a face of a similar cast . It occurred to [Nella]155-nella to look at the ' Almanach [de Gotha]189-de gotha '[155-nella] - that record of all the mazes of [Continental]47-continental blue blood ; but the ' Almanach [de Gotha]189-de gotha '[155-nella] made no reference to [any barony of [Zerlinski]188-the baroness zerlinski]862-any barony of zerlinski . [Nella]155-nella inquired where [the Baroness]837-the baroness meant to take lunch , and was informed that a table had been reserved for [her]837-the baroness in [the dining - room]2501-the dining - room , and [she]155-nella at once decided to lunch in [the dining - room]2501-the dining - room [herself]155-nella . Seated in a corner , half - hidden by a pillar , [she]155-nella could survey [all the guests]866-all the guests , and watch [each group]867-each group as it entered or left . Presently [the Baroness]837-the baroness appeared , dressed in black , with a tiny lace shawl , despite the June warmth ; very stately , very quaint , and gently smiling . [Nella]155-nella observed [her]837-the baroness intently . [The lady]847-the lady ate heartily , working without haste and without delay through the elaborate menu of the luncheon . [Nella]155-nella noticed that [she]837-the baroness had beautiful white teeth . Then a remarkable thing happened . A cream puff was served to [the Baroness]837-the baroness by way of sweets , and [Nella]155-nella was astonished to see [the little lady]871-the little lady remove the top , and with a spoon quietly take something from the interior which looked like a piece of folded paper . [No one who had not been watching with the eye of a lynx]872-no one who had not been watching with the eye of a lynx would have noticed anything extraordinary in the action ; indeed , the chances were nine hundred and ninety - nine to one that it would pass unheeded . But , unfortunately for [the Baroness]188-the baroness zerlinski , it was the thousandth chance that happened . [Nella]155-nella jumped up , and walking over to [the Baroness]837-the baroness , said to [her]837-the baroness :

Perhaps it was instinct , perhaps it was the mere spirit of adventure ; but that evening [Nella]155-nella was to be seen of all men on [the steamer]882-the steamer for [Ostend]42-ostend which leaves [Dover]48-dover at 11 p.m. [She]155-nella told [no one]361-no one of [her]155-nella intentions - not even [[her]155-nella father , who was not in [the h"tel]340-the h"tel when [she]155-nella left]884-her father , who was not in the h"tel when she left . It would not be too much to say that [she]155-nella was distinctly annoyed . [She]155-nella pretended to be annoyed with circumstances , but really [she]155-nella was annoyed with [Nella Racksole]155-nella . [Her]155-nella mercurial spirits rose again . A minute ago [she]155-nella was regarding [herself]155-nella as no better than a ninny engaged in a wild - goose chase . Such is human nature .

[The steamer]882-the steamer seemed interminably slow in coming into [harbour]911-harbour . [Nella]155-nella walked on [the Digue]51-the digue for a few minutes to watch it the better . [The town]912-the town was silent and almost deserted . [It]912-the town had a false and sinister aspect . [She]155-nella remembered tales which [she]155-nella had heard of [this glittering resort]913-this glittering resort , which in the season holds more scoundrels than [any place in [Europe]4-europe]914-any place in europe , save only [Monte Carlo]52-monte carlo . Chapter Nine [TWO WOMEN AND THE REVOLVER]955-two women and the revolver

' But [Mr Dimmock]166-dimmock was murdered . [He]2984-your husband was poisoned . If [he]2984-your husband had not been poisoned why was [his]2984-your husband body stolen ? It must have been stolen to prevent inquiry , to hide traces . Tell [me]149-miss spencer about that . '[149-miss spencer]

'[149-miss spencer]

[Nella]155-nella was inclined to believe the statement . ' Oh , but [you]149-miss spencer must know , '[155-nella] smiled [Nella]155-nella calmly . ' [You]149-miss spencer ca n't possibly be so innocent as all that , [Mrs Tom Jackson]192-mrs tom jackson . [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer looked into [Nella]155-nella 's face , and then [her]155-nella eyes dropped , and [her]155-nella fingers worked nervously with the tablecloth .

Then [she]155-nella raised the revolver . It was a mechanical , unintentional sort of action , and certainly [she]155-nella had no intention of using the weapon , but , strange to say , [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer again cowered before it . Even at that moment [Nella]155-nella wondered that [a woman like [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer]974-a woman like miss spencer could be so simple as to think the revolver would actually be used . Having absolutely no physical cowardice [herself]155-nella , [Nella]155-nella had the greatest difficulty in imagining that [other people]975-other people could be at the mercy of a bodily fear . Still , [she]155-nella saw [her]155-nella advantage , and used it relentlessly , and with as much theatrical gesture as [she]155-nella could command . [She]155-nella raised the revolver till it was level with [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer 's face , and suddenly a new , queer feeling took hold of [her]155-nella . [She]155-nella knew that [she]155-nella would indeed use that revolver now , if [the miserable woman before [her]155-nella]976-the miserable woman before her drove [her]155-nella too far . [She]155-nella felt afraid - afraid of [herself]155-nella ; [she]155-nella was in the grasp of a savage , primeval instinct . In a flash [she]155-nella saw [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer dead at [her]155-nella feet - [the police]673-the police - [a court of justice]978-a court of justice - the scaffold . It was horrible .

' Speak , '[155-nella] [she]155-nella said hoarsely , and [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer 's face went whiter .

' [Rocco]152-rocco ! What about [Rocco]152-rocco ? '[155-nella] [Nella]155-nella could scarcely hear [herself]155-nella . [Her]155-nella grip of the revolver tightened .

[Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer 's eyes opened wider ; [she]149-miss spencer gazed at [Nella]155-nella with a glassy stare .

[Nella]155-nella was conscious of a sudden revulsion . [The woman]966-the woman had surely fainted . Dropping the revolver [she]155-nella ran round the table . [She]155-nella was [herself]155-nella again - feminine , sympathetic , [the old Nella]155-nella . [She]155-nella felt immensely relieved that this had happened . But at the same instant [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer sprang up from the chair like a cat , seized the revolver , and with a wild movement of the arm flung it against the window . It crashed through the glass , exploding as it went , and there was a tense silence .

' [I]149-miss spencer told [you]155-nella that [you]155-nella were [a fool]954-a fool , '[149-miss spencer] remarked [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer slowly , ' coming here like a sort of [female Jack Sheppard]193-female jack sheppard , and trying to get the best of [me]149-miss spencer .[149-miss spencer]

[We]982-we are on equal terms now . [You]155-nella frightened [me]0-i , but [I]0-i knew [I]0-i was [a cleverer woman]983-a cleverer woman than [you]155-nella , and that in the end , if [I]0-i kept on long enough , [I]0-i should win .

Now it will be [my]0-i turn . '[0-i]

Dumbfounded , and overcome with a miserable sense of the truth of [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer 's words , [Nella]155-nella stood still . The idea of [her]155-nella colossal foolishness swept through [her]155-nella like a flood . [She]155-nella felt almost ashamed . But even at this juncture [she]155-nella had no fear . [She]155-nella faced [the woman]966-the woman bravely , [her]155-nella mind leaping about in search of some plan . [She]155-nella could think of nothing but a bribe - an enormous bribe .

' [I]155-nella admit [you]155-nella 've won , '[155-nella] [she]155-nella said , ' but [I]155-nella 've not finished yet . Just listen . '[155-nella]

[Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer folded [her]149-miss spencer arms , and glanced at the door , smiling bitterly .

' [You]155-nella know [[my]149-miss spencer father]2751-my father is [a millionaire]2537-a millionaire ; perhaps [you]155-nella know that [he]2751-my father is [one of [the richest men in [the world]311-the world]3014-the richest men in the world]3013-one of the richest men in the world . '[149-miss spencer]

' Twenty thousand pounds , '[155-nella] said [Nella]155-nella promptly . [She]155-nella had begun to regard the affair as a business operation .

[Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer 's lip curled .

Again [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer 's lip curled .

[Nella]155-nella felt cold down the spine , and sat down again in [her]155-nella chair . A draught of air from the broken window blew on [her]155-nella cheek . Steps sounded in [the passage]985-the passage ; the door opened , but [Nella]155-nella did not turn round . [She]155-nella could not move [her]155-nella eyes from [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer 's . There was a noise of rushing water in [her]155-nella ears . [She]155-nella lost consciousness , and slipped limply to [the ground]986-the ground .

Chapter Ten AT SEA

IT seemed to [Nella]155-nella that [she]155-nella was being rocked gently in a vast cradle , which swayed to and fro with a motion at once slow and incredibly gentle . This sensation continued for some time , and there was added to it the sound of a quick , quiet , muffled beat . Soft , exhilarating breezes wafted [her]155-nella forward in spite of [herself]155-nella , and yet [she]155-nella remained in a delicious calm . [She]155-nella wondered if [[her]155-nella mother]987-her mother was kneeling by [her]155-nella side , whispering some lullaby in [her]155-nella childish ears . Then strange colours swam before [her]155-nella eyes , [her]155-nella eyelids wavered , and at last [she]155-nella awoke . For a few moments [her]155-nella gaze travelled to and fro in a vain search for some clue to [her]155-nella surroundings , was aware of nothing except sense of repose and a feeling of relief that some mighty and fatal struggle was over ; [she]155-nella cared not whether [she]155-nella had conquered or suffered defeat in the struggle of [her]155-nella soul with [some other soul]988-some other soul ; it was finished , done with , and the consciousness of its conclusion satisfied and contented [her]155-nella . Gradually [her]155-nella brain , recovering from its obsession , began to grasp the phenomena of [her]155-nella surroundings , and [she]155-nella saw that [she]155-nella was on [a yacht]989-a yacht , and that [the yacht]990-the yacht was moving . The motion of the cradle was the smooth rolling of [the vessel]991-the vessel ; the beat was the beat of its screw ; the strange colours were the cloud tints thrown by the sun as it rose over a distant and receding shore in the wake of [the yacht]990-the yacht ; [[her]155-nella mother]987-her mother 's lullaby was the crooned song of [the man at the wheel]994-the man at the wheel . [Nella]155-nella all through [her]155-nella life had had many experiences of yachting . From [the waters of [the River Hudson]55-the river hudson]995-the waters of the river hudson to those bluer tides of [the Mediterranean Sea]56-the mediterranean sea , [she]155-nella had yachted in all seasons and all weathers . [She]155-nella loved the water , and now it seemed deliciously right and proper that [she]155-nella should be on [the water]996-the water again . [She]155-nella raised [her]155-nella head to look round , and then let it sink back : [she]155-nella was fatigued , enervated ; [she]155-nella desired only solitude and calm ; [she]155-nella had no care , no anxiety , no responsibility : a hundred years might have passed since [her]155-nella meeting with [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer , and the memory of that meeting appeared to have faded into the remotest background of [her]155-nella mind .

It was [a small yacht]997-a small yacht , and [her]155-nella practised eye at once told that it belonged to the highest aristocracy of [pleasure craft]998-pleasure craft . As [she]155-nella reclined in the deck - chair it did not occur to [her]155-nella at that moment to speculate as to the identity of [the person who had led [her]155-nella therein [she]155-nella examined all visible details of [the vessel]991-the vessel]999-the person who had led her therein she examined all visible details of the vessel . The deck was as white and smooth as [her]155-nella own hand , and the seams ran along [its]991-the vessel length like blue veins . All the brass - work , from the band round the slender funnel to the concave surface of the binnacle , shone like gold .

The tapered masts stretched upwards at a rakish angle , and the rigging seemed like spun silk . No sails were set ; [the yacht]990-the yacht was under steam , and doing about seven or eight knots . [She]155-nella judged that [it]990-the yacht was [a boat of a hundred tons or so]1002-a boat of a hundred tons or so , probably Clyde - built , and not more than two or three years old .

[No one]361-no one was to be seen on deck except [the man at the wheel]994-the man at the wheel : [this man]827-this man wore a blue jersey ; but there was neither name nor initial on the jersey , nor was there a name on the white life - buoys lashed to the main rigging , nor on [the polished dinghy which hung on [the starboard davits]1007-the starboard davits]1006-the polished dinghy which hung on the starboard davits . [She]155-nella called to [the man]442-the man , and called again , in a feeble voice , but [the steerer]1009-the steerer took no notice of [her]155-nella , and continued [his]1009-the steerer quiet song as though nothing else existed in [the universe]1010-the universe save [the yacht]990-the yacht , [the sea]1012-the sea , the sun , and [himself]1009-the steerer .

Then [her]155-nella eyes swept the outline of [the land]1013-the land from which [they]1014-they were hastening , and [she]155-nella could just distinguish [a lighthouse]1015-a lighthouse and a great white irregular dome , which [she]155-nella recognized as [the Kursaal at [Ostend]42-ostend]1016-the kursaal at ostend , [that gorgeous rival of [the gaming palace at [Monte Carlo]52-monte carlo]1018-the gaming palace at monte carlo]1017-that gorgeous rival of the gaming palace at monte carlo . So [she]155-nella was leaving [Ostend]42-ostend . The rays of the sun fell on [her]155-nella caressingly , like a restorative . All around [the water]996-the water was changing from wonderful greys and dark blues to still more wonderful pinks and translucent unearthly greens ; the magic kaleidoscope of dawn was going forward in its accustomed way , regardless of the vicissitudes of [mortals]1020-mortals .

Here and there in the distance [she]155-nella descried a sail - the brown sail of [some Ostend fishing - boat]1021-some ostend fishing - boat returning [home]2605-home after a night 's trawling . Then the beat of paddles caught [her]155-nella ear , and [a steamer]1023-a steamer blundered past , wallowing clumsily among the waves like a tortoise . It was the Swallow from [London]6-london . [She]155-nella could see [some of [its]1023-a steamer passengers]1024-some of its passengers leaning curiously over the aft - rail . [A girl in a mackintosh]1025-a girl in a mackintosh signalled to [her]155-nella , and mechanically [she]155-nella answered the salute with [her]155-nella arm . [The officer of [the bridge of [the Swallow]1028-the swallow]1027-the bridge of the swallow]1026-the officer of the bridge of the swallow hailed [the yacht]990-the yacht , but [the man at the wheel]994-the man at the wheel offered no reply . In another minute [the Swallow]194-the swallow was nothing but a blot in the distance .

[Nella]155-nella tried to sit straight in the deck - chair , but [she]155-nella found [herself]155-nella unable to do so . Throwing off the rug which covered [her]155-nella , [she]155-nella discovered that [she]155-nella had been tied to the chair by means of a piece of broad webbing . Instantly [she]155-nella was alert , awake , angry ; [she]155-nella knew that [her]155-nella perils were not over ; [she]155-nella felt that possibly they had scarcely yet begun . [Her]155-nella lazy contentment , [her]155-nella dreamy sense of peace and repose , vanished utterly , and [she]155-nella steeled [herself]155-nella to meet the dangers of a grave and difficult situation .

Just at that moment [a man]2659-a man came up from below . [He]2659-a man was [a man of forty or so , clad in irreproachable blue , with a peaked yachting cap]1032-a man of forty or so , clad in irreproachable blue , with a peaked yachting cap . [He]2659-a man raised the cap politely .

' Good morning , '[2659-a man] [he]2659-a man said . ' Beautiful sunrise , is n't it ? '[2659-a man] The clever and calculated insolence of [his]2659-a man tone cut [her]155-nella like a lash as [she]155-nella lay bound in the chair . Like all people who have lived easy and joyous lives in those fair regions where gold smoothes every crease and law keeps a tight hand on disorder , [she]155-nella found it hard to realize that there were other regions where gold was useless and law without power . Twenty - four hours ago [she]155-nella would have declared it impossible that such an experience as [she]155-nella had suffered could happen to [anyone]415-anyone ; [she]155-nella would have talked airily about civilization and the nineteenth century , and progress and [the police]673-the police . But [her]155-nella experience was teaching [her]155-nella that human nature remains always the same , and that beneath the thin crust of security on which [[we]1035-we good citizens]1036-we good citizens exist the dark and secret forces of crime continue to move , just as [they]1037-they did in the days when [you]1038-you could n't go from [Cheapside]57-cheapside to [Chelsea]58-chelsea without being set upon by [thieves]1039-thieves . [Her]155-nella experience was in a fair way to teach [her]155-nella this lesson better than [she]155-nella could have learnt it even in [the bureaux of [the detective police of [Paris]7-paris]1041-the detective police of paris , [London]6-london , and [St Petersburg]14-st petersburg]1040-the bureaux of the detective police of paris , london , and st petersburg .

' Good morning , '[442-the man] [the man]442-the man repeated , and [she]155-nella glanced at [him]442-the man with a sullen , angry gaze .

' [You]442-the man ! '[155-nella] [she]155-nella exclaimed , ' [You]442-the man , [Mr Thomas Jackson]191-mr tom jackson , if that is [your]442-the man name ! Loose [me]155-nella from this chair , and [I]155-nella will talk to [you]442-the man . '[155-nella] [Her]155-nella eyes flashed as [she]155-nella spoke , and the contempt in them added mightily to [her]155-nella beauty . [Mr Thomas Jackson]191-mr tom jackson , otherwise [Jules]147-jules , [erstwhile head waiter at [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]1043-erstwhile head waiter at the grand babylon , considered [himself]442-the man [a connoisseur in feminine loveliness]1045-a connoisseur in feminine loveliness , and the vision of [Nella Racksole]155-nella smote [him]442-the man like an exquisite blow .

' With pleasure , '[442-the man] [he]442-the man replied . ' [I]442-the man had forgotten that to prevent [you]155-nella from falling [I]442-the man had secured [you]155-nella to the chair '[442-the man] ; and with a quick movement [he]442-the man unfastened the band . [Nella]155-nella stood up , quivering with fiery annoyance and scorn .

' Now , '[155-nella] [she]155-nella said , fronting [him]442-the man , ' what is the meaning of this ? '[155-nella]

' [You]155-nella fainted , '[442-the man] [he]442-the man replied imperturbably . ' Perhaps [you]155-nella do n't remember . '[442-the man]

[The man]442-the man offered [her]155-nella a deck - chair with a characteristic gesture . [Nella]155-nella was obliged to acknowledge , in spite of [herself]155-nella , that [the fellow]2768-the fellow had distinction , an air of breeding . [No one]361-no one would have guessed that for twenty years [he]442-the man had been [an h"tel waiter]1049-an h"tel waiter . [His]442-the man long , lithe figure , and easy , careless carriage seemed to be the figure and carriage of [an aristocrat]1050-an aristocrat , and [his]442-the man voice was quiet , restrained , and authoritative .

' That has nothing to do with [my]442-the man being carried off in [this yacht of [yours]442-the man]3020-this yacht of yours . '[442-the man]

' It is not [[my]442-the man yacht]3021-my yacht , '[442-the man] [he]442-the man said , ' but that is a minor detail . As to the more important matter , forgive [me]442-the man that [I]442-the man remind [you]155-nella that only a few hours ago [you]442-the man were threatening [a lady in [[my]442-the man house]3023-my house]3022-a lady in my house with a revolver . '[442-the man]

' Then it was [[your]442-the man house]3024-your house ? '[442-the man]

' Why not ? May [I]442-the man not possess [a house]3025-a house ? '[442-the man] [He]442-the man smiled .

' [I]442-the man must request [you]442-the man to put [the yacht]990-the yacht about at once , instantly , and take [me]442-the man back . '[442-the man] [She]442-the man tried to speak firmly .

' Ah ! '[442-the man] [he]442-the man said , ' [I]442-the man am afraid that 's impossible . [I]442-the man did n't put out to [sea]3027-sea with the intention of returning at once , instantly . '[442-the man] In the last words [he]442-the man gave a faint imitation of [her]442-the man tone .

' When [I]442-the man do get back , '[442-the man] [she]442-the man said , ' when [[my]442-the man father]2751-my father gets to know of this affair , it will be an exceedingly bad day for [you]442-the man , [Mr Jackson]191-mr tom jackson . '[442-the man]

' But supposing [[your]442-the man father]2828-your father does n't hear of it - '[155-nella]

' What ? '[442-the man]

' Supposing [you]442-the man never get back ? '[155-nella]

[He]151-racksole laughed at the fruitless efforts of [the police]673-the police , but [he]151-racksole could not honestly say that [his]151-racksole own efforts had been less barren . Chapter Twelve [ROCCO AND ROOM]197-rocco NO . 111

ON the afternoon of the same day - the interview just described had occurred in the morning - [Racksole]151-racksole was visited by another idea , and [he]151-racksole said to [himself]151-racksole that [he]151-racksole ought to have thought of it before . The conversation with [Mr Sampson Levi]184-mr sampson levi had continued for a considerable time , and [the two men]399-the two men had exchanged various notions , and agreed to meet again , but the theory that [Reginald Dimmock]166-dimmock had probably been [a traitor to [[his]166-dimmock family]1123-his family]1122-a traitor to his family - [a traitor whose repentance had caused [his]166-dimmock death]1124-a traitor whose repentance had caused his death - had not been thoroughly discussed ; the talk had tended rather to Continental politics , with a view to discovering what [princely family]1125-princely family might have an interest in the temporary disappearance of [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen . Now , as [Racksole]151-racksole considered in detail the particular affair of [Reginald Dimmock]166-dimmock , deceased , [he]151-racksole was struck by one point especially , to wit : Why had [Dimmock]166-dimmock and [Jules]147-jules manoeuvred to turn [Nella Racksole]155-nella out of [Room No . 111]1126-room no . 111 on that first night ? That [they]399-the two men had so manoeuvred , that the broken window - pane was not a mere accident , [Racksole]151-racksole felt perfectly sure . [He]151-racksole had felt perfectly sure all along ; but the significance of the facts had not struck [him]151-racksole . It was plain to [him]151-racksole now that there must be something of extraordinary and peculiar importance about [Room No . 111]1126-room no . 111 . After lunch [he]151-racksole wandered quietly [upstairs]1128-upstairs and looked at [Room No . 111]1126-room no . 111 ; that is to say , [he]151-racksole looked at the outside of [it]1126-room no . 111 ; it happened to be occupied , but [the guest]365-the guest was leaving that evening . The thought crossed [his]151-racksole mind that there could be no object in gazing blankly at the outside of [a room]1131-a room ; yet [he]151-racksole gazed ; then [he]151-racksole wandered quickly down again to [the next floor]1132-the next floor , and in passing along [the corridor of that floor]1133-the corridor of that floor [he]151-racksole stopped , and with an involuntary gesture stamped [his]151-racksole foot .

' [Great Scott]170-great scott ! '[151-racksole] [he]151-racksole said , ' [I]151-racksole 've got hold of something - No . 111 is exactly over [the State apartments]2792-the state apartments . '[151-racksole]

[He]151-racksole went to [the bureau]295-the bureau , and issued instructions that [No . 111]198-no . 111 was not to be re - let to [anyone]415-anyone until further orders . At [the bureau]295-the bureau [they]1137-me gave [him]151-racksole [Nella]155-nella 's note , which ran thus :

[Dearest Papa]176-papa , - [I]0-i am going away for a day or two on the trail of a due .

If [I]0-i 'm not back in three days , begin to inquire for [me]1137-me at [Ostend]42-ostend . Till then leave [me]1137-me alone . - [[Your]176-papa sagacious daughter]3127-your sagacious daughter , [NELL]182-nell .[1137-me]

These few words , in [Nella]155-nella 's large scrawling hand , filled one side of the paper . At the bottom was a P.T.O. [He]151-racksole turned over , and read the sentence , underlined , ' P.S. - Keep an eye on [Rocco]197-rocco . '[151-racksole]

' [I]151-racksole wonder what [the little creature]3128-the little creature is up to ? '[151-racksole] [he]151-racksole murmured , as [he]151-racksole tore the letter into small fragments , and threw them into the waste - paper basket .

Then , without any delay , [he]151-racksole took the lift down to [the basement]1138-the basement , with the object of making a preliminary inspection of [Rocco]197-rocco in [[his]197-rocco lair]1139-his lair . [He]151-racksole could scarcely bring [himself]151-racksole to believe that [this suave and stately gentleman]1140-this suave and stately gentleman , [this enthusiast of gastronomy]1141-this enthusiast of gastronomy , was concerned in the machinations of [Jules]147-jules and [other rascals unknown]1142-other rascals unknown . Nevertheless , from habit , [he]151-racksole obeyed [[his]151-racksole daughter]425-his daughter , giving [her]425-his daughter credit for a certain amount of perspicuity and cleverness .

[The kitchens of [the Grand Babylon H"tel]840-the grand babylon h"tel]1144-the kitchens of the grand babylon h"tel are one of the wonders of [Europe]4-europe .

Only three years before the events now under narration [Felix Babylon]153-babylon had had [them]1144-the kitchens of the grand babylon h"tel newly installed with every device and patent that the ingenuity of [two continents]1146-two continents could supply . [They]1144-the kitchens of the grand babylon h"tel covered nearly an acre of superficial space .

[They]1144-the kitchens of the grand babylon h"tel were walled and floored from end to end with tiles and marble , which enabled them to be washed down every morning like the deck of [a man - of - war]1147-a man - of - war .

[Visitors]1148-visitors were sometimes taken to see the potato - paring machine , the patent plate - dryer , the [Babylon]153-babylon - spit a contrivance of [Felix Babylon]153-babylon 's own , the silver - grill , the system of connected stock - pots , and other amazing phenomena of [the department]1149-the department . Sometimes , if [they]1148-visitors were fortunate , [they]1148-visitors might also see [the artist who sculptured ice into forms of [men]719-men and beasts for table ornaments , or the first napkin - folder in [London]6-london]1150-the artist who sculptured ice into forms of men and beasts for table ornaments , or the first napkin - folder in london , or [the man who daily invented fresh designs for pastry and blancmanges]1152-the man who daily invented fresh designs for pastry and blancmanges . [Twelve chefs]1153-twelve chefs pursued [their]1153-twelve chefs labours in [those kitchens]1154-those kitchens , helped by [ninety assistant chefs]1155-ninety assistant chefs , and [a further army of [unconsidered menials]1157-unconsidered menials]1156-a further army of unconsidered menials . Over all these was [Rocco]197-rocco , supreme and unapproachable . Half - way along [the suite of kitchens]1158-the suite of kitchens , [Rocco]197-rocco had [an apartment of [his]197-rocco own]1159-an apartment of his own , wherein [he]197-rocco thought out those magnificent combinations , those marvellous feats of succulence and originality , which had given [him]197-rocco [his]197-rocco fame . [Visitors]1148-visitors never caught a glimpse of [Rocco]197-rocco in [the kitchens]1161-the kitchens , though sometimes , on a special night , [he]197-rocco would stroll nonchalantly through [the dining - room]2501-the dining - room , like [the great man [he]197-rocco was]1163-the great man he was , to receive the compliments of [the h"tel habitués]1164-the h"tel habitués - people of insight who recognized [his]197-rocco uniqueness .

[Theodore Racksole]151-racksole 's sudden and unusual appearance in [the kitchen]538-the kitchen caused a little stir . [He]151-racksole nodded to [some of [the chefs]1167-the chefs]1166-some of the chefs , but said nothing to [anyone]415-anyone , merely wandering about amid the maze of copper utensils , and white - capped [workers]1169-workers . At length [he]151-racksole saw [Rocco]197-rocco , surrounded by [several admiring chefs]1170-several admiring chefs . [Rocco]197-rocco was bending over a freshly - roasted partridge which lay on a blue dish . [He]197-rocco plunged a long fork into the back of the bird , and raised it in the air with [his]197-rocco left hand . In [his]197-rocco right [he]197-rocco held a long glittering carving - knife . [He]197-rocco was giving one of [his]197-rocco world - famous exhibitions of carving . In four swift , unerring , delicate , perfect strokes [he]197-rocco cleanly severed the limbs of the partridge . It was a wonderful achievement - how wondrous none but [the really skilful carver]1171-the really skilful carver can properly appreciate . [The chefs]1167-the chefs emitted a hum of applause , and [Rocco]197-rocco , long , lean , and graceful , retired to [[his]197-rocco own apartment]1173-his own apartment . [Racksole]151-racksole followed [him]197-rocco . [Rocco]197-rocco sat in a chair , one hand over [his]197-rocco eyes ; [he]197-rocco had not noticed [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole .

' What are [you]199-rocco doing , [M. Rocco]199-rocco ? '[414-the millionaire] [the millionaire]414-the millionaire asked smiling . ' Ah ! '[199-rocco] exclaimed [Rocco]199-rocco , starting up with an apology . ' Pardon ! [I]199-rocco was inventing a new mayonnaise , which [I]199-rocco shall need for a certain menu next week . '[199-rocco]

' Do [you]199-rocco invent these things without materials , then ? '[151-racksole] questioned [Racksole]151-racksole .

' Certainly . [I]199-rocco do dem in [my]199-rocco mind . [I]199-rocco tink dem . Why should [I]199-rocco want materials ? [I]199-rocco know all flavours . [I]199-rocco tink , and tink , and tink , and it is done . [I]199-rocco write down .[199-rocco]

[I]0-i give the recipe to [[my]0-i best chef]1175-my best chef - dere [you]151-racksole are . [I]0-i need not even taste , [I]0-i know how it will taste . It is like composing music . [De great composers]1176-de great composers do not compose at de piano . '[1176-de great composers]

' [I]151-racksole see , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole .

' It is because [I]199-rocco work like dat dat [you]151-racksole pay [me]199-rocco three thousand a year , '[199-rocco] [Rocco]199-rocco added gravely .

' Heard about [Jules]147-jules ? '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole abruptly .

' [Jules]147-jules ? '[151-racksole]

' Yes . [He]147-jules 's been arrested in [Ostend]42-ostend , '[414-the millionaire] [the millionaire]414-the millionaire continued , lying cleverly at a venture . ' [They]3129-they say that [he]147-jules and [several others]3130-several others are implicated in a murder case - the murder of [Reginald Dimmock]166-dimmock . '[414-the millionaire]

' Truly ? '[199-rocco] drawled [Rocco]199-rocco , scarcely hiding a yawn . [His]199-rocco indifference was so superb , so gorgeous , that [Racksole]151-racksole instantly divined that it was assumed for the occasion .

' It seems that , after all , [the police]673-the police are good for something . But this is the first time [I]151-racksole ever knew [them]673-the police to be worth [their]673-the police salt . ' [I]151-racksole have mentioned it to [you]199-rocco to warn [you]199-rocco that so far as [you]199-rocco are concerned the search is of course merely a matter of form .
