' Certainly not , '[199-rocco] and [Rocco]199-rocco shrugged [his]199-rocco shoulders .

' [I]151-racksole shall ask [you]199-rocco to say nothing about this to [anyone]415-anyone , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole . ' The news of [Jules]147-jules '[151-racksole] arrest is quite private to [myself]0-i . The papers know nothing of it . [You]151-racksole comprehend ? '[151-racksole]

[Rocco]199-rocco smiled in [his]199-rocco grand manner , and [[Rocco]199-rocco 's master]1178-rocco 's master thereupon went away .

[Racksole]151-racksole was very well satisfied with the little conversation . It was perhaps dangerous to tell a series of mere lies to [a clever fellow like [Rocco]199-rocco]1179-a clever fellow like rocco , and [Racksole]151-racksole wondered how [he]151-racksole should ultimately explain [them]1180-them to [this great master - chef]1181-this great master - chef if [his]199-rocco and [Nella]155-nella 's suspicions should be unfounded , and nothing came of them . Nevertheless , [Rocco]199-rocco 's manner , a strange elusive something in [the man]442-the man 's eyes , had nearly convinced [Racksole]151-racksole that [he]199-rocco was somehow implicated in [Jules]147-jules ' schemes - and probably in the death of [Reginald Dimmock]166-dimmock and the disappearance of [Prince Eugen of Posen]180-prince eugen .[199-rocco]

That night , or rather about half - past one the next morning , when the last noises of the h"tel 's life had died down , [Racksole]151-racksole made [his]151-racksole way to [Room 111 on the second floor]1183-room 111 on the second floor . [He]151-racksole locked the door on the inside , and proceeded to examine [the place]291-the place , square foot by square foot . Every now and then some creak or other sound startled [him]151-racksole , and [he]151-racksole listened intently for a few seconds . [The bedroom]1185-the bedroom was furnished in the ordinary splendid style of [bedrooms at [the Grand Babylon H"tel]840-the grand babylon h"tel]1186-bedrooms at the grand babylon h"tel , and in that respect called for no remark . What most interested [Racksole]151-racksole was the flooring . [He]151-racksole pulled up the thick Oriental carpet , and peered along every plank , but could discover nothing unusual .

Then [he]151-racksole went to [the dressing - room]2686-the dressing - room , and finally to [the bathroom]1189-the bathroom , both of which opened out of [the main room]1190-the main room . But in [neither of [these smaller chambers]1192-these smaller chambers]1191-neither of these smaller chambers was [he]151-racksole any more successful than in [the bedroom]1185-the bedroom itself . Finally [he]151-racksole came to the bath , which was enclosed in a panelled casing of polished wood , after the manner of [baths]1194-baths . [Some baths]1195-some baths have a cupboard beneath the taps , with a door at the side , but this one appeared to have none . [He]151-racksole tapped the panels , but not a single one of them gave forth that ' curious hollow sound '[151-racksole] which usually betokens [a secret place]1196-a secret place . Idly [he]151-racksole turned the cold - tap of [the bath]1197-the bath , and the water began to rush in . [He]151-racksole turned off the cold - tap and turned on the waste - tap , and as [he]151-racksole did so [his]151-racksole knee , which was pressing against the panelling , slipped forward . The panelling had given way , and [he]151-racksole saw that one large panel was hinged from the inside , and caught with a hasp , also on the inside . A large space within the casing of the end of [the bath]1197-the bath was thus revealed . Before doing anything else , [Racksole]151-racksole tried to repeat the trick with the waste - tap , but [he]151-racksole failed ; it would not work again , nor could [he]151-racksole in any way perceive that there was any connection between the rod of the waste - tap and the hasp of the panel . [Racksole]151-racksole could not see into the cavity within the casing , and the electric light was fixed , and could not be moved about like a candle . [He]151-racksole felt in [his]151-racksole pockets , and fortunately discovered a box of matches . Aided by these , [he]151-racksole looked into [the cavity]1199-the cavity , and saw nothing ; nothing except a rather large hole at the far end - some three feet from the casing . With some difficulty [he]151-racksole squeezed [himself]151-racksole through the open panel , and took a half - kneeling , half - sitting posture within . There [he]151-racksole struck a match , and it was a most unfortunate thing that in striking , the box being half open , [he]151-racksole set fire to all the matches , and was half smothered in the atrocious stink of phosphorus which resulted . One match burned clear on the floor of the cavity , and , rubbing [his]151-racksole eyes , [Racksole]151-racksole picked it up , and looked down the hole which [he]151-racksole had previously descried . It was a hole apparently bottomless , and about eighteen inches square . The curious part about the hole was that a rope - ladder hung down it . When [he]151-racksole saw that rope - ladder [Racksole]151-racksole smiled the smile of [a happy man]1200-a happy man .

The match went out .

Should [he]151-racksole make a long journey , perhaps to [some distant corner of [the h"tel]340-the h"tel]1201-some distant corner of the h"tel , for a fresh box of matches , or should [he]151-racksole attempt to descend that rope - ladder in the dark ? [He]151-racksole decided on the latter course , and [he]151-racksole was the more strongly moved thereto as [he]151-racksole could now distinguish a faint , a very faint tinge of light at the bottom of the hole .

With infinite care [he]151-racksole compressed [himself]151-racksole into the well - like hole , and descended the latter . At length [he]151-racksole arrived on firm ground , perspiring , but quite safe and quite excited . [He]151-racksole saw now that the tinge of light came through a small hole in the wood . [He]151-racksole put [his]151-racksole eye to the wood , and found that [he]151-racksole had a fine view of [the State bathroom]1203-the state bathroom , and through the door of [the State bathroom]1203-the state bathroom into [the State bedroom]1205-the state bedroom . At [the massive marble - topped washstand in [the State bedroom]1205-the state bedroom]1206-the massive marble - topped washstand in the state bedroom [a man]2659-a man was visible , bending over some object which lay thereon .

[The man]442-the man was [Rocco]199-rocco !

Chapter Thirteen IN [THE STATE BEDROOM]1205-the state bedroom

IT was of course plain to [Racksole]151-racksole that [the peculiar passageway which [he]151-racksole had , at great personal inconvenience , discovered between [the bathroom of No . 111]1212-the bathroom of no . 111 and [the State bathroom on the floor below]1213-the state bathroom on the floor below]1211-the peculiar passageway which he had , at great personal inconvenience , discovered between the bathroom of no . 111 and the state bathroom on the floor below must have been specially designed by [some person]1214-some person or [persons]1215-persons for the purpose of keeping a nefarious watch upon [the occupants of [the State suite of apartments]1217-the state suite of apartments]1216-the occupants of the state suite of apartments . It was a means of communication at once simple and ingenious . At that moment [he]151-racksole could not be sure of the precise method employed for it , but [he]151-racksole surmised that the casing of the waterpipes had been used as a ' well '[151-racksole] , while space for the pipes themselves had been found in the thickness of the ample brick walls of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon . The eye - hole , through which [he]151-racksole now had a view of [the bedroom]1185-the bedroom , was a very minute one , and probably would scarcely be noticed from the exterior . One thing [he]151-racksole observed concerning it , namely , that it had been made for [a man somewhat taller than [himself]151-racksole]1220-a man somewhat taller than himself ; [he]151-racksole was obliged to stand on tiptoe in order to get [his]151-racksole eye in the correct position . [He]151-racksole remembered that both [Jules]147-jules and [Rocco]199-rocco were distinctly above the average height ; also that [they]1221-they were [both thin men]1222-both thin men , and could have descended the well with comparative ease . [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole , though not stout , was [a well - set man with large bones]1223-a well - set man with large bones .

These things flashed through [his]151-racksole mind as [he]151-racksole gazed , spellbound , at the mysterious movements of [Rocco]199-rocco . The door between [the bathroom]1189-the bathroom and [the bedroom]1185-the bedroom was wide open , and [his]151-racksole own situation was such that [his]151-racksole view embraced a considerable portion of [the bedroom]1185-the bedroom , including the whole of [the immense and gorgeously - upholstered bedstead]1227-the immense and gorgeously - upholstered bedstead , but not including the whole of [the marble washstand]1228-the marble washstand . [He]151-racksole could see only half of [the washstand]1229-the washstand , and at intervals [Rocco]199-rocco passed out of sight as [his]199-rocco lithe hands moved over the object which lay on the marble . At first [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole could not decide what this object was , but after a time , as [his]151-racksole eyes grew accustomed to the position and the light , [he]151-racksole made it out .

It was the body of [a man]2659-a man . Or , rather , to be more exact , [Racksole]151-racksole could discern the legs of [a man on that half of the table which was visible to [him]151-racksole]1231-a man on that half of the table which was visible to him . Involuntarily [he]151-racksole shuddered , as the conviction forced itself upon [him]151-racksole that [Rocco]199-rocco had [some unconscious human being helpless on that cold marble surface]1232-some unconscious human being helpless on that cold marble surface . The legs never moved . Therefore , [the hapless creature]1233-the hapless creature was either asleep or under the influence of an anaesthetic - or horrible thought ! dead .

[Racksole]151-racksole wanted to call out , to stop by some means or other the dreadful midnight activity which was proceeding before [his]151-racksole astonished eyes ; but fortunately [he]151-racksole restrained [himself]151-racksole .

On the washstand [he]151-racksole could see certain strangely - shaped utensils and instruments which [Rocco]199-rocco used from time to time . The work seemed to [Racksole]151-racksole to continue for interminable hours , and then at last [Rocco]199-rocco ceased , gave a sign of satisfaction , whistled several bars from ' Cavalleria Rusticana '[199-rocco] , and came into [the bath - room]2687-the bath - room , where [he]199-rocco took off [his]199-rocco coat , and very quietly washed [his]199-rocco hands . As [he]199-rocco stood calmly and leisurely wiping those long fingers of [his]199-rocco , [he]199-rocco was less than four feet from [Racksole]151-racksole , and [the cooped - up millionaire]1235-the cooped - up millionaire trembled , holding [his]1235-the cooped - up millionaire breath , lest [Rocco]199-rocco should detect [his]1235-the cooped - up millionaire presence behind the woodwork . But nothing happened , and [Rocco]199-rocco returned unsuspectingly to [the bedroom]1185-the bedroom . [Racksole]151-racksole saw [him]1235-the cooped - up millionaire place some sort of white flannel garment over the prone form on the table , and then lift [it]1237-it bodily on to the great bed , where it lay awfully still . [The hidden watcher]1238-the hidden watcher was sure now that it was a corpse upon which [Rocco]199-rocco had been exercising [his]199-rocco mysterious and sinister functions .

But whose corpse ? And what functions ? Could this be a [West End h"tel]63-west end h"tel , [[Racksole]151-racksole 's own h"tel]151-racksole , in [the very heart of [London]6-london]1239-the very heart of london , [the best - policed city in [the world]311-the world]1240-the best - policed city in the world ? It seemed incredible , impossible ; yet so it was . Once more [he]151-racksole remembered what [Felix Babylon]153-babylon had said to [him]151-racksole and realized the truth of the saying anew . [The proprietor of [a vast and complicated establishment like [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]1243-a vast and complicated establishment like the grand babylon]1242-the proprietor of a vast and complicated establishment like the grand babylon could never know a tithe of the extraordinary and queer occurrences which happened daily under [his]1242-the proprietor of a vast and complicated establishment like the grand babylon very nose ; the atmosphere of [such a caravanserai]1245-such a caravanserai must necessarily be an atmosphere of mystery and problems apparently inexplicable . Nevertheless , [Racksole]151-racksole thought that [Fate]200-fate was carrying things with rather a high hand when [she]1246-she permitted [[his]151-racksole chef]1247-his chef to spend the night hours over [a man]2659-a man 's corpse in [[his]151-racksole State bedroom]1249-his state bedroom , [this sacred apartment which was supposed to be occupied only by [individuals of Royal Blood]1251-individuals of royal blood]1250-this sacred apartment which was supposed to be occupied only by individuals of royal blood . [Racksole]151-racksole would not have objected to a certain amount of mystery , but [he]151-racksole decidedly thought that there was a little too much mystery here for [his]151-racksole taste . [He]151-racksole thought that even [Felix Babylon]153-babylon would have been surprised at this .

The electric chandelier in the centre of the ceiling was not lighted ; only the two lights on either side of [the washstand]1229-the washstand were switched on , and these did not sufficiently illuminate the features of [the man on the bed]1253-the man on the bed to enable [Racksole]151-racksole to see them clearly . In vain the millionaire strained [his]151-racksole eyes ; [he]151-racksole could only make out that the corpse was probably that of [a young man]1254-a young man . Just as [he]151-racksole was wondering what would be the best course of action to pursue , [he]151-racksole saw [Rocco]199-rocco with a square - shaped black box in [his]199-rocco hand . Then [the chef]1255-the chef switched off the two electric lights , and [the State bedroom]1205-the state bedroom was in darkness . In that swift darkness [Racksole]151-racksole heard [Rocco]199-rocco spring on to the bed . Another half - dozen moments of suspense , and there was a blinding flash of white , which endured for several seconds , and showed [Rocco]199-rocco standing like an evil spirit over the corpse , the black box in one hand and a burning piece of aluminium wire in the other . The aluminium wire burnt out , and darkness followed blacker than before .

[Rocco]199-rocco had photographed the corpse by flashlight .

But the dazzling flare which had disclosed the features of [the dead man to the insensible lens of the camera]1257-the dead man to the insensible lens of the camera had disclosed them also to [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole . [The dead man]1258-the dead man was [Reginald Dimmock]166-dimmock !

Stung into action by this discovery , [Racksole]151-racksole tried to find the exit from [[his]151-racksole place of concealment]1259-his place of concealment . [He]151-racksole felt sure that there existed some way out into [the State bathroom]1203-the state bathroom , but [he]151-racksole sought for [it]1261-it fruitlessly , groping with both hands and feet . Then [he]151-racksole decided that [he]151-racksole must ascend the rope - ladder , make haste for [the first - floor corridor]1262-the first - floor corridor , and intercept [Rocco]199-rocco when [he]151-racksole left [the State apartments]2792-the state apartments . It was a painful and difficult business to ascend that thin and yielding ladder in such a confined space , but [Racksole]151-racksole was managing it very nicely , and had nearly reached the top , when , by some untoward freak of chance , the ladder broke above [his]151-racksole weight , and [he]151-racksole slipped ignominiously down to the bottom of the wooden tube . Smothering an excusable curse , [Racksole]151-racksole crouched , baffled . Then [he]151-racksole saw that the force of [his]151-racksole fall had somehow opened a trap - door at [his]151-racksole feet . [He]151-racksole squeezed through , pushed open another tiny door , and in another second stood in [the State bathroom]1203-the state bathroom . [He]151-racksole was dishevelled , perspiring , rather bewildered ; but [he]151-racksole was there . In the next second [he]151-racksole had resumed absolute command of all [his]151-racksole faculties .

Strange to say , [he]151-racksole had moved so quietly that [Rocco]199-rocco had apparently not heard [him]151-racksole . [He]151-racksole stepped noiselessly to the door between [the bathroom]1189-the bathroom and [the bedroom]1185-the bedroom , and stood there in silence . [Rocco]199-rocco had switched on again the lights over [the washstand]1229-the washstand and was busy with [his]199-rocco utensils .

[Racksole]151-racksole deliberately coughed .

Chapter Fourteen [ROCCO]199-rocco ANSWERS SOME QUESTIONS

[ROCCO]199-rocco turned round with the swiftness of a startled tiger , and gave [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole one long piercing glance .

' D - n ! '[199-rocco] said [Rocco]199-rocco , with as pure an Anglo - Saxon accent and intonation as [Racksole]151-racksole [himself]151-racksole could have accomplished .

The most extraordinary thing about the situation was that at this juncture [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole did not know what to say . [He]151-racksole was so dumbfounded by the affair , and especially by [Rocco]199-rocco 's absolute and sublime calm , that both speech and thought failed [him]151-racksole .

' [I]199-rocco give in , '[199-rocco] said [Rocco]199-rocco . ' From the moment [you]151-racksole entered [this cursed h"tel]3135-this cursed h"tel [I]199-rocco was afraid of [you]151-racksole . [I]199-rocco told [Jules]147-jules [I]199-rocco was afraid of [you]151-racksole . [I]199-rocco knew there would be trouble with [a man of [your]151-racksole kidney]3136-a man of your kidney , and [I]199-rocco was right ; confound it ! [I]199-rocco tell [you]151-racksole [I]199-rocco give in . [I]199-rocco know when [I]199-rocco 'm[199-rocco] beaten . [I]0-i 've got no revolver and no weapons of any kind . [I]0-i surrender . Do what [you]1268-you like . '[1268-you]

And with that [Rocco]199-rocco sat down on a chair . It was magnificently done . Only [a truly great man]1269-a truly great man could have done it . [Rocco]199-rocco actually kept [his]199-rocco dignity .

For answer , [Racksole]151-racksole walked slowly into [the vast apartment]1270-the vast apartment , seized a chair , and , dragging it up to [Rocco]199-rocco 's chair , sat down opposite to [him]199-rocco . Thus [they]1271-they faced [each other]400-each other , [their]1271-they knees almost touching , both in evening dress . On [Rocco]199-rocco 's right hand was the bed , with the corpse of [Reginald Dimmock]166-dimmock . On [Racksole]151-racksole 's right hand , and a little behind [him]199-rocco , was the marble washstand , still littered with [Rocco]199-rocco 's implements . The electric light shone on [Rocco]199-rocco 's left cheek , leaving the other side of [his]199-rocco face in shadow . [Racksole]151-racksole tapped [him]199-rocco on the knee twice .

' So [you]0-i 're[151-racksole] [another Englishman masquerading as [a foreigner]2724-a foreigner in [my]0-i h"tel]1273-another englishman masquerading as a foreigner in my h"tel , '[151-racksole]

[Racksole]151-racksole remarked , by way of commencing the interrogation .

' [I]151-racksole 'm[151-racksole] not , ' answered [Rocco]199-rocco quietly . '[0-i] [I]0-i 'm [a citizen of [the United States]310-the united states]3137-a citizen of the united states . '[151-racksole]

' The deuce [you]0-i are ! '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole exclaimed .

' Yes , [I]151-racksole was born at [West Orange]65-west orange , [New Jersey]66-new jersey , [New York State]67-new york state . '[151-racksole]

' Why was poor little [Dimmock]166-dimmock poisoned ? '[414-the millionaire] [The millionaire]414-the millionaire 's voice softened as [he]151-racksole looked for an instant at the corpse of [the unfortunate young man]1276-the unfortunate young man .

' Do n't question [me]151-racksole , [Mr Rucker]201-elihu p. rucker , '[151-racksole] said [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole . ' [I]151-racksole 've been embalming it . '[151-racksole]

' Em - balming it . '[151-racksole]

' Certainly ; [Richardson]202-richardson 's system of arterial fluid injection , as improved by [myself]151-racksole . [You]201-elihu p. rucker were n't aware that [I]151-racksole included the art of embalming among [my]151-racksole accomplishments . Nevertheless , it is so . '[151-racksole]

' But why ? '[151-racksole] asked [Racksole]151-racksole , more mystified than ever . ' Why should [you]199-rocco trouble to embalm [the poor chap]3150-the poor chap 's corpse ? '[151-racksole]

' Ca n't [you]199-rocco see ? Does n't it strike [you]199-rocco ? That corpse has to be taken care of .[151-racksole]

It contains , or rather , it did contain , very serious evidence against [some person]1214-some person or persons unknown to [the police]673-the police . It may be necessary to move it about from place to place . A corpse ca n't be hidden for long ; a corpse betrays [itself]1279-itself . [One]277-one could n't throw [it]1281-it in [the Thames]1282-the thames , for it would have been found inside twelve hours . [One]277-one could n't bury [it]1281-it - it was n't safe . The only thing was to keep it handy and movable , ready for emergencies . [I]0-i need n't inform [you]1284-you that , without embalming , [you]1284-you ca n't keep a corpse handy and movable for more than four or five days . It 's the kind of thing that wo n't keep . And so it was suggested that [I]0-i should embalm it , and [I]0-i did . Mind [you]1284-you , [I]0-i still objected to the murder , but [I]0-i could n't go back on [a colleague]1285-a colleague , [you]1284-you understand . [You]1284-you do understand that , do n't [you]1284-you ? Well , here [you]1284-you are , and here it is , and that 's all . '[1284-you]

[Rocco]199-rocco leaned back in [his]199-rocco chair as though [he]199-rocco had said everything that ought to be said . [He]199-rocco closed [his]199-rocco eyes to indicate that so far as [he]199-rocco was concerned the conversation was also closed . [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole stood up .

' Where do [you]0-i suppose [you]0-i 'll get a night 's rest ? '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole asked .

' In [the cells]3152-the cells , of course . Have n't [I]199-rocco told [you]0-i [I]199-rocco know when [I]199-rocco 'm[199-rocco] beaten . '[151-racksole] [He]151-racksole pointed , with a strange , scornful gesture of [his]151-racksole elbow , to the bed . ' And now , shall [we]3154-we go ? '[151-racksole]

' Well ? '[199-rocco] [Rocco]199-rocco murmured , with an air of tired resignation , as if to say , ' What must be must be . '[199-rocco]

' Where has [Dimmock]166-dimmock 's corpse been during the last three or four days , since [he]166-dimmock - died ? '[151-racksole]

' Oh ! '[199-rocco] answered [Rocco]199-rocco , apparently surprised at the simplicity of the question . ' It 's been in [[my]199-rocco room]2645-my room , and one night it was on the roof ; once it went out of [the h"tel]340-the h"tel as luggage , but it came back the next day as a case of Demerara sugar . [I]199-rocco forgot where else it has been , but it 's been kept perfectly safe and treated with every consideration . '[199-rocco]

' And who contrived all these manoeuvres ? '[151-racksole] asked [Racksole]151-racksole as calmly as [he]151-racksole could .

' [I]199-rocco did . That is to say , [I]199-rocco invented them and [I]199-rocco saw that they were carried out . [You]151-racksole see , the suspicions of [[your]151-racksole police]3162-your police obliged [me]199-rocco to be particularly spry . '[199-rocco]

' And who carried them out ? '[151-racksole]

' Ah ! that would be telling tales . But [I]199-rocco do n't mind assuring [you]151-racksole that [[my]199-rocco accomplices]3163-my accomplices were [innocent accomplices]3164-innocent accomplices . It is absurdly easy for [a man like [me]199-rocco]3165-a man like me to impose on [underlings]3166-underlings - absurdly easy . '[199-rocco]

' What did [you]151-racksole intend to do with the corpse ultimately ? '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole pursued [his]151-racksole inquiry with immovable countenance .

' Who knows ? '[199-rocco] said [Rocco]199-rocco , twisting [his]199-rocco beautiful moustache . ' That would have depended on several things - on [[your]151-racksole police]3162-your police , for instance . '[151-racksole]

' Certainly . Do n't [you]151-racksole ? If [you]151-racksole do n't [I]151-racksole need only hint that [Dimmock]166-dimmock had [a Prince]2860-a prince for [[his]166-dimmock father]3173-his father . '[151-racksole]

' It seems to [me]151-racksole , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole , with cold sarcasm , ' that [you]151-racksole behaved rather clumsily in choosing [this bedroom]3174-this bedroom as the scene of [your]151-racksole operations . '[151-racksole]

' [I]151-racksole guessed , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole succinctly .

' [You]151-racksole were not afraid of a search ? '[199-rocco]

' [I]151-racksole knew that no search was intended . [I]151-racksole knew that [you]151-racksole were trying to frighten [me]151-racksole . [Rocco]199-rocco rose and moved towards the door . With an instinctive action [Racksole]151-racksole rushed forward and seized [him]199-rocco by the shoulder .

[Racksole]151-racksole was distinctly and notably impressed by [this man]827-this man - by [this master spirit to whom [he]827-this man was to have paid a salary at the rate of three thousand pounds a year]1294-this master spirit to whom he was to have paid a salary at the rate of three thousand pounds a year . ' Good - bye , [Mr Racksole]151-racksole , '[199-rocco] [he]199-rocco remarked suavely , bowing again , lower than before . And with that [Rocco]199-rocco , without hastening , walked down [the corridor]790-the corridor and so out of sight .

[Racksole]151-racksole said never a word . [He]151-racksole was too disgusted with [himself]151-racksole to speak . [He]151-racksole clenched [his]151-racksole fists , and put [his]151-racksole teeth together , and held [his]151-racksole breath . In the silence [he]151-racksole could hear the dwindling sound of [Rocco]199-rocco 's footsteps on the thick carpet .

It was the greatest blow of [Racksole]151-racksole 's life .

The next morning [the high - born guests of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]1305-the high - born guests of the grand babylon were aroused by a rumour that by some accident [the millionaire proprietor of [the h"tel]340-the h"tel]1307-the millionaire proprietor of the h"tel had remained all night locked up m [the lift]855-the lift . [A duchess]1312-a duchess said that [Rocco]199-rocco 's departure would mean the ruin of [the h"tel]340-the h"tel , whereupon [[her]1312-a duchess husband]3048-her husband advised [her]1312-a duchess not to talk nonsense .

As for [Racksole]151-racksole , [he]151-racksole sent a message for [the detective in charge of the Dimmock affair]1315-the detective in charge of the dimmock affair , and bravely told [him]1315-the detective in charge of the dimmock affair the happenings of the previous night .

[Racksole]151-racksole said nothing .

' [I]1317-the detective [myself]1317-the detective have a clue , '[1317-the detective] added [the detective]1317-the detective . ' With pleasure , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole .

In ten minutes [he]151-racksole was on [his]151-racksole way to [Victoria Station]70-victoria station .

Chapter Fifteen END OF [THE YACHT ADVENTURE]1320-the yacht adventure

[WE]1321-we must now return to [Nella Racksole]155-nella and [Prince Aribert of Posen]167-aribert on board [the yacht]990-the yacht without a name . [The Prince]2578-the prince 's first business was to make [Jules]147-jules , otherwise [Mr Tom Jackson]191-mr tom jackson , perfectly secure by means of several pieces of rope . Although [Mr Jackson]191-mr tom jackson had been stunned into a complete unconsciousness , and there was a contused wound under [his]191-mr tom jackson ear , [no one]361-no one could say how soon [he]191-mr tom jackson might not come to [himself]191-mr tom jackson and get very violent . So [the Prince]2578-the prince , having tied [his]191-mr tom jackson arms and legs , made [him]191-mr tom jackson fast to a stanchion .

' [I]155-nella hope [he]191-mr tom jackson wo n't die , '[155-nella] said [Nella]155-nella . ' [He]191-mr tom jackson looks very white . '[155-nella]

' [The Mr Jacksons of [this world]3200-this world]3199-the mr jacksons of this world , '[167-aribert] said [Prince Aribert]167-aribert sententiously , ' never die till [they]3199-the mr jacksons of this world are hung . By the way , [I]167-aribert wonder how it is that [no one]361-no one has interfered with [us]1329-us . Perhaps [they]3199-the mr jacksons of this world are discreetly afraid of [my]167-aribert revolver - of [your]155-nella revolver , [I]167-aribert mean . '[167-aribert]

Both [he]167-aribert and [Nella]155-nella glanced up at [the imperturbable steersman , who kept [the yacht]990-the yacht 's head straight out to [sea]3027-sea]1326-the imperturbable steersman , who kept the yacht 's head straight out to sea . By this time [they]1329-us were about a couple of miles from [the Belgian shore]1330-the belgian shore .

Addressing [him]1326-the imperturbable steersman , who kept the yacht 's head straight out to sea in French , [the Prince]2578-the prince ordered [the sailor]1332-the sailor to put [the yacht]990-the yacht about , and make again for [Ostend Harbour]49-ostend harbour , but [the fellow]2768-the fellow took no notice whatever of the summons . [The Prince]167-aribert raised the revolver , with the idea of frightening [the steersman]1335-the steersman , and then [the man]442-the man began to talk rapidly in a mixture of French and Flemish . [He]442-the man said that [he]442-the man had received [Jules]147-jules ' strict orders not to interfere in any way , no matter what might happen on the deck of [the yacht]990-the yacht . [He]442-the man was [the captain of [the yacht]990-the yacht]3203-the captain of the yacht , and [he]442-the man had to make for [a certain English port]3205-a certain english port , the name of which [he]442-the man could not divulge : [he]442-the man was to keep [the vessel]991-the vessel at full steam ahead under any and all circumstances . [He]442-the man seemed to be a very big , a very strong , and [a very determined man]3207-a very determined man , and [the Prince]2578-the prince was at a loss what course of action to pursue . [He]2578-the prince asked several more questions , but the only effect of them was to render [the man]442-the man taciturn and ill - humoured .[442-the man]

In vain [Prince Aribert]167-aribert explained that [Miss Nella Racksole]155-nella , [daughter of [millionaire Racksole]155-nella]1337-daughter of millionaire racksole , had been abducted by [Mr Tom Jackson]191-mr tom jackson ; in vain [he]191-mr tom jackson flourished the revolver threateningly ; [the surly but courageous captain]1338-the surly but courageous captain said merely that that had nothing to do with [him]191-mr tom jackson ; [he]191-mr tom jackson had instructions , and [he]191-mr tom jackson should carry them out . [He]167-aribert sarcastically begged to remind [[his]167-aribert interlocutor]1339-his interlocutor that [he]191-mr tom jackson was [the captain of [the yacht]990-the yacht]3203-the captain of the yacht .

' It wo n't do to shoot [him]442-the man , [I]2578-the prince suppose , '[2578-the prince] said [the Prince]2578-the prince to [Nella]155-nella . ' [I]2578-the prince might bore a hole into [his]442-the man leg , or something of that kind . '[2578-the prince]

' It 's rather risky , and rather hard on [the poor captain]3210-the poor captain , with [his]3210-the poor captain extraordinary sense of duty , '[155-nella] said [Nella]155-nella . ' [I]2578-the prince wonder where [the crew]3213-the crew is , '[2578-the prince] said [the Prince]2578-the prince .

Just then [Mr Jackson]191-mr tom jackson , prone and bound on [the deck]1062-the deck , showed signs of recovering from [his]191-mr tom jackson swoon . [His]191-mr tom jackson eyes opened , and [he]191-mr tom jackson gazed vacantly around . ' See here ! '[2578-the prince] replied [the Prince]2578-the prince , ' [I]2578-the prince do n't want to have any arguments , but [this yacht]3214-this yacht must return to [Ostend]42-ostend at once , where [you]167-aribert will be given up to [the authorities]3215-the authorities . '[2578-the prince]

' Really ! '[191-mr tom jackson] snarled [Mr Tom Jackson]191-mr tom jackson . ' Shall [I]191-mr tom jackson ! '[191-mr tom jackson] Then [he]191-mr tom jackson called out in French to [the man at the wheel]994-the man at the wheel , ' [Hi André]206-hi andré ! let [these two]533-these two be put off in [the dinghy]1061-the dinghy . '[191-mr tom jackson]

It was a peculiar situation . Certain of nothing but the possession of [Nella]155-nella 's revolver , [the Prince]2578-the prince scarcely knew whether to carry the argument further , and with stronger measures , or to accept the situation with as much dignity as the circumstances would permit .

' Let [us]533-these two take [the dinghy]1061-the dinghy , '[155-nella] said [Nella]155-nella ; ' [we]533-these two can row [ashore]3219-ashore in an hour . '[155-nella]

[He]2578-the prince felt that [she]155-nella was right . To leave [the yacht]990-the yacht in such a manner seemed somewhat ignominious , and it certainly involved the escape of [that profound villain]1349-that profound villain , [Mr Thomas Jackson]191-mr tom jackson . But what else could be done ? [The Prince]2578-the prince and [Nella]155-nella constituted [one party on [the vessel]991-the vessel]1351-one party on the vessel ; [they]1353-they knew [their]1353-they own strength , but [they]1353-they did not know the strength of [[their]1353-they opponents]1354-their opponents . [They]1353-they held [the hostile ringleader]1355-the hostile ringleader bound and captive , but [this man]827-this man had proved [himself]827-this man capable of giving orders , and even to gag [him]827-this man would not help [them]1353-they if [the captain of [the yacht]990-the yacht]3203-the captain of the yacht persisted in [his]3203-the captain of the yacht obstinate course . Moreover , there was a distinct objection to promiscuous shooting ; [the Prince]2578-the prince felt that ; there was no knowing how promiscuous shooting might end .

' [We]1353-they will take [the dinghy]1061-the dinghy , '[2578-the prince] said [the Prince]2578-the prince quickly , to [the captain]1361-the captain .

A bell rang below , and [a sailor]1362-a sailor and [the Negro boy]1363-the negro boy appeared on [deck]888-deck . The pulsations of the screw grew less rapid . [The yacht]990-the yacht stopped . [The dinghy]1061-the dinghy was lowered . As [the Prince]2578-the prince and [Nella]155-nella prepared to descend into [the little cock - boat]1368-the little cock - boat [Mr Tom Jackson]191-mr tom jackson addressed [Nella]155-nella , all bound as [he]191-mr tom jackson lay .

' Good - bye , '[191-mr tom jackson] [he]191-mr tom jackson said , ' [I]191-mr tom jackson shall see [you]155-nella again , never fear . '[191-mr tom jackson] .

In another moment [they]1369-they were in [the dinghy]1061-the dinghy , and [the dinghy]1061-the dinghy was adrift . [The yacht]990-the yacht 's screw chumed the water , and [the beautiful vessel]1373-the beautiful vessel slipped away from [them]1369-they . As it receded [a figure]1060-a figure appeared at the stem . It was [Mr Thomas Jackson]191-mr tom jackson .

[He]191-mr tom jackson had been released by [[his]191-mr tom jackson minions]1375-his minions . [He]191-mr tom jackson held a white handkerchief to [his]191-mr tom jackson ear , and offered a calm , enigmatic smile to [the two forlorn but victorious occupants of [the dinghy]1061-the dinghy]1376-the two forlorn but victorious occupants of the dinghy . [Jules]147-jules had been defeated for once in [his]147-jules life ; or perhaps it would be more just to say that [he]147-jules had been out - manoeuvred . [Men like [Jules]147-jules]1378-men like jules are incapable of being defeated . It was characteristic of [his]147-jules luck that now , in the very hour when [he]147-jules had been caught red - handed in a serious crime against society , [he]147-jules should be effecting a leisurely escape - an escape which left no clue behind .

[The sea]1012-the sea was utterly calm and blue in the morning sun . [The dinghy]1061-the dinghy rocked itself lazily in the swell of [the yacht]990-the yacht 's departure . As the mist cleared away the outline of [the shore]1382-the shore became more distinct , and it appeared as if [Ostend]42-ostend was distant scarcely a cable 's length . The white dome of the great Kursaal glittered in the pale turquoise sky , and the smoke of steamers in [the harbour]1383-the harbour could be plainly distinguished . On the offing was [a crowd of brown - sailed fishing luggers returning with the night 's catch]1384-a crowd of brown - sailed fishing luggers returning with the night 's catch . The many - hued bathing - vans could be counted on [the distant beach]1385-the distant beach . Everything seemed perfectly normal . It was difficult for either [Nella]155-nella or [[her]155-nella companion]648-her companion to realize that anything extraordinary had happened within the last hour . Yet there was [the yacht]990-the yacht , not a mile off , to prove to [them]1388-them that something very extraordinary had , in fact , happened . [The yacht]990-the yacht was no vision , nor was [that sinister watching figure at its stern]1390-that sinister watching figure at its stern a vision , either .

' [I]2578-the prince suppose [Jules]147-jules was too surprised and too feeble to inquire how [I]2578-the prince came to be on board [[his]147-jules yacht]3221-his yacht , '[2578-the prince] said [the Prince]2578-the prince , taking the oars .

' Oh ! How did [you]2578-the prince ? '[155-nella] asked [Nella]155-nella , [her]155-nella face lighting up . ' Really , [I]155-nella had almost forgotten that part of the affair . '[155-nella]

' [I]2578-the prince must begin at the beginning and it will take some time , '[2578-the prince] answered [the Prince]2578-the prince . ' Had [we]3222-we not better postpone the recital till [we]3222-we get [ashore]3219-ashore ? '[2578-the prince]

' [I]155-nella will row and [you]2578-the prince shall talk , '[155-nella] said [Nella]155-nella . ' [I]155-nella want to know now . '[155-nella]

[He]2578-the prince smiled happily at [her]155-nella , but gently declined to yield up the oars .

' Is it not sufficient that [I]2578-the prince am [here]2493-here ? '[2578-the prince] [he]2578-the prince said .

' It is sufficient , yes , '[155-nella] [she]155-nella replied , ' but [I]155-nella want to know . '[155-nella]

With a long , easy stroke [he]2578-the prince was pulling [the dinghy]1061-the dinghy shorewards . [She]155-nella sat in the stern - sheets .

' There is no rudder , '[2578-the prince] [he]2578-the prince remarked , ' so [you]155-nella must direct [me]2578-the prince . Keep [the boat]3225-the boat 's head on [the lighthouse]3226-the lighthouse . The tide seems to be running in strongly ; that will help [us]3227-us . [The people on shore]3228-the people on shore will think that [we]3227-us have only been for a little early morning excursion . '[2578-the prince]

' Will [you]2578-the prince kindly tell [me]155-nella how it came about that [you]2578-the prince were able to save [my]155-nella life , [Prince]167-aribert ? '[155-nella] [she]155-nella said .

' Save [your]2578-the prince life , [Miss Racksole]155-nella ? [I]2578-the prince did n't save [your]2578-the prince life ; [I]2578-the prince merely knocked [a man]2659-a man down . '[2578-the prince]

' [You]2578-the prince saved [my]155-nella life , '[155-nella] [she]155-nella repeated . ' [That villain]3230-that villain would have stopped at nothing . [I]155-nella saw it in [his]3230-that villain eye . '[155-nella]

' Then [you]2578-the prince were [a brave woman]3231-a brave woman , for [you]2578-the prince showed no fear of death . '[1394-i] [His]1394-i admiring gaze rested full on [her]155-nella . For a moment the oars ceased to move .

[She]155-nella gave a gesture of impatience .

With [his]151-racksole eyes glued on the table , and ears open for every remark , of [the players]1478-the players and [the croupier]1479-the croupier , [he]151-racksole took [his]151-racksole first lesson in roulette . [He]151-racksole saw [a mere youth]1480-a mere youth win fifteen thousand francs , which were stolen in [the most barefaced mariner]1481-the most barefaced mariner by [a rouged girl scarcely older than [the youth]498-the youth]1482-a rouged girl scarcely older than the youth ; [he]151-racksole saw [two old gamesters]1484-two old gamesters stake [their]1484-two old gamesters coins , and lose , and walk quietly out of [the place]291-the place ; [he]151-racksole saw [the bank]1486-the bank win fifty thousand francs at a single turn .

' This is rather good fun , '[151-racksole] [he]151-racksole said at length , ' but the stakes are too small to make it really exciting . [I]151-racksole 'll try [my]151-racksole luck , just for the experience . [I]151-racksole 'm[151-racksole] bound to win . '[151-racksole]

' Why ? '[2578-the prince] asked [the Prince]2578-the prince .

' Because [I]151-racksole always do , in games of chance , '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole answered with gay confidence . ' It is [my]151-racksole fate . Then to - night , [you]3292-you must remember , [I]151-racksole shall be [a beginner]3293-a beginner , and [you]3292-you know [the tyro]3294-the tyro 's luck . '[151-racksole]

In ten minutes the croupier of that table was obliged to suspend operations pending the arrival of a further supply of coin .

' What did [I]151-racksole tell [you]3292-you ? '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole , leading the way to another table further up [the room]383-the room . At the second table there was a considerable air of excitement . [This woman]1492-this woman was the centre of attraction . '[167-aribert] By dint of a carefully - exercised diplomacy , [Racksole]151-racksole manoeuvred [himself]151-racksole into a seat opposite to [the lady in the red hat]1494-the lady in the red hat . [Nineteen]211-nineteen won . [Racksole]151-racksole received four thousand four hundred francs . ' [HE]1601-the unconscious prince must on no account be moved , '[1603-the dark little belgian doctor , whose eyes seemed to peer so quizzically through his spectacles] said [the dark little Belgian doctor , whose eyes seemed to peer so quizzically through [his]1603-the dark little belgian doctor , whose eyes seemed to peer so quizzically through his spectacles spectacles]1603-the dark little belgian doctor , whose eyes seemed to peer so quizzically through his spectacles ; and [he]1603-the dark little belgian doctor , whose eyes seemed to peer so quizzically through his spectacles said it with much positiveness .

That pronouncement rather settled [their]1604-them plans for [them]1604-them . It was certainly a professional triumph for [Nella]155-nella , who , previous to [the doctor]2847-the doctor 's arrival , had told [them]1604-them the very same thing . Considerable argument had passed before [the doctor]2847-the doctor was sent for . [Prince Aribert]167-aribert was for keeping the whole affair a deep secret among [[their]1604-them three selves]1607-their three selves . [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole agreed so far , but [he]151-racksole suggested further that at no matter what risk [they]1604-them should transport [the patient]1608-the patient over to [England]22-england at once . ' But what about [the Spencer female]3322-the spencer female ? '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole had said .

[Both the men]1616-both the men were somewhat taken aback by [the girl]577-the girl 's sagacious grasp of the situation , and it came about that [they]1616-both the men began to obey [her]577-the girl like [subordinates]1618-subordinates .

By the evening of the following day , everything was going smoothly . [The doctor]2847-the doctor came and departed several times , and sent medicine , and seemed fairly optimistic as to the issue of the illness . [An old woman]1623-an old woman had been induced to come in and cook and clean . [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer was kept out of sight on [the attic floor]1624-the attic floor , pending some decision as to what to do with [her]149-miss spencer . [And [no one]361-no one outside [the house]945-the house]1625-and no one outside the house had asked any questions . [This strong - minded and active trio]1631-this strong - minded and active trio - [Racksole]151-racksole , [Nella]155-nella , and [Prince Aribert]167-aribert - might have been [the lawful and accustomed tenants of [the house]945-the house]1632-the lawful and accustomed tenants of the house , for any outward evidence to the contrary .

On the afternoon of the third day [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen was distinctly and seriously worse . [Nella]155-nella had sat up with [him]180-prince eugen the previous night and throughout the day .

[[Her]155-nella father]386-her father had spent the morning at [the h"tel]340-the h"tel , and [Prince Aribert]167-aribert had kept watch . [The two men]399-the two men were never absent from [the house]945-the house at the same time , and [one of [them]399-the two men]1638-one of them always did duty as [sentinel]1639-sentinel at night . On this afternoon [Prince Aribert]167-aribert and [Nella]155-nella sat together in [[the patient]1608-the patient 's bedroom]1641-the patient 's bedroom . [The doctor]2847-the doctor had just left . [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole was [downstairs]3183-downstairs reading the New York Herald . [The Prince]2578-the prince and [Nella]155-nella were near the window , which looked on to [the back - garden]1645-the back - garden .

It was [a queer shabby little bedroom]1646-a queer shabby little bedroom to shelter the august body of [a European personage like [Prince Eugen of Posen]180-prince eugen]1647-a european personage like prince eugen of posen . Curiously enough , both [Nella]155-nella and [[her]155-nella father]386-her father , ardent democrats though [they]399-the two men were , had been somehow impressed by the royalty and importance of [the fever - stricken Prince]1649-the fever - stricken prince - impressed as [they]399-the two men had never been by [Aribert]167-aribert . [They]399-the two men had both felt that [here]2493-here , under [their]399-the two men care , was a species of individuality quite new to [them]399-the two men , and different from anything [they]399-the two men had previously encountered . Even the gestures and tones of [his]167-aribert delirium had an air of abrupt yet condescending command - an imposing mixture of suavity and haughtiness . As for [Nella]155-nella , [she]155-nella had been first struck by the beautiful ' E '[217-the racksoles] over a crown on the sleeves of [his]167-aribert linen , and by the signet ring on [his]167-aribert pale , emaciated hand . After all , these trifling outward signs are at least as effective as others of deeper but less obtrusive significance . [The Racksoles]217-the racksoles , too , duly marked the attitude of [Prince Aribert]167-aribert to [[his]167-aribert nephew]2586-his nephew : it was at once paternal and reverential ; it disclosed clearly that [Prince Aribert]167-aribert continued , in spite of everything , to regard [[his]167-aribert nephew]2586-his nephew as [[his]167-aribert sovereign lord]1653-his sovereign lord and [master]1654-master , as [a being surrounded by a natural and inevitable pomp and awe]1655-a being surrounded by a natural and inevitable pomp and awe . This attitude , at the beginning , seemed false and unreal to [the Americans]172-americans ; it seemed to [them]172-americans to be assumed ; but gradually [they]172-americans came to perceive that [they]172-americans were mistaken , and that though [America]8-america might have cast out ' the monarchial superstition '[155-nella] , nevertheless that ' superstition '[155-nella] had vigorously survived in [another part of [the world]311-the world]1656-another part of the world .

' [You]167-aribert and [Mr Racksole]151-racksole have been extraordinarily kind to [me]167-aribert , '[167-aribert] said [Prince Aribert]167-aribert very quietly , after [the two]755-the two had sat some time in silence .

' Why ? How ? '[1659-she] [she]1659-she asked unaffectedly . ' [We]755-the two are interested in this affair [ourselves]755-the two , [you]167-aribert know . It began at [our]755-the two h"tel - [you]167-aribert must n't forget that , [Prince]167-aribert . '[1659-she]

' [I]167-aribert do n't , '[167-aribert] [he]167-aribert said . ' [I]167-aribert forget nothing . ' Ah ! '[1660-i] [he]1660-i said , ' who knows how this thing will end ? All [our]3337-we trouble , [our]3337-we anxieties , [our]3337-we watchfulness , may come to nothing . ' But why ? '[1661-her] [she]1661-her questioned . ' Supposing , that is , that anything could happen to [me]1661-her - which it ca n't . '[1661-her]

' How do [you]1662-you know it is nothing to [me]1661-her , [Prince]2788-prince ? '[1661-her] [she]1661-her asked [him]1662-you quickly .

Just then [the sick man]1663-the sick man made a convulsive movement , and [Nella]155-nella flew to the bed and soothed [him]1663-the sick man . From the head of the bed [she]1661-her looked over at [Prince Aribert]167-aribert , and [he]167-aribert returned [her]1661-her bright , excited glance . [She]1661-her was in [her]1661-her travelling - frock , with a large white Belgian apron tied over it . Large dark circles of fatigue and sleeplessness surrounded [her]1661-her eyes , and to [the Prince]2578-the prince [her]1661-her cheek seemed hollow and thin ; [her]1661-her hair lay thick over the temples , half covering the ears . [Aribert]167-aribert gave no answer to [her]1661-her query - merely gazed at [her]1661-her with melancholy intensity .

' [I]1661-her think [I]1661-her will go and rest , '[1661-her] [she]1661-her said at last . ' [You]167-aribert will know all about the medicine . '[1661-her]

' Sleep well , '[167-aribert] [he]167-aribert said , as [he]167-aribert softly opened the door for [her]1661-her . And then [he]167-aribert was alone with [Eugen]180-prince eugen . It was [his]167-aribert turn that night to watch , for [they]1665-they still half - expected some strange , sudden visit , or onslaught , or move of one kind or another from [Jules]147-jules . [Racksole]155-nella slept in [the parlour on [the ground floor]1667-the ground floor]1666-the parlour on the ground floor .

[Nella]155-nella had [the front bedroom]1668-the front bedroom on [the first floor]2651-the first floor ; [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer was immured in [the attic]1670-the attic ; [the last - named lady]1671-the last - named lady had been singularly quiet and incurious , taking [her]1671-the last - named lady food from [Nella]155-nella and asking no questions , [the old woman]1672-the old woman went at nights to [[her]1672-the old woman own abode in [the purlieus of [the harbour]1383-the harbour]1674-the purlieus of the harbour]1673-her own abode in the purlieus of the harbour . Hour after hour [Aribert]167-aribert sat silent by [[his]167-aribert nephew]2586-his nephew 's bed - side , attending mechanically to [his]167-aribert wants , and every now and then gazing hard into the vacant , anguished face , as if trying to extort from that mask the secrets which it held . [Aribert]167-aribert was tortured by the idea that if [he]167-aribert could have only half an hour 's , only a quarter of an hour 's , rational speech with [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen , all might be cleared up and put right , and by the fact that that rational talk was absolutely impossible on [Eugen]180-prince eugen 's part until the fever had run its course . As the minutes crept on to midnight [the watcher]1677-the watcher , made nervous by the intense , electrical atmosphere which seems always to surround [a person who is dangerously ill]1678-a person who is dangerously ill , grew more and more a prey to vague and terrible apprehensions . [His]167-aribert mind dwelt hysterically on the most fatal possibilities .

[He]167-aribert wondered what would occur if by any ill - chance [Eugen]180-prince eugen should die in that bed - how [he]167-aribert would explain the affair to [Posen]180-prince eugen and to [the Emperor]2592-the emperor , how [he]167-aribert would justify [himself]167-aribert . [He]167-aribert saw [himself]167-aribert being tried for murder , sentenced [him]167-aribert - [a Prince of the blood]1680-a prince of the blood ! , led to the scaffold ... a scene unparalleled in [Europe]4-europe for over a century ! ... Then [he]167-aribert gazed anew at [the sick man]1663-the sick man , and thought [he]167-aribert saw death in every drawn feature of that agonized face . [He]167-aribert could have screamed aloud . [His]167-aribert ears heard a peculiar resonant boom . [He]167-aribert started - it was nothing but the city clock striking twelve . But there was another sound - a mysterious shuffle at the door . [He]167-aribert listened ; then jumped from [his]167-aribert chair . Nothing now ! Nothing ! But still [he]167-aribert felt drawn to the door , and after what seemed an interminable interval [he]167-aribert went and opened it , [his]167-aribert heart beating furiously . [Nella]155-nella lay in a heap on the door mat . [She]155-nella was fully dressed , but had apparently lost consciousness . [He]167-aribert clutched at [her]155-nella slender body , picked [her]155-nella up , carried [her]155-nella to the chair by [the fire - place]1682-the fire - place , and laid [her]155-nella in it . [He]167-aribert had forgotten all about [Eugen]180-prince eugen .

' What is it , [[my]167-aribert angel]3339-my angel ? '[167-aribert] [he]167-aribert whispered , and then [he]167-aribert kissed [her]155-nella - kissed [her]155-nella twice . [He]167-aribert could only look at [her]155-nella ; [he]167-aribert did not know what to do to succour [her]155-nella .

At last [she]155-nella opened [her]155-nella eyes and sighed .

' Where am [I]155-nella ? '[155-nella] [she]155-nella asked vaguely , in a tremulous tone as [she]155-nella recognized [him]167-aribert . ' Is it [you]167-aribert ? Did [I]155-nella do anything silly ? Did [I]155-nella faint ? '[155-nella]

' What has happened ? Were [you]155-nella ill ? '[167-aribert] [he]167-aribert questioned anxiously . [He]167-aribert was kneeling at [her]155-nella feet , holding [her]155-nella hand tight .

' [I]155-nella saw [Jules]147-jules by the side of [my]155-nella bed , '[155-nella] [she]155-nella murmured ; ' [I]155-nella 'm[155-nella] sure [I]0-i saw [him]167-aribert ; [he]167-aribert laughed at [me]0-i . [I]0-i had not undressed . [I]0-i sprang up , frightened , but [he]167-aribert had gone , and then [I]0-i ran [downstairs]3183-downstairs - to [you]167-aribert . '[0-i]

' [You]155-nella were dreaming , '[167-aribert] [he]167-aribert soothed [her]155-nella .

' Was [I]167-aribert ? '[167-aribert]

' [You]155-nella must have been . [I]167-aribert have not heard a sound . [No one]361-no one could have entered .[167-aribert]

But if [you]167-aribert like [I]0-i will wake [Mr Racksole]151-racksole . '[151-racksole]

' Perhaps [I]155-nella was dreaming , '[155-nella] [she]155-nella admitted . ' How foolish ! '[155-nella]

' [You]155-nella were over - tired , '[167-aribert] [he]167-aribert said , still unconsciously holding [her]155-nella hand . [They]1684-they gazed at [each other]400-each other . [She]155-nella smiled at [him]167-aribert .

' [You]167-aribert kissed [me]155-nella , '[155-nella] [she]155-nella said suddenly , and [he]167-aribert blushed red and stood up before [her]155-nella . ' Why did [you]167-aribert kiss [me]155-nella ? '[155-nella]

' Ah ! [Miss Racksole]155-nella , '[167-aribert] [he]167-aribert murmured , hurrying the words out . ' Forgive [me]167-aribert . It is unforgivable , but forgive [me]167-aribert . [I]167-aribert was overpowered by [my]167-aribert feelings . [I]167-aribert did not know what [I]167-aribert was doing . '[167-aribert]

' Why did [you]167-aribert kiss [me]155-nella ? '[155-nella] [she]155-nella repeated .

' Because - [Nella]155-nella ! [I]155-nella love [you]155-nella . [I]155-nella have no right to say it . '[155-nella]

' Why have [you]167-aribert no right to say it ? '[155-nella]

' If [Eugen]180-prince eugen dies , [I]155-nella shall owe a duty to [Posen]180-prince eugen - [I]155-nella shall be [its ruler]3341-its ruler . '[155-nella]

' Well ! '[155-nella] [she]155-nella said calmly , with an adorable confidence . ' [Papa]176-papa is worth forty millions . Would [you]1686-i not abdicate ? '[155-nella]

' Ah ! '[1686-i] [he]1686-i gave a low cry . ' Will [you]155-nella force [me]1686-i to say these things ? '[1686-i]

' But [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen will live , '[155-nella] [she]155-nella said positively , ' and if [he]180-prince eugen lives - '[155-nella]

' Am [I]155-nella , then , rich enough ? '[155-nella]

' [Nella]155-nella ! '[1687-he] [He]1687-he bent down to [her]155-nella .

Then there was a crash of breaking glass . [Aribert]167-aribert went to the window and opened it . ' It was [Jules]147-jules , '[1687-he] [he]1687-he exclaimed to [Nella]155-nella , and without another word rushed [upstairs]1128-upstairs to [the attic]1670-the attic . [The attic]1670-the attic was empty . [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer had mysteriously vanished .

Chapter Nineteen ROYALTY AT [THE GRAND BABYLON]5-the grand babylon

[THE Royal apartments at [the Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon]1693-the royal apartments at the grand babylon are famous in [the world of h"tels]317-the world of h"tels , and indeed elsewhere , as being , in [their]1693-the royal apartments at the grand babylon own way , unsurpassed . [Some of [the palaces of [Germany]77-germany]1696-the palaces of germany]1695-some of the palaces of germany , and in particular [those of [the mad Ludwig of [Bavaria]78-bavaria]1698-the mad ludwig of bavaria]1697-those of the mad ludwig of bavaria , may possess rooms and saloons which outshine [them]1695-some of the palaces of germany in gorgeous luxury and the mere wild fairy - like extravagance of wealth ; but there is nothing , anywhere , even on [Eighth Avenue]79-eighth avenue , [New York]1-new york , which can fairly be called more complete , more perfect , more enticing , or - not least important - more comfortable .

[The suite]1699-the suite consists of [six chambers]1700-six chambers - [the ante - room]783-the ante - room , [the saloon or audience chamber]1702-the saloon or audience chamber , [the dining - room]2501-the dining - room , [the yellow drawing - room where [Royalty]342-royalty receives [[its]342-royalty friends]1706-its friends]1704-the yellow drawing - room where royalty receives its friends , [the library]1707-the library , and [the State bedroom]1205-the state bedroom - to the last of which [we]1709-we have already been introduced . The most important and most impressive of these is , of course , [the audience chamber]1710-the audience chamber , [an apartment fifty feet long by forty feet broad , with a superb outlook over [the Thames]11-the thames]1711-an apartment fifty feet long by forty feet broad , with a superb outlook over the thames , [the Shot Tower]1712-the shot tower , and [the higher signals of [the South - Western Railway]1714-the south - western railway]1713-the higher signals of the south - western railway . The decoration of [this room]2696-this room is mainly in the German taste , since [four out of every six of [[its]2696-this room Royal occupants]1717-its royal occupants]1716-four out of every six of its royal occupants are of Teutonic blood ; but [its]2696-this room chief glory is [its]2696-this room French ceiling , a masterpiece by [Fragonard]218-fragonard , taken bodily from [a certain famous palace on [the Loire]80-the loire]1718-a certain famous palace on the loire . The walls are of panelled oak , with an eight - foot dado of Arras cloth imitated from unique Continental examples . The carpet , woven in one piece , is an antique specimen of the finest Turkish work , and it was obtained , a bargain , by [Felix Babylon]153-babylon , from [an impecunious Roumanian Prince]1719-an impecunious roumanian prince . The silver candelabra , now fitted with electric light , came from [the Rhine]81-the rhine , and each had a separate history . The Royal chair - it is not etiquette to call it a throne , though it amounts to a throne - was looted by [Napoleon]219-napoleon from [an Austrian city]1720-an austrian city , and bought by [Felix Babylon]153-babylon at the sale of [a French collector]1721-a french collector . At each corner of [the room]383-the room stands a gigantic grotesque vase of German faience of the sixteenth century . These were presented to [Felix Babylon]153-babylon by [[William]220-william the First of [Germany]77-germany]1723-william the first of germany , upon the conclusion of [his]220-william first incognito visit to [London]6-london in connection with the French trouble of 1875 .

There is only one picture in [the audience chamber]1710-the audience chamber . It is a portrait of [the luckless but noble [Dom Pedro]221-dom pedro]1725-the luckless but noble dom pedro , [Emperor of [the Brazils]82-the brazils]1726-emperor of the brazils . Given to [Felix Babylon]153-babylon by [Dom Pedro]221-dom pedro [himself]221-dom pedro , it hangs there solitary and sublime as a reminder to [Kings]1727-kings and Princes that Empires may pass away and greatness fall . [A certain Prince who was occupying [the suite]1699-the suite during the Jubilee of 1887]1728-a certain prince who was occupying the suite during the jubilee of 1887 - when [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon had [seven persons of Royal blood]1731-seven persons of royal blood under [its]252-the grand babylon roof - sent a curt message to [Felix]153-babylon that the portrait must be removed . [Felix]153-babylon respectfully declined to remove it , and [the Prince]2578-the prince left for [another h"tel]1733-another h"tel , where [he]2578-the prince was robbed of two thousand pounds ' worth of jewellery . [The Royal audience chamber of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]3345-the royal audience chamber of the grand babylon , if [people]2848-people only knew it , is [one of the sights of [London]6-london]3348-one of the sights of london , but it is never shown , and if [you]3349-you ask [the h"tel servants]2695-the h"tel servants about [its]3345-the royal audience chamber of the grand babylon wonders [they]2695-the h"tel servants will tell [you]3349-you only foolish facts concerning it , as that the Turkey carpet costs fifty pounds to clean , and that one of the great vases is cracked across the pedestal , owing to the rough treatment accorded to [it]3345-the royal audience chamber of the grand babylon during a riotous game of [[Blind Man]222-blind man 's Buff]3351-blind man 's buff , played one night by [four young Princesses]3352-four young princesses , [a Balkan King]3353-a balkan king , and [[his]167-aribert [aides - de - camp]3355-aides - de - camp]3354-his aides - de - camp .[167-aribert]

In one of the window recesses of [this magnificent apartment]1734-this magnificent apartment , on a certain afternoon in late July , stood [Prince Aribert of Posen]167-aribert . [He]167-aribert was faultlessly dressed in the conventional frock - coat of English civilization , with a gardenia in [his]167-aribert button - hole , and the indispensable crease down the front of the trousers . [He]167-aribert seemed to be fairly amused , and also to expect [someone]575-someone , for at frequent intervals [he]167-aribert looked rapidly over [his]167-aribert shoulder in the direction of the door behind the Royal chair . At last [a little wizened , stooping old man , with a distinctly German cast of countenance]1736-a little wizened , stooping old man , with a distinctly german cast of countenance , appeared through the door , and laid some papers on a small table by the side of the chair .

' Ah , [Hans]223-hans , [[my]167-aribert old friend]3356-my old friend ! '[167-aribert] said [Aribert]167-aribert , approaching [the old man]1737-the old man . ' [I]167-aribert must have a little talk with [you]223-hans about one or two matters . How do [you]223-hans find [[His]1737-the old man Royal Highness]3357-his royal highness ? '[167-aribert]

[The old man]1737-the old man saluted , military fashion . ' Not very well , [[your]3357-his royal highness Highness]2783-your highness , '[1737-the old man] [he]1737-the old man answered . ' [I]1737-the old man 've been [valet to [[your]3357-his royal highness Highness 's nephew]3360-your highness 's nephew]3359-valet to your highness 's nephew since [his]3360-your highness 's nephew majority , and [I]1737-the old man was valet to [[his]3360-your highness 's nephew Royal father]3361-his royal father before [him]3360-your highness 's nephew , but [I]1737-the old man never saw - '[1737-the old man] [He]1737-the old man stopped , and threw up [his]1737-the old man wrinkled hands deprecatingly .

' [You]167-aribert never saw what ? '[167-aribert] [Aribert]167-aribert smiled affectionately on [the old fellow]1739-the old fellow . [You]1740-you could perceive that [these two , so sharply differentiated in rank]1741-these two , so sharply differentiated in rank , had been intimate in the past , and would be intimate again .

' Do [you]2783-your highness know , [[my]1737-the old man Prince]3362-my prince , '[1737-the old man] said [the old man]1737-the old man , ' that [we]3363-we are to receive [the financier]3364-the financier , [Sampson Levi]184-mr sampson levi - is that [his]184-mr sampson levi name ? - in [the audience chamber]1710-the audience chamber ? ' [One]277-one would have thought so , '[167-aribert] agreed [Prince Aribert]167-aribert , ' but perhaps [[your]2783-your highness master]3369-your master has a special reason . '[167-aribert]

' [His]3369-your master orders , [Prince]2788-prince , '[223-hans] and [old Hans]223-hans , who had had a wide experience of Royal whims and knew half the secrets of [the Courts of [Europe]4-europe]1743-the courts of europe , gave [Aribert]167-aribert a look which might have meant anything . ' [He]3369-your master sent [me]167-aribert back on an - an errand , [[your]2783-your highness Highness]2783-your highness . '[167-aribert]

' And [you]167-aribert were to rejoin [him]3369-your master here ? '[167-aribert]

' Just so , [Highness]224-highness . And [I]167-aribert did rejoin [him]3369-your master here , although , to tell the truth , [I]167-aribert had begun to fear that [I]167-aribert might never see [[my]167-aribert master]3374-my master again . '[167-aribert]

' [The Prince]2578-the prince has been very ill in [Ostend]42-ostend , [Hans]223-hans . '[167-aribert]

' So [I]223-hans have gathered , '[223-hans] [Hans]223-hans responded drily , slowly rubbing [his]223-hans hands together . ' And [[his]2578-the prince Highness]2573-his highness is not yet perfectly recovered . '[223-hans]

At that moment , [Eugen]180-prince eugen , [Hereditary Prince of [Posen]167-aribert]1744-hereditary prince of posen , entered [the audience chamber]1710-the audience chamber . [He]180-prince eugen was pale and languid , and [his]180-prince eugen uniform seemed to be a trouble to [him]180-prince eugen . [His]180-prince eugen hair had been slightly ruffled , and there was a look of uneasiness , almost of alarmed unrest , in [his]180-prince eugen fine dark eyes . [He]180-prince eugen was like [a man who is afraid to look behind [him]180-prince eugen lest [he]180-prince eugen should see something there which ought not to be there]1746-a man who is afraid to look behind him lest he should see something there which ought not to be there . [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen had recovered ; at any rate , [he]180-prince eugen was convalescent , and [he]180-prince eugen had been removed to [London]6-london , where [he]180-prince eugen took up again the dropped thread of [his]180-prince eugen princely life . [He]180-prince eugen was able to resume [his]180-prince eugen public and official career . Only - only [Jules]147-jules , [Rocco]199-rocco , and [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer were still at large ; and the body of [Reginald Dimmock]166-dimmock lay buried in [the domestic mausoleum of [the palace at [Posen]167-aribert]1761-the palace at posen]1760-the domestic mausoleum of the palace at posen ; and [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen had still to interview [Mr Sampson Levi]184-mr sampson levi .

That various matters lay heavy on the mind of [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen was beyond question . [He]180-prince eugen seemed to have withdrawn within [himself]180-prince eugen . Despite the extraordinary experiences through which [he]180-prince eugen had recently passed , events which called aloud for explanations and confidence between [the nephew]1762-the nephew and [the uncle]2609-the uncle , [he]180-prince eugen would say scarcely a word to [Prince Aribert]167-aribert . Any allusion , however direct , to the days at [Ostend]42-ostend , was ignored by [him]180-prince eugen with more or less ingenuity , and [Prince Aribert]167-aribert was really no nearer a full solution of the mystery of [Jules]147-jules ' plot than [he]167-aribert had been on the night when [he]167-aribert and [Racksole]155-nella visited the gaming tables at [Ostend]42-ostend . [Eugen]180-prince eugen was well aware that [he]180-prince eugen had been kidnapped through the agency of [the woman in the red hat]3379-the woman in the red hat , but , doubtless ashamed at having been [[her]3379-the woman in the red hat dupe]3380-her dupe , [he]180-prince eugen would not proceed in any way with the clearing - up of the matter .[180-prince eugen]

' [You]180-prince eugen will receive in [this room]2696-this room , [Eugen]180-prince eugen ? '[167-aribert] [Aribert]167-aribert questioned [him]180-prince eugen .

' Yes , '[167-aribert] was the answer , given pettishly . ' Why not ? ' [Aribert]167-aribert , '[1765-the hereditary prince] [the Hereditary Prince]1765-the hereditary prince continued , when [they]1766-they were alone in [the chamber]1767-the chamber , ' [you]167-aribert think [I]1765-the hereditary prince am mad . '[1765-the hereditary prince]

' [[My]167-aribert dear]2506-my dear [Eugen]180-prince eugen , '[167-aribert] said [Prince Aribert]167-aribert , startled in spite of [himself]167-aribert . ' Do n't be absurd . '[167-aribert]

' [I]1765-the hereditary prince say [you]167-aribert think [I]1765-the hereditary prince am mad . [Aribert]167-aribert made no reply . As a matter of strict fact , the thought had crossed [his]167-aribert mind that [Eugen]180-prince eugen 's brain had not yet recovered its normal tone and activity . This speech of [[his]167-aribert nephew]2586-his nephew 's , however , had the effect of immediately restoring [his]167-aribert belief in [the latter]312-the latter 's entire sanity . [He]167-aribert felt convinced that if only [he]167-aribert could regain [[his]167-aribert nephew]2586-his nephew 's confidence , the old brotherly confidence which had existed between [them]1771-them since the years when [they]1771-them played together as [boys]1772-boys , all might yet be well . But at present there appeared to be no sign that [Eugen]180-prince eugen meant to give [his]180-prince eugen confidence to [anyone]415-anyone .

[The young Prince]1774-the young prince had come up out of [the valley of the shadow of death]1775-the valley of the shadow of death , but some of [the valley]1776-the valley 's shadow had clung to [him]1774-the young prince , and it seemed [he]1774-the young prince was unable to dissipate it .

' By the way , '[180-prince eugen] said [Eugen]180-prince eugen suddenly , ' [I]180-prince eugen must reward [these Racksoles]217-the racksoles , [I]180-prince eugen suppose . ' Then what must [I]180-prince eugen offer ? '[180-prince eugen]

' [You]180-prince eugen ! '[180-prince eugen] There was a long pause , and then [Eugen]180-prince eugen laughed . ' Ah ! '[180-prince eugen] [he]180-prince eugen said . '[180-prince eugen]

' [The Emperor]2592-the emperor has nothing to do with the affair . [I]180-prince eugen shall renounce [my]180-prince eugen rights .[180-prince eugen]

[I]0-i shall become [a plain citizen]1778-a plain citizen . '[0-i]

' In which case [you]180-prince eugen will have no fortune to speak of . '[180-prince eugen]

' [Mr Levi]184-mr sampson levi , '[2578-the prince] [he]2578-the prince said , ' if [you]1796-your do not place the money in [my]2578-the prince hands to - morrow [you]1796-your will ruin one of [the oldest of [reigning families]3459-reigning families]3458-the oldest of reigning families , and , incidentally , [you]1796-your will alter the map of [Europe]4-europe .
