' Pardon [me]184-mr sampson levi , [[your]1796-your Highness]2783-your highness , '[184-mr sampson levi] said [little Levi]184-mr sampson levi , rising in resentment , ' it is not [I]184-mr sampson levi who have not kept faith . [I]184-mr sampson levi beg to repeat that the money is no longer at [my]184-mr sampson levi disposal , and to bid [[your]1796-your Highness]2783-your highness good morning . '[184-mr sampson levi]

And [Mr Sampson Levi]184-mr sampson levi left [the audience chamber]1710-the audience chamber with an awkward , aggrieved bow . It was a scene characteristic of the end of the nineteenth century - [an overfed , commonplace , pursy little man who had been born in [a Brixton semi - detached villa]1805-a brixton semi - detached villa , and whose highest idea of pleasure was a Sunday up [the river]2891-the river]1804-an overfed , commonplace , pursy little man who had been born in a brixton semi - detached villa , and whose highest idea of pleasure was a sunday up the river in [an expensive electric launch]1807-an expensive electric launch , confronting and utterly routing , in a h"tel belonging to [an American millionaire]1808-an american millionaire , [the representative of [a race of men who had fingered every page of European history for centuries]1810-a race of men who had fingered every page of european history for centuries , and who still , in [their]1810-a race of men who had fingered every page of european history for centuries native castles]1809-the representative of a race of men who had fingered every page of european history for centuries , and who still , in their native castles , were surrounded with every outward circumstance of pomp and power .

' [Aribert]167-aribert , '[180-prince eugen] said [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen , a little later , ' [you]167-aribert were right . It is all over . [I]180-prince eugen have only one refuge - '[180-prince eugen]

' [You]167-aribert do n't mean - '[167-aribert] [Aribert]167-aribert stopped , dumbfounded .

' Yes , [I]167-aribert do , '[167-aribert] [he]167-aribert said quickly . ' [I]167-aribert can manage it so that it will look like an accident . '[167-aribert]

Chapter Twenty - One THE RETURN OF FÉLIX [BABYLON]153-babylon

ON the evening of [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen 's fateful interview with [Mr Sampson Levi]184-mr sampson levi , [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole was wandering somewhat aimlessly and uneasily about the entrance hail and [adjacent corridors of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]1811-adjacent corridors of the grand babylon . [He]151-racksole had returned from [Ostend]42-ostend only a day or two previously , and had endeavoured with all [his]151-racksole might to forget the affair which had carried [him]151-racksole [there]290-there - to regard it , in fact , as done with . But [he]151-racksole found [himself]151-racksole unable to do so . In vain [he]151-racksole remarked , under [his]151-racksole breath , that there were some things which were best left alone : if [his]151-racksole experience as [a manipulator of markets]1814-a manipulator of markets , [a contriver of gigantic schemes in [New York]1-new york]1815-a contriver of gigantic schemes in new york , had taught [him]151-racksole anything at all , it should surely have taught [him]151-racksole that . Yet [he]151-racksole could not feel reconciled to such a position . The mere presence of [the princes in [his]151-racksole h"tel]1816-the princes in his h"tel roused the fighting instincts of [this man , who had never in [his]151-racksole whole career been beaten]1817-this man , who had never in his whole career been beaten . [He]151-racksole had , as it were , taken up arms on [their]1816-the princes in his h"tel side , and if [the princes of [Posen]167-aribert]1818-the princes of posen would not continue [their]1818-the princes of posen own battle , nevertheless [he]151-racksole , [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole , wanted to continue it for [them]1818-the princes of posen . To a certain extent , of course , the battle had been won , for [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen had been rescued from an extremely difficult and dangerous position , and [the enemy]1819-the enemy - consisting of [Jules]147-jules , [Rocco]199-rocco , [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer , and perhaps [others]1820-others - had been put to flight . But that , [he]151-racksole conceived , was not enough ; it was very far from being enough . That [the criminals]1821-the criminals , for [criminals]1822-criminals [they]1821-the criminals decidedly were , should still be at large , [he]151-racksole regarded as an absurd anomaly . And there was another point : [he]151-racksole had said nothing to [the police]673-the police of all that had occurred . [He]151-racksole disdained [the police]673-the police , but [he]151-racksole could scarcely fail to perceive that if [the police]673-the police should by accident gain a clue to the real state of the case [he]151-racksole might be placed rather awkwardly , for the simple reason that in the eyes of the law it amounted to a misdemeanour to conceal as much as [he]151-racksole had concealed . [He]151-racksole asked [himself]151-racksole , for the thousandth time , why [he]151-racksole had adopted a policy of concealment from [the police]673-the police , why [he]151-racksole had become in any way interested in the Posen matter , and why , at this present moment , [he]151-racksole should be so anxious to prosecute it further ? To the first two questions [he]151-racksole replied , rather lamely , that [he]151-racksole had been influenced by [Nella]155-nella , and also by a natural spirit of adventure ; to the third [he]151-racksole replied that [he]151-racksole had always been in the habit of carrying things through , and was now actuated by a mere childish , obstinate desire to carry this one through . Moreover , [he]151-racksole was splendidly conscious of [his]151-racksole perfect ability to carry it through . One additional impulse [he]151-racksole had , though [he]151-racksole did not admit it to [himself]151-racksole , being by nature adverse to big words , and that was an abstract love of justice , [the Anglo - Saxon]1827-the anglo - saxon 's deep - found instinct for helping the right side to conquer , even when grave risks must thereby be run , with no corresponding advantage .

[He]151-racksole was turning these things over in [his]151-racksole mind as [he]151-racksole walked about [the vast h"tel]1828-the vast h"tel on that evening of the last day in July . The Society papers had been stating for a week past that [London]6-london was empty , but , in spite of the Society papers , [London]6-london persisted in seeming to be just as full as ever . [The Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon was certainly not as crowded as [it]252-the grand babylon had been a month earlier , but [it]252-the grand babylon was doing a very passable business . At the close of the season [the gay butterflies of [the social community]1831-the social community]1830-the gay butterflies of the social community have a habit of hovering for a day or two in [the big h"tels]1832-the big h"tels before [they]1830-the gay butterflies of the social community flutter away to castle and [country - house]1833-country - house , [meadow and moor]1834-meadow and moor , [lake and stream]1835-lake and stream . The great basket - chairs in [the portico]669-the portico were well filled by old and middle - aged gentlemen engaged in enjoying the varied delights of liqueurs , cigars , and the full moon which floated so serenely above [the Thames]11-the thames . Here and there [a pretty woman on the arm of a cavalier in immaculate attire]1837-a pretty woman on the arm of a cavalier in immaculate attire swept [her]1837-a pretty woman on the arm of a cavalier in immaculate attire train as [she]1837-a pretty woman on the arm of a cavalier in immaculate attire turned to and fro in [the promenade of [the terrace]2616-the terrace]1838-the promenade of the terrace . [Waiters]1840-waiters and [uniformed commissionaires and gold - braided doorkeepers]1841-uniformed commissionaires and gold - braided doorkeepers moved noiselessly about ; at short intervals [the chief of the doorkeepers]1842-the chief of the doorkeepers blew [his]1842-the chief of the doorkeepers shrill whistle and hansoms drove up with tinkling bell to take away a pair of butterflies to some place of amusement or boredom ; occasionally [a private carriage]1843-a private carriage drawn by [expensive and self - conscious horses]1844-expensive and self - conscious horses put [the hansoms]1845-the hansoms to shame by its mere outward glory . It was a hot night , a night for [the summer woods]1846-the summer woods , and save for [the vehicles]1847-the vehicles there was no rapid movement of any kind . It seemed as though [the world]311-the world - [the world]311-the world , that is to say , of [the Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon - was fully engaged in the solemn processes of digestion and small - talk . Even the long row of the Embankment gas - lamps , stretching right and left , scarcely trembled in the still , warm , caressing air . The stars overhead looked down with many blinkings upon [the enormous pile of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]1850-the enormous pile of the grand babylon , and the moon regarded [it]252-the grand babylon with bland and changeless face ; what [they]1852-they thought of [it]252-the grand babylon and [[its]252-the grand babylon inhabitants]1853-its inhabitants can not , unfortunately , be recorded . What [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole thought of the moon can be recorded : [he]151-racksole thought it was a nuisance . It somehow fascinated [his]151-racksole gaze with its silly stare , and so interfered with [his]151-racksole complex meditations . [He]151-racksole glanced round at [the well - dressed and satisfied people]1854-the well - dressed and satisfied people - [[his]151-racksole guests]450-his guests , [[his]151-racksole customers]1856-his customers . [They]1854-the well - dressed and satisfied people appeared to ignore [him]151-racksole absolutely .

Probably only [a very small percentage of [them]1854-the well - dressed and satisfied people]1857-a very small percentage of them had the least idea that [this tall spare man]1858-this tall spare man , with the iron - grey hair and the thin , firm , resolute face , who wore [his]1858-this tall spare man American - cut evening clothes with such careless ease , was [the sole proprietor of [the Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon]1859-the sole proprietor of the grand babylon , and possibly [the richest man in [Europe]4-europe]1860-the richest man in europe . As has already been stated , [Racksole]151-racksole was not [a celebrity in [England]22-england]1861-a celebrity in england .

[The guests of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]1862-the guests of the grand babylon saw merely [a restless male person]1864-a restless male person , whose restlessness was rather a disturber of [their]1862-the guests of the grand babylon quietude , but with whom , to judge by [his]151-racksole countenance , it would be inadvisable to remonstrate . Therefore [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole continued [his]151-racksole perambulations unchallenged , and kept saying to [himself]151-racksole , ' [I]151-racksole must do something . '[151-racksole] But what ? [He]151-racksole could think of no course to pursue .

At last [he]151-racksole walked straight through [the h"tel]340-the h"tel and out at the other entrance , and so up [the little unassuming side street]1866-the little unassuming side street into the roaring torrent of [the narrow and crowded Strand]1867-the narrow and crowded strand . [He]151-racksole jumped on [a Putney bus]1868-a putney bus , and paid [his]151-racksole fair to [Putney]227-putney , fivepence , and then , finding that [the humble occupants of [the vehicle]927-the vehicle]1869-the humble occupants of the vehicle stared at the spectacle of [a man in evening dress but without a dustcoat]1871-a man in evening dress but without a dustcoat , [he]151-racksole jumped off again , oblivious of the fact that [the conductor]1872-the conductor jerked a thumb towards [him]151-racksole and winked at [the passengers]1873-the passengers as who should say , ' There goes [a lunatic]3462-a lunatic . '[1872-the conductor] [He]151-racksole went into [a tobacconist 's shop]1874-a tobacconist 's shop and asked for a cigar . [The shopman]1875-the shopman mildly inquired what price .

' What are the best [you]442-the man 've got ? '[151-racksole] asked [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole .

' Five shillings each , [sir]2479-sir , '[442-the man] said [the man]442-the man promptly .

' Give [me]151-racksole a penny one , '[151-racksole] was [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole 's laconic request , and [he]151-racksole walked out of [the shop]1877-the shop smoking the penny cigar . It was a new sensation for [him]151-racksole .

[He]151-racksole was inhaling the aromatic odours of [[Eugene Rimmel]228-eugene rimmel 's establishment]1878-eugene rimmel 's establishment for the sale of scents when [a gentleman]2671-a gentleman , walking slowly in the opposite direction , accosted [him]151-racksole with a quiet , ' Good evening , [Mr Racksole]151-racksole . '[2671-a gentleman] [The millionaire]414-the millionaire did not at first recognize [[his]414-the millionaire interlocutor]1339-his interlocutor , who wore a travelling overcoat , and was carrying a handbag . Then a slight , pleased smile passed over [his]442-the man features , and [he]442-the man held out [his]442-the man hand .

' Well , [Mr Babylon]153-babylon , '[151-racksole] [he]151-racksole greeted [the other]1882-the other , ' of all persons in [the wide world]367-the wide world [you]153-babylon are [the man [I]151-racksole would most have wished to meet]3465-the man i would most have wished to meet . '[151-racksole]

' [You]153-babylon flatter [me]1883-the little anglicized swiss , '[1883-the little anglicized swiss] said [the little Anglicized Swiss]1883-the little anglicized swiss .

' No , [I]151-racksole do n't , '[151-racksole] answered [Racksole]151-racksole ; ' it is n't [my]151-racksole custom , any more than it 's [yours]153-babylon . [I]151-racksole wanted to have a real good long yarn with [you]153-babylon , and lo ! here [you]153-babylon are ! Where have [you]153-babylon sprung from ? '[151-racksole]

' From [Lausanne]30-lausanne , '[153-babylon] said [Felix Babylon]153-babylon . ' [I]153-babylon had finished [my]153-babylon duties [there]290-there , [I]153-babylon had nothing else to do , and [I]153-babylon felt homesick . [I]153-babylon felt the nostalgia of [London]6-london , and so [I]153-babylon came over , just as [you]151-racksole see , '[153-babylon] and [he]153-babylon raised the handbag for [Racksole]151-racksole 's notice . ' One toothbrush , one razor , two slippers , eh ? '[153-babylon] [He]153-babylon laughed . ' [I]153-babylon was wondering as [I]153-babylon walked along where [I]153-babylon should stay - [me]153-babylon , [Felix Babylon]153-babylon , homeless in [London]6-london . '[153-babylon]

' [I]151-racksole should advise [you]153-babylon to stay at [the Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon , '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole laughed back .

' [I]153-babylon accept , '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon , and added , ' [You]151-racksole are very good , [Mr Racksole]151-racksole . '[153-babylon]

[They]1884-they strolled together back to [the h"tel]340-the h"tel , saying nothing in particular , but feeling very content with [[each other]400-each other 's company]1887-each other 's company .

' Many [customers]3470-customers ? '[153-babylon] asked [Felix Babylon]153-babylon .

' [I]151-racksole think [I]151-racksole may say in [the storekeeper]3471-the storekeeper 's phrase , that if there is any business about [I]151-racksole am doing it .[151-racksole]

To - night [the people]1889-the people are all on [the terrace in [the portico]669-the portico]1890-the terrace in the portico - it 's so confoundedly hot - and the consumption of ice is simply enormous - nearly as large as it would be in [New York]1-new york . '[151-racksole]

' In that case , '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon politely , ' let [me]153-babylon offer [you]151-racksole another cigar . '[153-babylon]

' But [I]151-racksole have not finished this one . '[151-racksole]

' That is just why [I]153-babylon wish to offer [you]151-racksole another one . [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole laughingly lighted the Rothschild Havana which [Babylon]153-babylon gave [him]151-racksole , and [they]1892-they entered the h"tel arm in arm . But no sooner had [they]1892-they mounted the steps than [little Felix]153-babylon became the object of numberless greetings . It appeared that [he]153-babylon had been highly popular among [[his]153-babylon quondam guests]1893-his quondam guests . At last [they]1892-they reached [the managerial room]1894-the managerial room , where [Babylon]153-babylon was regaled on a chicken , and [Racksole]151-racksole assisted [him]153-babylon in the consumption of a bottle of [Heidsieck Monopole]86-heidsieck monopole , [Carte d'Or]87-carte d'or .

' This chicken is almost perfectly grilled , '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon at length . ' It is a credit to [the house]945-the house . But why , [[my]153-babylon dear]2506-my dear [Racksole]151-racksole , why in the name of [Heaven]160-heaven did [you]151-racksole quarrel with [Rocco]199-rocco ? '[153-babylon]

' Then [you]151-racksole have heard ? '[151-racksole]

' Heard ! [[My]153-babylon dear friend]3481-my dear friend , it was in every newspaper on [the Continent]3482-the continent . Some journals prophesied that [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon would have to close [its]252-the grand babylon doors within half a year now that [Rocco]199-rocco had deserted [it]252-the grand babylon . But of course [I]153-babylon knew better . '[153-babylon]

' As a matter of fact , [I]151-racksole had not made arrangements in advance , '[151-racksole] said [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole , a little ruefully ; ' but happily [we]3484-we have found in [[our]3484-we second sous - chef]3485-our second sous - chef [an artist inferior only to [Rocco]199-rocco [himself]199-rocco]3486-an artist inferior only to rocco himself . That , however , was mere good fortune . '[151-racksole]

' Surely , '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon , ' it was indiscreet to trust to mere good fortune in such a serious matter ? '[153-babylon]

' [I]151-racksole did n't trust to mere good fortune . [I]151-racksole did n't trust to anything except [Rocco]199-rocco , and [he]199-rocco deceived [me]151-racksole . '[151-racksole]

' But why did [you]151-racksole quarrel with [him]199-rocco ? '[153-babylon]

' [I]151-racksole did n't quarrel with [him]199-rocco . [I]151-racksole found [him]199-rocco embalming a corpse in [the State bedroom]1205-the state bedroom one night - '[151-racksole]

' [You]151-racksole what ? '[153-babylon] [Babylon]153-babylon almost screamed .

' [I]151-racksole found [him]199-rocco embalming a corpse in [the State bedroom]1205-the state bedroom , '[151-racksole] repeated [Racksole]151-racksole in [his]151-racksole quietest tones .

[The two men]399-the two men gazed at [each other]400-each other , and then [Racksole]151-racksole replenished [Babylon]153-babylon 's glass .

' Tell [me]153-babylon , '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon , settling [himself]153-babylon deep in an easy chair and lighting a cigar .

And [Racksole]151-racksole thereupon recounted to [him]153-babylon the whole of the Posen episode , with every circumstantial detail so far as [he]153-babylon knew it . It was a long and complicated recital , and occupied about an hour . During that time [little Felix]153-babylon never spoke a word , scarcely moved a muscle ; only [his]153-babylon small eyes gazed through the bluish haze of smoke . The clock on the mantelpiece tinkled midnight .

' Time for whisky and soda , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole , and got up as if to ring the bell ; but [Babylon]153-babylon waved [him]151-racksole back .

' [You]151-racksole have told [me]153-babylon that [this Sampson Levi]3489-this sampson levi had an audience of [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen to - day , but [you]151-racksole have not told [me]153-babylon the result of that audience , '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon .

' Because [I]153-babylon do not yet know it . But [I]153-babylon shall doubtless know to - morrow . In the meantime , [I]153-babylon feel fairly sure that [Levi]184-mr sampson levi declined to produce [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen 's required million . [I]153-babylon have reason to believe that the money was lent elsewhere . '[153-babylon]

' H'm ! '[153-babylon] mused [Babylon]153-babylon ; and then , carelessly , ' [I]153-babylon am not at all surprised at that arrangement for spying through [the bathroom of [the State apartments]2792-the state apartments]3490-the bathroom of the state apartments . '[153-babylon]

' Why are [you]153-babylon not surprised ? '[153-babylon]

' Oh ! '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon , ' it is such an obvious dodge - so easy to carry out . As for [me]153-babylon , [I]153-babylon took special care never to involve [myself]153-babylon in these affairs . [I]153-babylon knew they existed ; [I]153-babylon somehow felt that they existed . But [I]153-babylon also felt that they lay outside [my]153-babylon sphere . [My]153-babylon business was to provide board and lodging of the most sumptuous kind to [those who did n't mind paying for it]3492-those who did n't mind paying for it ; and [I]153-babylon did [my]153-babylon business . If anything else went on in [the h"tel]340-the h"tel , under the rose , [I]153-babylon long determined to ignore it unless it should happen to be brought before [my]153-babylon notice ; and it never was brought before [my]153-babylon notice . However , [I]153-babylon admit that there is a certain pleasurable excitement in this kind of affair and doubtless [you]153-babylon have experienced that . '[153-babylon]

' [I]151-racksole have , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole simply , ' though [I]151-racksole believe [you]153-babylon are laughing at [me]151-racksole . '[151-racksole]

' By no means , '[153-babylon] [Babylon]153-babylon replied . ' Now what , if [I]153-babylon may ask the question , is going to be [your]153-babylon next step ? '[153-babylon]

' That is just what [I]151-racksole desire to know [myself]151-racksole , '[151-racksole] said [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole .

' Well , '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon , after a pause , ' let [us]3494-us begin . In the first place , it is possible [you]153-babylon may be interested to hear that [I]153-babylon happened to see [Jules]147-jules to - day . '[153-babylon]

' [You]153-babylon did ! '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole remarked with much calmness . ' Where ? '[151-racksole]

' Well , it was early this morning , in [Paris]7-paris , just before [I]153-babylon left [there]290-there . The meeting was quite accidental , and [Jules]147-jules seemed rather surprised at meeting [me]153-babylon . [He]147-jules respectfully inquired where [I]153-babylon was going , and [I]153-babylon said that [I]153-babylon was going to [Switzerland]13-switzerland . At that moment [I]153-babylon thought [I]153-babylon was going to [Switzerland]13-switzerland . It had occurred to [me]153-babylon that after all [I]153-babylon should be happier [there]290-there , and that [I]153-babylon had better turn back and not see [London]6-london any more . However , [I]153-babylon changed [my]153-babylon mind once again , and decided to come on to [London]6-london , and accept the risks of being miserable [there]290-there without [my]153-babylon h"tel . Then [I]153-babylon asked [Jules whither]147-jules [he]147-jules was bound , and [he]147-jules told [me]153-babylon that [he]147-jules was off to [Constantinople]88-constantinople , being interested in [a new French h"tel there]3498-a new french h"tel there . [I]153-babylon wished [him]147-jules good luck , and [we]3499-we parted . '[153-babylon]

' [Constantinople]88-constantinople , eh ! '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole . ' A highly suitable place for [him]147-jules , [I]151-racksole should say . '[151-racksole]

' But , '[153-babylon] [Babylon]153-babylon resumed , ' [I]153-babylon caught sight of [him]147-jules again . '[153-babylon]

' Where ? '[151-racksole]

' At [Charing Cross]31-charing cross , a few minutes before [I]153-babylon had the pleasure of meeting [you]153-babylon .[153-babylon]

[Mr Jules]147-jules had not gone to [Constantinople]88-constantinople after all . [He]147-jules did not see [me]0-i , or [I]0-i should have suggested to [him]147-jules that in going from [Paris]7-paris to [Constantinople]88-constantinople it is not usual to travel via [London]6-london . '[153-babylon]

' The cheek of [the fellow]2768-the fellow ! '[151-racksole] exclaimed [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole . ' The gorgeous and colossal cheek of [the fellow]2768-the fellow ! '[151-racksole]

Chapter Twenty - Two IN [THE WINE CELLARS OF]1897-the wine cellars of [THE GRAND BABYLON]153-babylon

' DO [you]153-babylon know anything of the antecedents of [this Jules]3502-this jules , '[151-racksole] asked [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole , helping [himself]151-racksole to whisky .

' Nothing whatever , '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon . ' Until [you]153-babylon told [me]153-babylon , [I]153-babylon do n't think [I]153-babylon was aware that [his]3502-this jules true name was [Thomas Jackson]191-mr tom jackson , though of course [I]153-babylon knew that it was not [Jules]147-jules . [I]153-babylon certainly was not aware that [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer was [[his]3502-this jules wife]704-his wife , but [I]153-babylon had long suspected that [their]3504-their relations were somewhat more intimate than the nature of [their]3504-their respective duties in the h"tel absolutely demanded . All that [I]153-babylon do know of [Jules]147-jules - [he]147-jules will always be called [Jules]147-jules - is that [he]147-jules gradually , by some mysterious personal force , acquired a prominent position in [the h"tel]340-the h"tel . Decidedly [he]147-jules was [the cleverest and most intellectual waiter [I]153-babylon have ever known]3506-the cleverest and most intellectual waiter i have ever known , and [he]147-jules was specially skilled in the difficult task of retaining [his]147-jules own dignity while not interfering with that of [other people]975-other people .[153-babylon]

[I]0-i 'm afraid this information is a little too vague to be of any practical assistance in the present difficulty . '[0-i]

' What is the present difficulty ? '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole queried , with a simple air .

' [I]151-racksole should imagine that the present difficulty is to account for [the man]442-the man 's presence in [London]6-london . '[151-racksole]

' That is easily accounted for , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole .

' How ? Do [you]151-racksole suppose [he]147-jules is anxious to give [himself]147-jules up to justice , or that the chains of habit bind [him]147-jules to [the h"tel]340-the h"tel ? '[0-i]

' Neither , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole . ' [Jules]147-jules is going to have another try - that 's all . '[151-racksole]

' Another try at what ? '[0-i]

' At [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen . Either at [his]180-prince eugen life or [his]180-prince eugen liberty . Most probably [the former]3510-the former this time ; almost certainly [the former]3510-the former . [He]180-prince eugen has guessed that [we]3512-we are somewhat handicapped by [our]3512-we anxiety to keep [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen 's predicament quite quiet , and [he]180-prince eugen is taking advantage , of that fact . As [he]180-prince eugen already is fairly rich , on [his]180-prince eugen own admission , the reward which has been offered to [him]180-prince eugen must be enormous , and [he]180-prince eugen is absolutely determined to get it . [He]180-prince eugen has several times recently proved [himself]180-prince eugen to be [a daring fellow]3513-a daring fellow ; unless [I]151-racksole am mistaken [he]180-prince eugen will shortly prove [himself]180-prince eugen to be still more daring . '[151-racksole]

' But what can [he]180-prince eugen do ? Surely [you]151-racksole do n't suggest that [he]180-prince eugen will attempt the life of [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen in [this h"tel]2485-this h"tel ? '[0-i]

' Why not ? If [Reginald Dimmock]166-dimmock fell on mere suspicion that [he]166-dimmock would turn out unfaithful to the conspiracy , why not [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen ? '[151-racksole]

' But it would be an unspeakable crime , and do infinite harm to the h"tel ! '[0-i]

' True ! '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole admitted , smiling . [Little Felix Babylon]153-babylon seemed to brace [himself]153-babylon for the grasping of [his]153-babylon monstrous idea .

' How could it possibly be done ? '[153-babylon] [he]153-babylon asked at length .

' [Dimmock]166-dimmock was poisoned . '[0-i]

' Yes , but [you]151-racksole had [Rocco]199-rocco here then , and [Rocco]199-rocco was in the plot . It is conceivable that [Rocco]199-rocco could have managed it - barely conceivable . But without [Rocco]199-rocco [I]151-racksole can not think it possible . [I]151-racksole can not even think that [Jules]147-jules would attempt it . [You]151-racksole see , in [a place like [the Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon]3515-a place like the grand babylon , as probably [I]151-racksole need n't point out to [you]151-racksole , food has to pass through so many hands that to poison [one person]3516-one person without killing perhaps fifty would be a most delicate operation . Moreover , [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen , unless [he]180-prince eugen has changed [his]180-prince eugen habits , is always served by [[his]180-prince eugen own attendant]3517-his own attendant , [old Hans]223-hans , and therefore any attempt to tamper with a cooked dish immediately before serving would be hazardous in the extreme . '[151-racksole]

' Granted , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole . ' The wine , however , might be more easily got at .[151-racksole]

Had [you]151-racksole thought of that ? '[151-racksole]

' [I]153-babylon had not , '[153-babylon] [Babylon]153-babylon admitted . ' [You]151-racksole are [an ingenious theorist]3518-an ingenious theorist , but [I]153-babylon happen to know that [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen always has [his]180-prince eugen wine opened in [his]180-prince eugen own presence . No doubt it would be opened by [Hans]223-hans . Therefore the wine theory is not tenable , [[my]153-babylon friend]2542-my friend . '[153-babylon]

' [I]151-racksole do not see why , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole . ' [I]151-racksole know nothing of wine as [an expert]3520-an expert , and [I]151-racksole very seldom drink it , but it seems to [me]151-racksole that a bottle of wine might be tampered with while it was still in [the cellar]1543-the cellar , especially if there was [an accomplice in [the h"tel]340-the h"tel]3522-an accomplice in the h"tel . '[151-racksole]

' [You]151-racksole think , then , that [you]151-racksole are not yet rid of all [[your]151-racksole conspirators]3524-your conspirators ? '[153-babylon]

' [I]151-racksole think that [Jules]147-jules might still have [an accomplice within [the building]1519-the building]3525-an accomplice within the building . '[151-racksole]

' And that a bottle of wine could be opened and recorked without leaving any trace of the operation ? '[153-babylon] [Babylon]153-babylon was a trifle sarcastic .

' [I]151-racksole do n't see the necessity of opening the bottle in order to poison the wine , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole . ' [I]151-racksole have never tried to poison [anybody]3527-anybody by means of a bottle of wine , and [I]151-racksole do n't lay claim to any natural talent as [a poisoner]3528-a poisoner , but [I]151-racksole think [I]151-racksole could devise several ways of managing the trick . Of course , [I]151-racksole admit [I]151-racksole may be entirely mistaken as to [Jules]147-jules '[151-racksole] intentions . '[151-racksole]

' Ah ! '[153-babylon] said [Felix Babylon]153-babylon . ' [The wine cellars beneath [us]3530-us]3529-the wine cellars beneath us are one of the wonders of [London]6-london . In the valuation [I]153-babylon reckoned them at sixty thousand pounds . And [I]153-babylon may say that [I]153-babylon always took care that [the cellars]3531-the cellars were properly guarded . '[153-babylon]

' [I]151-racksole am ashamed to say that [I]151-racksole have not yet inspected [my]151-racksole wines , '[151-racksole] smiled [Racksole]151-racksole ; ' [I]151-racksole have never given [them]3531-the cellars a thought . '[151-racksole]

' Impossible , [[my]162-the grand babylon dear fellow]3537-my dear fellow ! ' Why not to - night ? '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole suggested , calmly .

' To - night ! It is very late : [Hubbard]229-hubbard will have gone to bed . '[151-racksole]

' And may [I]151-racksole ask who is [Hubbard]229-hubbard ? [I]151-racksole remember the name but dimly . '[151-racksole]

' [A sedate man of forty]3540-a sedate man of forty . [He]229-hubbard has the keys of [the cellars]3531-the cellars . ' [We]3546-we will wake [him]229-hubbard , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole .

' But it is one o'clock in the morning , '[153-babylon] [Babylon]153-babylon protested .

' Never mind - that is , if [you]151-racksole consent to accompany [me]153-babylon . [A cellar]1536-a cellar is the same by night as by day . Therefore , why not now ? '[153-babylon]

[Babylon]153-babylon shrugged [his]153-babylon shoulders . ' As [you]151-racksole wish , '[153-babylon] [he]153-babylon agreed , with [his]153-babylon indestructible politeness .

' And now to find this [Mr Hubbard]229-hubbard , with [his]229-hubbard key of the cupboard , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole , as [they]1899-they walked out of [the room]383-the room together . Although the hour was so late , [the h"tel]340-the h"tel was not , of course , closed for the night . [A few guests]1902-a few guests still remained about in [the public rooms]1903-the public rooms , and [a few fatigued waiters]1904-a few fatigued waiters were still in attendance . [One of [these latter]1906-these latter]1905-one of these latter was despatched in search of [the singular Mr Hubbard]229-hubbard , and it fortunately turned out that [this gentleman]1907-this gentleman had not actually retired , though [he]1907-this gentleman was on the point of doing so . [He]1907-this gentleman brought the keys to [Mr Racksole]151-racksole in person , and after [he]1907-this gentleman had had a little chat with [[his]1907-this gentleman former master]1908-his former master , [the proprietor]318-the proprietor and [the ex - proprietor of [the Grand Babylon H"tel]840-the grand babylon h"tel]1910-the ex - proprietor of the grand babylon h"tel proceeded on [their]1899-they way to [the cellars]3531-the cellars .

[These cellars]1913-these cellars extend over , or rather under , quite half the superficial areas of [the whole h"tel]3176-the whole h"tel - [the longitudinal half which lies next to [the Strand]90-the strand]1915-the longitudinal half which lies next to the strand .

Owing to the fact that the ground slopes sharply from [the Strand]90-the strand to [the river]2891-the river , [the Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon is , so to speak , deeper near [the Strand]90-the strand than [it]5-the grand babylon is near [the Thames]11-the thames . Towards [the Thames]11-the thames there is , below the entrance level , [a basement]1917-a basement and [a sub - basement]1918-a sub - basement . Towards [the Strand]90-the strand there is [basement]1919-basement , [sub - basement]1920-sub - basement , and [the huge wine cellars beneath all]1921-the huge wine cellars beneath all . After descending [the four flights of the service stairs]1922-the four flights of the service stairs , and traversing a long passage running parallel with [the kitchen]538-the kitchen , [the two]755-the two found [themselves]755-the two opposite a door , which , on being unlocked , gave access to [another flight of stairs]1925-another flight of stairs . At the foot of this was the main entrance to [the cellars]3531-the cellars . Outside the entrance was the wine - lift , for the ascension of delicious fluids to [the upper floors]1927-the upper floors , and , opposite , [[Mr Hubbard]229-hubbard 's little office]1928-mr hubbard 's little office . There was electric light everywhere .

[Babylon]153-babylon , who , as being most accustomed to [them]755-the two , held the bunch of keys , opened the great door , and then [they]755-the two were in [the first cellar]1929-the first cellar - [the first of [a suite of five]1931-a suite of five]1930-the first of a suite of five . [Racksole]151-racksole was struck not only by the icy coolness of [the place]291-the place , but also by [its]291-the place vastness . [Babylon]153-babylon had seized a portable electric handlight , attached to a long wire , which lay handy , and , waving it about , disclosed the dimensions of [the place]291-the place . By that flashing illumination [the subterranean chamber]1537-the subterranean chamber looked unutterably weird and mysterious , with [its]1537-the subterranean chamber rows of numbered bins , stretching away into the distance till the radiance was reduced to the occasional far gleam of the light on the shoulder of a bottle . Then [Babylon]153-babylon switched on the fixed electric lights , and [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole entered upon a personally - conducted tour of what was quite the most interesting part of [[his]151-racksole own property]1935-his own property .

To see the innocent enthusiasm of [Felix Babylon]153-babylon for these stores of exhilarating liquid was what is called in [the North]91-the north ' a sight for sair een '[151-racksole] .

[He]151-racksole displayed to [Racksole]151-racksole 's bewildered gaze , in [their]755-the two due order , all the wines of [three continents]1936-three continents - nay , of four , for the superb and luscious [Constantia]92-constantia wine of [Cape Colony]93-cape colony was not wanting in that most catholic collection of vintages . Beginning with the unsurpassed products of [Burgundy]94-burgundy , [he]151-racksole continued with the clarets of [Médoc]95-médoc , [Bordeaux]96-bordeaux , and [Sauterne]97-sauterne ; then to [the champagnes of [Ay]98-ay]1937-the champagnes of ay , [Hautvilliers]99-hautvilliers , and [Pierry]100-pierry ; then to the hocks and moselles of [Germany]77-germany , and the brilliant imitation champagnes of [Main]101-main , [Neckar]102-neckar , and [Naumburg]103-naumburg ; then to [the famous and adorable Tokay of [Hungary]104-hungary]1938-the famous and adorable tokay of hungary , and all the Austrian varieties of French wines , including [Carlowitz]105-carlowitz and [Somlauer]106-somlauer ; then to [the dry sherries of [Spain]107-spain]1939-the dry sherries of spain , including [purest Manzanilla]108-purest manzanilla , and Amontillado , and [Vino de Pasto]109-vino de pasto ; then to the wines of [Malaga]110-malaga , both sweet and dry , and all the ' Spanish reds '[1941-he] from [Catalonia]111-catalonia , including the dark ' Tent '[1941-he] so often used sacramentally ; then to [the renowned port of [Oporto]112-oporto]1940-the renowned port of oporto . And so on , to an extent and with a fullness of detail which can not be rendered here .

At the end of [the suite of cellars]1945-the suite of cellars there was a glazed door , which , as could be seen , gave access to [a supplemental and smaller cellar]1946-a supplemental and smaller cellar , [an apartment about fifteen or sixteen feet square]1947-an apartment about fifteen or sixteen feet square .

' Anything special in [there]290-there ? '[151-racksole] asked [Racksole]151-racksole curiously , as [they]1948-they stood before the door , and looked within at the seined ends of bottles .

' Ah ! '[153-babylon] exclaimed [Babylon]153-babylon , almost smacking [his]153-babylon lips , ' therein lies the cream of all . '[153-babylon]

' The best champagne , [I]151-racksole suppose ? '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole .

' Yes , '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon , ' the best champagne is there - a very special Sillery , as exquisite as [you]3549-you will find anywhere . [You]3549-you have old Burgundy in [that cellar]1547-that cellar , [Mr Racksole]151-racksole , which cost [me]153-babylon - how much do [you]3549-you think ? - eighty pounds a bottle .[153-babylon]

Probably it will never be drunk , ' [he]153-babylon added with a sigh . '[153-babylon] It is too expensive even for [princes]3399-princes and [plutocrats]1950-plutocrats . '[153-babylon]

' Yes , it will , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole quickly . ' [You]3549-you and [I]151-racksole will have a bottle up to - morrow . '[151-racksole]

' Then , '[153-babylon] continued [Babylon]153-babylon , still riding [his]153-babylon hobby - horse , ' there is a sample of the Rhine wine dated 1706 which caused such a sensation at the Vienna Exhibition of 1873 . '[153-babylon]

' Indeed ! '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole . ' Let [us]1951-we go [inside]2801-inside . '[151-racksole]

' What is that ? '[414-the millionaire] asked [the millionaire]414-the millionaire sharply .

' That is merely a ventilation grating . Good ventilation is absolutely essential . '[151-racksole]

' Looks broken , does n't it ? '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole suggested and then , putting a finger quickly on [Babylon]153-babylon 's shoulder , ' there 's [someone]575-someone in [the cellar]1543-the cellar . [The two men]399-the two men stood tense and silent for a while , listening , under the ray of the single electric light in the ceiling . Half [the cellar]1543-the cellar was involved in gloom . At length [Racksole]151-racksole walked firmly down the central passage - way between the bins and turned to the corner at the right .
