Chapter Twenty - Three FURTHER EVENTS IN [THE CELLAR]1543-the cellar

' WELL , [Father]165-father , '[155-nella] [Nella]155-nella greeted [[her]155-nella astounded parent]1960-her astounded parent . ' [You]165-father should make sure that [you]165-father have got hold of [the right person]3559-the right person before [you]165-father use all that terrible muscular force of [yours]165-father . [I]155-nella do believe [you]165-father have broken [my]155-nella shoulder bone . '[155-nella] [She]155-nella rubbed [her]155-nella shoulder with a comical expression of pain , and then stood up before [the two men]399-the two men . The skirt of [her]155-nella dark grey dress was torn and dirty , and [the usually trim Nella]1962-the usually trim nella looked as though [she]155-nella had been shot down a canvas fire - escape . Mechanically [she]155-nella smoothed [her]155-nella frock , and gave a straightening touch to [her]155-nella hair .

' Good evening , [Miss Racksole]155-nella , '[153-babylon] said [Felix Babylon]153-babylon , bowing formally . ' This is an unexpected pleasure . '[153-babylon] [Felix]153-babylon 's drawing - room manners never deserted [him]153-babylon upon any occasion whatever .

' May [I]414-the millionaire inquire what [you]155-nella are doing in [[my]414-the millionaire wine cellar]3560-my wine cellar , [Nella Racksole]155-nella ? '[414-the millionaire] said [the millionaire]414-the millionaire a little stiffly [He]153-babylon was certainly somewhat annoyed at having mistaken [[his]153-babylon daughter]425-his daughter for [a criminal]1965-a criminal ; moreover , [he]153-babylon hated to be surprised , and upon this occasion [he]153-babylon had been surprised beyond any ordinary surprise ; lastly , [he]153-babylon was not at all pleased that [Nella]155-nella should be observed in that strange predicament by [a stranger]1966-a stranger .

' [I]155-nella will tell [you]153-babylon , '[155-nella] said [Nella]155-nella . ' [I]155-nella had been reading rather late in [[my]155-nella room]2645-my room - the night was so close . [I]155-nella heard [Big Ben]231-big ben strike half - past twelve , and then [I]155-nella put the book down , and went out on to the balcony of [my]155-nella window for a little fresh air before going to bed . [I]155-nella leaned over [the balcony]726-the balcony very quietly - [you]153-babylon will remember that [I]155-nella am on [the third floor]849-the third floor now - and looked down below into [the little sunk yard which separates the wall of [the h"tel]340-the h"tel from [Salisbury Lane]120-salisbury lane]3564-the little sunk yard which separates the wall of the h"tel from salisbury lane . [I]155-nella was rather astonished to see a figure creeping across [the yard]1400-the yard . [I]155-nella knew there was no entrance into [the h"tel]340-the h"tel from [that yard]3568-that yard , and besides , it is fifteen or twenty feet below the level of [the street]2669-the street . So [I]155-nella watched . [The figure]3570-the figure went close up against the wall , and disappeared from [my]155-nella view . [I]155-nella leaned over [the balcony]726-the balcony as far as [I]155-nella dared , but [I]155-nella could n't see [him]3570-the figure . [I]155-nella could hear [him]3570-the figure , however . '[155-nella]

' What could [you]155-nella hear ? '[155-nella] questioned [Racksole]155-nella sharply .

' It sounded like a sawing noise , '[155-nella] said [Nella]155-nella ; ' and it went on for quite a long time - nearly a quarter of an hour , [I]155-nella should think - a rasping sort of noise . '[155-nella]

' Why on earth did n't [you]155-nella come and warn [me]155-nella or [someone else in the h"tel]3572-someone else in the h"tel ? '[155-nella] asked [Racksole]155-nella .

' Oh , [I]155-nella do n't know , [Dad]174-dad , '[155-nella] [she]155-nella replied sweetly . ' [I]155-nella had got interested in it , and [I]155-nella thought [I]155-nella would see it out [myself]155-nella . Well , as [I]155-nella was saying , [Mr. Babylon]153-babylon , '[155-nella] [she]155-nella continued , addressing [her]155-nella remarks to [Felix]153-babylon , with a dazzling smile , ' that noise went on for quite a long time . At last it stopped , and [the figure]3570-the figure reappeared from under the wall , crossed [the yard]1400-the yard , climbed up the opposite wall by some means or other , and so over the railings into [Salisbury Lane]120-salisbury lane . [I]155-nella felt rather relieved then , because [I]155-nella knew [he]3570-the figure had n't actually broken into [the h"tel]340-the h"tel . [He]3570-the figure walked down [Salisbury Lane]120-salisbury lane very slowly . [A policeman]3576-a policeman was just coming up . " Goodnight , [officer]3577-officer , " [I]155-nella heard [him]3570-the figure say to [the policeman]3578-the policeman , and [he]3578-the policeman asked [him]3578-the policeman for a match . [The policeman]3578-the policeman supplied the match , and [the other man]3233-the other man lighted a cigarette , and proceeded further down [the lane]1527-the lane . By cricking [your]3582-your neck from [my]155-nella window , [Mr Babylon]153-babylon , [you]3582-your can get a glimpse of [the Embankment]330-the embankment and [the river]2891-the river . [I]155-nella saw [the man]442-the man cross [the Embankment]330-the embankment , and lean over the river wall , where [he]442-the man seemed to be talking to [some one]2992-some one . [He]442-the man then walked along [the Embankment]330-the embankment to [Westminster]121-westminster and that was the last [I]155-nella saw of [him]442-the man . [I]155-nella waited a minute or two for [him]442-the man to come back , but [he]442-the man did n't come back , and so [I]155-nella thought it was about time [I]155-nella began to make inquiries into the affair . [I]155-nella went [downstairs]3183-downstairs instantly , and out of [the h"tel]340-the h"tel , through [the quadrangle]668-the quadrangle , into [Salisbury Lane]120-salisbury lane , and [I]155-nella looked over those railings . There was a ladder on the other side , by which it was perfectly easy - once [you]3592-you had got over the railings - to climb down into [the yard]1400-the yard . [I]155-nella was horribly afraid lest [someone]575-someone might walk up [Salisbury Lane]120-salisbury lane and catch [me]155-nella in the act of negotiating those railings , but [no one]361-no one did , and [I]155-nella surmounted them , with no worse damage than a torn skirt . [I]155-nella crossed [the yard]1400-the yard on tiptoe , and [I]155-nella found that in the wall , close to the ground and almost exactly under [my]155-nella window , there was an iron grating , about one foot by fourteen inches . [I]155-nella suspected , as there was no other ironwork near , that [the mysterious visitor]3597-the mysterious visitor must have been sawing at this grating for private purposes of [his]3597-the mysterious visitor own . [I]155-nella gave it a good shake , and [I]155-nella was not at all surprised that a good part of it came off in [my]155-nella hand , leaving just enough room for [a person]3598-a person to creep through . [I]155-nella decided that [I]155-nella would creep through , and now wish [I]155-nella had n't . [I]155-nella do n't know , [Mr Babylon]153-babylon , whether [you]153-babylon have ever tried to creep through a small hole with a skirt on . Have [you]153-babylon ? '[155-nella]

' [I]153-babylon have not had that pleasure , '[153-babylon] said [little Felix]153-babylon , bowing again , and absently taking up a bottle which lay to [his]153-babylon hand .

' Well , [you]153-babylon are fortunate , '[155-nella] the imperturbable [Nella]155-nella resumed . ' For quite three minutes [I]155-nella thought [I]155-nella should perish in that grating , [Dad]174-dad , with [my]155-nella shoulder inside and the rest of [me]155-nella outside . However , at last , by the most amazing and agonizing efforts , [I]155-nella pulled [myself]155-nella through and fell into [this extraordinary cellar]3599-this extraordinary cellar more dead than alive . Then [I]155-nella wondered what [I]155-nella should do next . Should [I]155-nella wait for [the mysterious visitor]3597-the mysterious visitor to return , and stab [him]3597-the mysterious visitor with [my]155-nella pocket scissors if [he]3597-the mysterious visitor tried to enter , or should [I]155-nella raise an alarm ? First of all [I]155-nella replaced the broken grating , then [I]155-nella struck a match , and [I]155-nella saw that [I]155-nella had got landed in a wilderness of bottles . The match went out , and [I]155-nella had n't another one . So [I]155-nella sat down in the corner to think . [I]155-nella had just decided to wait and see if [the visitor]3601-the visitor returned , when [I]155-nella heard footsteps , and then voices ; and then [you]1967-you came in . [I]155-nella must say [I]155-nella was rather taken aback , especially as [I]155-nella recognized the voice of [Mr Babylon]153-babylon . [You]1967-you see , [I]155-nella did n't want to frighten [you]1967-you .[155-nella]

If [I]0-i had bobbed up from behind the bottles and said " Booh ! " [you]1967-you would have had a serious shock . [I]0-i wanted to think of a way of breaking [my]0-i presence gently to [you]1967-you . But [you]1967-you saved [me]0-i the trouble , [Dad]174-dad . Was [I]0-i really breathing so loudly that [you]174-dad could hear [me]0-i ? '[0-i]

[The girl]577-the girl ended [her]577-the girl strange recital , and there was a moment 's silence in [the cellar]1543-the cellar . [Racksole]155-nella merely nodded an affirmative to [her]155-nella concluding question .

' Well , [Nell]182-nell , [[my]414-the millionaire girl]3303-my girl , '[414-the millionaire] said [the millionaire]414-the millionaire at length , ' [we]3603-we are much obliged for [your]182-nell gymnastic efforts - very much obliged . But now , [I]414-the millionaire think [you]182-nell had better go off to bed . There is going to be some serious trouble here , [I]414-the millionaire 'll lay [my]414-the millionaire last dollar on that ? '[414-the millionaire]

' But if there is to be a burglary [I]155-nella should so like to see it , [Dad]174-dad , '[155-nella] [Nella]155-nella pleaded . ' [I]155-nella 've never seen [a burglar]3604-a burglar caught red - handed . '[155-nella]

' This is n't a burglary , [[my]414-the millionaire dear]2506-my dear . [I]414-the millionaire calculate it 's something far worse than a burglary . '[414-the millionaire]

' What ? '[155-nella] [she]155-nella cried . ' Murder ? Arson ? Dynamite plot ? How perfectly splendid ! '[155-nella]

' [Mr Babylon]153-babylon informs [me]155-nella that [Jules]147-jules is in [London]6-london , '[155-nella] said [Racksole]155-nella quietly .

' [Jules]147-jules ! '[155-nella] [she]155-nella exclaimed under [her]155-nella breath , and [her]155-nella tone changed instantly to the utmost seriousness . ' Switch off the light , quick ! '[155-nella] Springing to the switch , [she]155-nella put [the cellar]1543-the cellar in darkness .

' What 's that for ? '[386-her father] said [[her]155-nella father]386-her father .

' If [he]147-jules comes back [he]147-jules would see the light , and be frightened away , '[155-nella] said [Nella]155-nella . ' That would n't do at all . '[155-nella]

' It would n't , [Miss Racksole]155-nella , '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon , and there was in [his]153-babylon voice a note of admiration for [the girl]577-the girl 's sagacity which [Racksole]155-nella heard with high paternal pride .

' Listen , [Nella]155-nella , '[312-the latter] said [the latter]312-the latter , drawing [[his]312-the latter daughter]425-his daughter to [him]312-the latter in the profound gloom of [the cellar]1543-the cellar . ' [We]3606-we fancy that [Jules]147-jules may be trying to tamper with a certain bottle of wine - a bottle which might possibly be drunk by [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen . Now do [you]155-nella think that [the man [you]155-nella saw]3607-the man you saw might have been [Jules]147-jules ? '[312-the latter]

' [I]1977-i had n't previously thought of [him]147-jules as being [Jules]147-jules , but immediately [you]155-nella mentioned the name [I]1977-i somehow knew that [he]147-jules was . Yes , [I]1977-i am sure it was [Jules]147-jules . '[1977-i]

' Well , just hear what [I]155-nella have to say . There is no time to lose . If [he]147-jules is coming at all [he]147-jules will be [here]2493-here very soon - and [you]155-nella can help . '[155-nella] [Racksole]155-nella explained what [he]1977-i thought [Jules]147-jules ' tactics might be . [He]1977-i proposed that if [the man]442-the man returned [he]147-jules should not be interfered with , but merely watched from the other side of the glass door .[1977-i]

' [You]155-nella want , as it were , to catch [Mr Jules]147-jules alive ? '[153-babylon] said [Babylon]153-babylon , who seemed rather taken aback at this novel method of dealing with [criminals]1822-criminals . ' Surely , '[153-babylon] [he]153-babylon added , ' it would be simpler and easier to inform [the police]673-the police of [your]155-nella suspicion , and to leave everything to [them]673-the police . '[153-babylon]

' [[My]155-nella dear fellow]3537-my dear fellow , '[155-nella] said [Racksole]155-nella , ' [we]3612-we have already gone much too far without [the police]673-the police to make it advisable for [us]3612-we to call [them]673-the police in at this somewhat advanced stage of the proceedings . Besides , if [you]3537-my dear fellow must know it , [I]155-nella have a particular desire to capture [the scoundrel]3614-the scoundrel [myself]155-nella . [I]155-nella will leave [you]3537-my dear fellow and [Nella]155-nella here , since [Nella]155-nella insists on seeing everything , and [I]155-nella will arrange things so that once [he]3614-the scoundrel has entered [the cellar]1543-the cellar [Jules]147-jules will not get out of [it]1543-the cellar again - at any rate through the grating . [You]3537-my dear fellow had better place [yourselves]3537-my dear fellow on the other side of the glass door , in [the big cellar]3616-the big cellar ; [you]3537-my dear fellow will be in a position to observe from there , [I]155-nella will skip off at once . All [you]3537-my dear fellow have to do is to take note of what [the fellow]2768-the fellow does . If [he]2768-the fellow has any accomplices within [the h"tel]340-the h"tel [we]1980-we shall probably be able by that means to discover who [the accomplice]3619-the accomplice is . '[155-nella]

Lighting a match and shading it with [his]1979-his hands , [Racksole]155-nella showed [them]1980-we both out of [the little cellar]1981-the little cellar . ' Now if [you]3537-my dear fellow lock this glass door on the outside [he]2768-the fellow ca n't escape this way : the panes of glass are too small , and the woodwork too stout . So , if [he]2768-the fellow comes into the trap , [[you]3537-my dear fellow two]3620-you two will have the pleasure of actually seeing [him]2768-the fellow frantically writhe therein , without any personal danger ; but perhaps [you]3537-my dear fellow 'd better not show [yourselves]3537-my dear fellow . '[155-nella]

In another moment [Felix Babylon]153-babylon and [Nella]155-nella were left to [themselves]1980-we in the darkness of [the cellar]1543-the cellar , listening to the receding footfalls of [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole . But the sound of these footfalls had not died away before another sound greeted [their]1980-we ears - the grating of [the small cellar]1983-the small cellar was being removed .

' [I]153-babylon hope [[your]577-the girl father]2828-your father will be in time , '[153-babylon] whispered [Felix]153-babylon

' Hush ! '[577-the girl] [the girl]577-the girl warned [him]153-babylon , and [they]1980-we stooped side by side in tense silence .

[A man]2659-a man cautiously but very neatly wormed [his]2659-a man body through the aperture of the grating . [The watchers]1986-the watchers could only see [his]2659-a man form indistinctly in the darkness .

Then , being fairly within [the cellar]1543-the cellar , [he]2659-a man walked without the least hesitation to the electric switch and turned on the light . It was unmistakably [Jules]147-jules , and [he]2659-a man knew the geography of [the cellar]1543-the cellar very well . [Babylon]153-babylon could with difficulty repress a start as [he]153-babylon saw [this bold and unscrupulous ex - waiter]1989-this bold and unscrupulous ex - waiter moving with such an air of assurance and determination about [the precious cellar]1990-the precious cellar . [Jules]147-jules went directly to a small bin which was numbered 17 , and took there from the topmost bottle .

' [The Romanee - Conti - Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen 's wine ! '[153-babylon] [Babylon]153-babylon exclaimed under [his]153-babylon breath .

[Jules]147-jules neatly and quickly removed the seal with an instrument which [he]147-jules had clearly brought for the purpose . [He]147-jules then took a little flat box from [his]147-jules pocket , which seemed to contain a sort of black salve . Rubbing [his]147-jules finger in this , [he]147-jules smeared the top of the neck of the bottle with it , just where the cork came against the glass . In another instant [he]147-jules had deftly replaced the seal and restored the bottle to its position . [He]147-jules then turned off the light , and made for the aperture . When [he]147-jules was half - way through [Nella]155-nella exclaimed , ' [He]147-jules will escape , after all . [Dad]174-dad has not had time - [we]3622-we must stop [him]147-jules . '[155-nella]

But [Babylon]153-babylon , that embodiment of caution , forcibly , but nevertheless politely , restrained [this Yankee girl]1991-this yankee girl , whom [he]153-babylon deemed so rash and imprudent , and before [she]1991-this yankee girl could free [herself]1991-this yankee girl the lithe form of [Jules]147-jules had disappeared .

Chapter Twenty - Four THE BOTTLE OF WINE

AS regards [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole , who was to have caught [[his]151-racksole man]1992-his man from the outside of [the cellar]1543-the cellar , [he]151-racksole made [his]151-racksole way as rapidly as possible from [the wine - cellars]1994-the wine - cellars , up to [the ground floor]1667-the ground floor , out of [the h"tel by [the quadrangle]668-the quadrangle]1996-the h"tel by the quadrangle , through [the quadrangle]668-the quadrangle , and out into [the top of [Salisbury Lane]120-salisbury lane]1999-the top of salisbury lane . Now , owing to the vastness of the structure of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon , the mere distance thus to be traversed amounted to a little short of a quarter of a mile , and , as it included [a number of stairs]2001-a number of stairs , about two dozen turnings , and [several passages which at that time of night were in darkness more or less complete]2002-several passages which at that time of night were in darkness more or less complete , [Racksole]151-racksole could not have been expected to accomplish the journey in less than five minutes . As a matter of fact , six minutes had elapsed before [he]151-racksole reached [the top of [Salisbury Lane]120-salisbury lane]1999-the top of salisbury lane , because [he]151-racksole had been delayed nearly a minute by some questions addressed to [him]151-racksole by [a muddled and whisky - laden guest]2004-a muddled and whisky - laden guest who had got lost in [the corridors]531-the corridors . As [everybody]2006-everybody knows , there is a sharp short bend in [Salisbury Lane]120-salisbury lane near the top . [Racksole]151-racksole ran round this at good racing speed , but [he]151-racksole was unfortunate enough to run straight up against [the very policeman who had not long before so courteously supplied [Jules]147-jules]2007-the very policeman who had not long before so courteously supplied jules with a match . [The policeman]3578-the policeman seemed to be scarcely in so pliant a mood just then .

' Hullo ! '[3578-the policeman] [he]3578-the policeman said , [his]3578-the policeman naturally suspicious nature being doubtless aroused by the spectacle of [a bareheaded man in evening dress]2009-a bareheaded man in evening dress running violently down [the lane]1527-the lane . ' What 's this ? Where are [you]151-racksole for in such a hurry ? '[3578-the policeman] and [he]3578-the policeman forcibly detained [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole for a moment and scrutinized [his]151-racksole face .

' Now , [officer]3577-officer , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole quietly , ' none of [your]3577-officer larks , if [you]3577-officer please .[151-racksole]

[I]0-i 've no time to lose . '[0-i]

' Beg [your]151-racksole pardon , [sir]2479-sir , '[3578-the policeman] [the policeman]3578-the policeman remarked , though hesitatingly and not quite with good temper , and [Racksole]151-racksole was allowed to proceed on [his]151-racksole way . [The millionaire]414-the millionaire 's scheme for trapping [Jules]147-jules was to get down into [the little sunk yard]2013-the little sunk yard by means of the ladder , and then to secrete [himself]151-racksole behind some convenient abutment of brickwork until [Mr Tom Jackson]191-mr tom jackson should have got into [the cellar]1543-the cellar . [He]151-racksole therefore nimbly surmounted the railings - the railings of [[his]151-racksole own h"tel]2015-his own h"tel - and was gingerly descending the ladder , when lo ! a rough hand seized [him]151-racksole by the coat - collar and with a ferocious jerk urged [him]151-racksole backwards . The fact was , [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole had counted without [the policeman]3578-the policeman . [That guardian of the peace]2017-that guardian of the peace , mistrusting [Racksole]151-racksole 's manner , quietly followed [him]151-racksole down [the lane]1527-the lane . The sight of [the millionaire climbing the railings]2019-the millionaire climbing the railings had put [him]151-racksole on [his]151-racksole mettle , and the result was the ignominious capture of [Racksole]151-racksole . In vain [Theodore]151-racksole expostulated , explained , anathematized . Only one thing would satisfy [the stolid policeman]2020-the stolid policeman - namely , that [Racksole]151-racksole should return with [him]2020-the stolid policeman to [the h"tel]340-the h"tel and there establish [his]151-racksole identity . If [Racksole]151-racksole then proved to be [Racksole]151-racksole , [owner of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]2022-owner of the grand babylon , well and good - [the policeman]3578-the policeman promised to apologize . So [Theodore]151-racksole had no alternative but to accept the suggestion . To prove [his]151-racksole identity was , of course , the work of only a few minutes , after which [Racksole]151-racksole , annoyed , but cool as ever , returned to [his]151-racksole railings , while [the policeman]3578-the policeman went off to another part of [[his]3578-the policeman beat]2026-his beat , where [he]3578-the policeman would be likely to meet [a comrade]2027-a comrade and have a chat .

In the meantime , [[our]2028-our friend]2029-our friend [Jules]147-jules , sublimely unconscious of the altercation going on outside , and of the special risk which [he]147-jules ran , was of course actually in [the cellar]1543-the cellar , which [he]147-jules had reached before [Racksole]151-racksole got to the railings for the first time . It was , indeed , a happy chance for [Jules]147-jules that [his]147-jules exit from [the cellar]1543-the cellar coincided with the period during which [Racksole]151-racksole was absent from the railings . As [Racksole]151-racksole came down [the lane]1527-the lane for the second time , [he]151-racksole saw a figure walking about fifty yards in front of [him]151-racksole towards [the Embankment]330-the embankment . Instantly [he]151-racksole divined that it was [Jules]147-jules , and that [the policeman]3578-the policeman had thrown [him]151-racksole just too late . [He]151-racksole ran , and [Jules]147-jules , hearing the noise of pursuit , ran also . [The ex - waiter]2035-the ex - waiter was fleet ; [he]2035-the ex - waiter made direct for a certain spot in the Embankment wall , and , to the intense astonishment of [Racksole]151-racksole , jumped clean over the wall , as it seemed , into [the river]2891-the river . ' Is [he]414-the millionaire so desperate as to commit suicide ? '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole exclaimed as [he]151-racksole ran , but a second later the puff and snort of a steam launch told [him]151-racksole that [Jules]147-jules was not quite driven to suicide . As [the millionaire]414-the millionaire crossed [the Embankment roadway]2038-the embankment roadway [he]414-the millionaire saw the funnel of the launch move out from under the river - wall . [It]2039-it swerved into midstream and headed towards [London Bridge]122-london bridge . There was a silent mist over [the river]2891-the river . [Racksole]151-racksole was helpless ....

Although [Racksole]151-racksole had now been twice worsted in a contest of wits within [the precincts of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]315-the precincts of the grand babylon , once by [Rocco]199-rocco and once by [Jules]147-jules , [he]151-racksole could not fairly blame [himself]151-racksole for the present miscarriage of [his]151-racksole plans - a miscarriage due to the meddlesomeness of [an extraneous person]2043-an extraneous person , combined with pure ill - fortune . [He]151-racksole did not , therefore , permit the accident to interfere with [his]151-racksole sleep that night .

On the following day [he]151-racksole sought out [Prince Aribert]167-aribert , between whom and [himself]151-racksole there now existed a feeling of unmistakable , frank friendship , and disclosed to [him]167-aribert the happenings of the previous night , and particularly the tampering with the bottle of [Romanée - Conti]233-romanée - conti .

' [I]151-racksole believe [you]151-racksole dined with [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen last night ? '[151-racksole]

' [I]151-racksole did . And curiously enough [we]3625-we had a bottle of Romanée - Conti , an admirable wine , of which [Eugen]180-prince eugen is passionately fond . '[151-racksole]

' And [you]151-racksole will dine with [him]180-prince eugen to - night ? '[151-racksole]

' Most probably . To - day will , [I]151-racksole fear , be [our]3625-we last day here . [Eugen]180-prince eugen wishes to return to [Posen]167-aribert early to - morrow . '[151-racksole]

' Has it struck [you]167-aribert , [Prince]180-prince eugen , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole , ' that if [Jules]147-jules had succeeded in poisoning [[your]167-aribert nephew]2836-your nephew , [he]147-jules would probably have succeeded also in poisoning [you]167-aribert ? '[151-racksole]

' [I]167-aribert had not thought of it , '[167-aribert] laughed [Aribert]167-aribert , ' but it would seem so . It appears that so long as [he]147-jules brings down [[his]147-jules particular quarry]3627-his particular quarry , [Jules]147-jules is careless of anything else that may be accidentally involved in the destruction . However , [we]3625-we need have no fear on that score now . [You]151-racksole know the bottle , and [you]151-racksole can destroy it at once . '[167-aribert]

' But [I]151-racksole do not propose to destroy it , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole calmly . ' If [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen asks for [Romanée - Conti]233-romanée - conti to be served to - night , as [he]180-prince eugen probably will , [I]151-racksole propose that that precise bottle shall be served to [him]180-prince eugen - and to [you]151-racksole . '[151-racksole]

' Then [you]151-racksole would poison [us]3625-we in spite of [ourselves]3625-we ? '[167-aribert]

' Scarcely , '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole smiled . ' [My]151-racksole notion is to discover [the accomplices within the h"tel]3628-the accomplices within the h"tel . [I]151-racksole have already inquired as to [the wine - clerk]3533-the wine - clerk , [Hubbard]229-hubbard . Now does it not occur to [you]151-racksole as extraordinary that on this particular day [Mr Hubbard]229-hubbard should be ill in bed ? [Hubbard]229-hubbard , [I]151-racksole am informed , is suffering from an attack of stomach poisoning , which has supervened during the night . [He]229-hubbard says that [he]229-hubbard does not know what can have caused it . [[His]229-hubbard place in [the wine cellars]3631-the wine cellars]3630-his place in the wine cellars will be taken to - day by [[his]229-hubbard assistant]3632-his assistant , [a mere youth]1480-a mere youth , but to all appearances [a fairly smart youth]3634-a fairly smart youth . [I]151-racksole need not say that [we]3635-we shall keep an eye on [that youth]3636-that youth . '[151-racksole]

' One moment , '[167-aribert] [Prince Aribert]167-aribert interrupted . ' [I]167-aribert do not quite understand how [you]151-racksole think the poisoning was to have been effected . '[167-aribert]

' The bottle is now under examination by [an expert]3520-an expert , who has instructions to remove as little as possible of the stuff which [Jules]147-jules put on the rim of the mouth of it . It will be secretly replaced in its bin during the day . [My]167-aribert idea is that by the mere action of pouring out the wine takes up some of the poison , which [I]167-aribert deem to be very strong , and thus becomes fatal as it enters the glass . '[167-aribert]

' But surely [the servant in attendance]3638-the servant in attendance would wipe the mouth of the bottle ? '[167-aribert]

' Very carelessly , perhaps . And moreover [he]3638-the servant in attendance would be extremely unlikely to wipe off all the stuff ; some of it has been ingeniously placed just on the inside edge of the rim . Besides , suppose [he]3638-the servant in attendance forgot to wipe the bottle ? '[167-aribert]

' [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen is always served at dinner by [Hans]223-hans . It is an honour which [the faithful old fellow]3639-the faithful old fellow reserves for [himself]3639-the faithful old fellow . '[167-aribert]

' But suppose [Hans]223-hans - '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole stopped .

' [Hans]223-hans an accomplice ! [[My]151-racksole dear]2506-my dear [Racksole]151-racksole , the suggestion is wildly impossible . '[151-racksole]

That night [Prince Aribert]167-aribert dined with [[his]167-aribert august nephew]2044-his august nephew in [the superb dining - room of [the Royal apartments]2046-the royal apartments]2045-the superb dining - room of the royal apartments . [Hans]223-hans served , the dishes being brought to the door by [other servants]2047-other servants . [Aribert]167-aribert found [[his]167-aribert nephew]2586-his nephew despondent and taciturn . On the previous day , when , after the futile interview with [Sampson Levi]184-mr sampson levi , [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen had despairingly threatened to commit suicide , in such a manner as to make it ' look like an accident '[167-aribert] , [Aribert]167-aribert had compelled [him]180-prince eugen to give [his]180-prince eugen word of honour not to do so .

' What wine will [[your]167-aribert Royal Highness]3445-your royal highness take ? '[223-hans] asked [old Hans]223-hans in [his]223-hans soothing tones , when the soup was served .

' Sherry , '[180-prince eugen] was [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen 's curt order .

' And [Romanée - Conti]233-romanée - conti afterwards ? '[223-hans] said [Hans]223-hans . [Aribert]167-aribert looked up quickly .

' No , not to - night . [I]180-prince eugen 'll try Sillery to - night , '[180-prince eugen] said [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen .

' [I]180-prince eugen think [I]180-prince eugen 'll have [Romanée - Conti]233-romanée - conti , [Hans]223-hans , after all , '[180-prince eugen] [he]180-prince eugen said . ' It suits [me]180-prince eugen better than champagne . '[180-prince eugen]

The famous and unsurpassable [Burgundy]94-burgundy was served with the roast . [Old Hans]223-hans brought it tenderly in its wicker cradle , inserted the corkscrew with mathematical precision , and drew the cork , which [he]223-hans offered for [[his]223-hans master]1074-his master 's inspection . [Eugen]180-prince eugen nodded , and told [him]223-hans to put it down . [Aribert]167-aribert watched with intense interest . [He]167-aribert could not for an instant believe that [Hans]223-hans was not the very soul of fidelity , and yet , despite [himself]167-aribert , [Racksole]151-racksole 's words had caused [him]167-aribert a certain uneasiness . At that moment [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen murmured across the table :

' [Aribert]167-aribert , [I]180-prince eugen withdraw [my]180-prince eugen promise . Observe that , [I]180-prince eugen withdraw it . '[180-prince eugen] [Aribert]167-aribert shook [his]167-aribert head emphatically , without removing [his]167-aribert gaze from [Hans]223-hans . [The white - haired servant]2050-the white - haired servant perfunctorily dusted [his]2050-the white - haired servant napkin round the neck of the bottle of [Romanée - Conti]233-romanée - conti , and poured out a glass . [Aribert]167-aribert trembled from head to foot .

[Eugen]180-prince eugen took up the glass and held it to the light .

' Do n't drink it , '[167-aribert] said [Aribert]167-aribert very quietly . ' [It]233-romanée - conti is poisoned . '[167-aribert]

' Poisoned ! '[180-prince eugen] exclaimed [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen .

' Poisoned , [sire]3397-sire ! '[223-hans] exclaimed [old Hans]223-hans , with an air of profound amazement and concern , and [he]223-hans seized the glass . ' Impossible , [sire]3397-sire . [I]223-hans [myself]223-hans opened the bottle . [No one else]3248-no one else has touched it , and the cork was perfect . '[223-hans]

' [I]167-aribert tell [you]223-hans it is poisoned , '[167-aribert] [Aribert]167-aribert repeated .

' [[Your]3397-sire Highness]2783-your highness will pardon [an old man]3646-an old man , '[223-hans] said [Hans]223-hans , ' but to say that this wine is poison is to say that [I]223-hans am [a murderer]3647-a murderer . [I]223-hans will prove to [you]3397-sire that it is not poisoned . [I]223-hans will drink it . '[223-hans] And [he]223-hans raised the glass to [his]223-hans trembling lips . In that moment [Aribert]167-aribert saw that [old Hans]223-hans , at any rate , was not [an accomplice of [Jules]147-jules]2051-an accomplice of jules . Springing up from [his]167-aribert seat , [he]167-aribert knocked the glass from [the aged servitor]2052-the aged servitor 's hands , and the fragments of it fell with a light tinkling crash partly on the table and partly on the floor . [The Prince]2578-the prince and [the servant]638-the servant gazed at [one another]2055-one another in a distressing and terrible silence .

There was a slight noise , and [Aribert]167-aribert looked aside . [He]167-aribert saw that [Eugen]180-prince eugen 's body had slipped forward limply over the left arm of [his]2578-the prince chair ; [the Prince]2578-the prince 's arms hung straight and lifeless ; [his]2578-the prince eyes were closed ; [he]2578-the prince was unconscious .

' [Hans]223-hans ! '[167-aribert] murmured [Aribert]167-aribert . ' [Hans]223-hans ! What is this ? '[167-aribert]

Chapter Twenty - Five [THE STEAM LAUNCH]2057-the steam launch

[MR TOM JACKSON]191-mr tom jackson 's notion of making good [his]191-mr tom jackson escape from the h"tel by means of a steam launch was an excellent one , so far as it went , but [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole , for [his]151-racksole part , did not consider that it went quite far enough .

[Theodore Racksole]151-racksole opined , with peculiar glee , that [he]151-racksole now had a tangible and definite clue for the catching of [[the Grand Babylon]162-the grand babylon 's ex - waiter]2058-the grand babylon 's ex - waiter . [He]151-racksole knew nothing of [the Port of [London]6-london]2059-the port of london , but [he]151-racksole happened to know a good deal of [the far more complicated , though somewhat smaller , Port of [New York]1-new york]2060-the far more complicated , though somewhat smaller , port of new york , and [he]151-racksole was sure there ought to be no extraordinary difficulty in getting hold of [Jules]147-jules ' steam launch . To [those who are not thoroughly familiar with [it]2057-the steam launch [the River Thames]123-the river thames and [[its]123-the river thames docks]3649-its docks]3648-those who are not thoroughly familiar with it the river thames and its docks , from [London Bridge]122-london bridge to [Gravesend]124-gravesend , seems [a vast and uncharted wilderness of craft]3650-a vast and uncharted wilderness of craft - a wilderness in which it would be perfectly easy to hide even a three - master successfully . To [such people]3651-such people the idea of looking for [a steam launch on [the river]2891-the river]3652-a steam launch on the river would be about equivalent to the idea of looking for a needle in a bundle of hay . But the fact is , there are [hundreds of men between [St Katherine 's Wharf]125-st katherine 's wharf and [Blackwall]126-blackwall who literally know [the Thames]11-the thames as [the suburban householder]3655-the suburban householder knows [[his]3655-the suburban householder back - garden]3656-his back - garden]3654-hundreds of men between st katherine 's wharf and blackwall who literally know the thames as the suburban householder knows his back - garden - who can recognize [thousands of ships]3657-thousands of ships and put a name to [them]3657-thousands of ships at a distance of half a mile , who are informed as to every movement of vessels on [the great stream]3658-the great stream , who know [all the captains]3659-all the captains , [all [the engineers]3661-the engineers , all [the lightermen]3662-the lightermen , all [the pilots]3663-the pilots , all [the licensed watermen]3664-the licensed watermen , and [all the unlicensed scoundrels from [the Tower]3666-the tower to [Gravesend]124-gravesend]3665-all the unlicensed scoundrels from the tower to gravesend , and a lot further . By [these experts of [the Thames]11-the thames]3667-these experts of the thames]3660-all the engineers , all the lightermen , all the pilots , all the licensed watermen , and all the unlicensed scoundrels from the tower to gravesend , and a lot further . by these experts of the thames the slightest unusual event on [the water]996-the water is noticed and discussed - a wherry can not change hands but [they]3667-these experts of the thames will guess shrewdly upon the price paid and the intentions of [the new owner]3669-the new owner with regard to it . [They]3667-these experts of the thames have a habit of watching [the river]2891-the river for the mere interest of the sight , and [they]3667-these experts of the thames talk about everything like [housewives gathered of an evening round the cottage door]3671-housewives gathered of an evening round the cottage door . If [the first mate of a Castle Liner]3672-the first mate of a castle liner gets the sack [they]3667-these experts of the thames will be able to tell [you]3673-you what [he]3672-the first mate of a castle liner said to [the captain]1361-the captain , what [the old man]1737-the old man said to [him]3672-the first mate of a castle liner , and what both said to [the Board]3676-the board , and having finished off that affair [they]3667-these experts of the thames will cheerfully turn to discussing whether [Bill Stevens]235-bill stevens sank [[his]235-bill stevens barge]3677-his barge outside [the West Indian No.2]3678-the west indian no.2 by accident or on purpose .[151-racksole]

[Theodore Racksole]151-racksole had no satisfactory means of identifying the steam launch which carried away [Mr Tom Jackson]191-mr tom jackson . The sky had clouded over soon after midnight , and there was also a slight mist , and [he]151-racksole had only been able to make out that it was a low craft , about sixty feet long , probably painted black . [He]151-racksole had personally kept a watch all through the night on vessels going upstream , and during the next morning [he]151-racksole had [a man to take [his]151-racksole place who warned [him]151-racksole whenever [a steam launch]2062-a steam launch went towards [Westminster]121-westminster]2061-a man to take his place who warned him whenever a steam launch went towards westminster . At noon , after [his]151-racksole conversation with [Prince Aribert]167-aribert , [he]151-racksole went down [the river]2891-the river in [a hired row - boat]2064-a hired row - boat as far as [the Custom House]921-the custom house , and poked about everywhere , in search of any vessel which could by any possibility be [the one [he]151-racksole was in search of]2066-the one he was in search of .

But [he]151-racksole found nothing . [He]151-racksole was , therefore , tolerably sure that [the mysterious launch]2067-the mysterious launch lay somewhere below [the Custom House]921-the custom house . At [the Custom House]921-the custom house stairs , [he]151-racksole landed , and asked for [a very high official]2070-a very high official - [an official inferior only to [a Commissioner]2072-a commissioner - whom [he]151-racksole had entertained once in [New York]1-new york , and who had met [him]151-racksole in [London]6-london on business at [Lloyd 's]127-lloyd 's]2071-an official inferior only to a commissioner - whom he had entertained once in new york , and who had met him in london on business at lloyd 's . In [the large but dingy office of]2073-the large but dingy office of [this great man]2074-this great man a long conversation took place - a conversation in which [Racksole]151-racksole had to exercise a certain amount of persuasive power , and which ultimately ended in [the high official]2075-the high official ringing [his]2075-the high official bell .

' [Desire Mr Hazell]236-hazell - room No . 332 - to speak to [me]2076-the official , '[2076-the official] said [the official]2076-the official to [the boy who answered the summons]2077-the boy who answered the summons , and then , turning to [Racksole]151-racksole : ' [I]2076-the official need hardly repeat , [[my]2076-the official dear]2506-my dear [Mr Racksole]151-racksole , that this is strictly unofficial . '[2076-the official]

' Agreed , of course , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole .

[Mr Hazell]236-hazell entered . [He]236-hazell was [a young man of about thirty , dressed in blue serge , with a pale , keen face , a brown moustache and a rather handsome brown beard]2078-a young man of about thirty , dressed in blue serge , with a pale , keen face , a brown moustache and a rather handsome brown beard .

' [Mr Hazell]236-hazell , '[2075-the high official] said [the high official]2075-the high official , ' let [me]2075-the high official introduce [you]236-hazell to [Mr Theodore Racksole]151-racksole - [you]236-hazell will doubtless be familiar with [his]151-racksole name . Just now [he]236-hazell is doing night duty . [He]236-hazell has [a boat]3683-a boat on [the river]2891-the river and [a couple of men]3685-a couple of men , and the right to board and examine any craft whatever . What [Mr Hazell]236-hazell and [[his]236-hazell crew]3686-his crew do n't know about [the Thames]11-the thames between here and [Gravesend]124-gravesend is n't knowledge . '[2075-the high official]

' Glad to meet [you]236-hazell , [sir]2479-sir , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole simply , and [they]2080-they shook hands .

[Racksole]151-racksole observed with satisfaction that [Mr Hazell]236-hazell was entirely at [his]236-hazell ease .

' Now , [Hazell]236-hazell , '[2075-the high official] [the high official]2075-the high official continued , ' [Mr Racksole]151-racksole wants [you]236-hazell to help in a little private expedition on [the river]2891-the river to - night . [I]2075-the high official will give [you]236-hazell a night 's leave . [I]2075-the high official sent for [you]236-hazell partly because [I]2075-the high official thought [you]236-hazell would enjoy the affair and partly because [I]2075-the high official think [I]2075-the high official can rely on [you]236-hazell to regard it as entirely unofficial and not to talk about it . [You]236-hazell understand ? [I]2075-the high official dare say [you]236-hazell will have no cause to regret having obliged [Mr Racksole]151-racksole . '[2075-the high official]

' [I]236-hazell think [I]236-hazell grasp the situation , '[236-hazell] said [Hazell]236-hazell , with a slight smile .

' And , by the way , '[2075-the high official] added [the high official]2075-the high official , ' although the business is unofficial , it might be well if [you]236-hazell wore [your]236-hazell official overcoat . See ? '[2075-the high official]

' Decidedly , '[236-hazell] said [Hazell]236-hazell ; ' [I]236-hazell should have done so in any case . '[236-hazell]

' And now , [Mr Hazell]236-hazell , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole , ' will [you]236-hazell do [me]151-racksole the pleasure of lunching with [me]151-racksole ? So it came to pass that [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole and [George Hazell]236-hazell , [outdoor clerk in [the Customs]2084-the customs]2083-outdoor clerk in the customs , lunched together at ' [[Thomas]191-mr tom jackson 's Chop - House]128-thomas 's chop - house '[2084-the customs] , in [the city of]2085-the city of [London]6-london , upon mutton - chops and coffee . [The millionaire]414-the millionaire soon discovered that [he]414-the millionaire had got hold of [a keen - witted man]2087-a keen - witted man and [a person of much insight]2088-a person of much insight .

' Tell [me]236-hazell , '[236-hazell] said [Hazell]236-hazell , when [they]2089-they had reached the cigarette stage , ' are [the magazine writers]3690-the magazine writers anything like correct ? '[236-hazell]

' What do [you]0-i mean ? '[151-racksole] asked [Racksole]151-racksole , mystified .

' Well , [you]0-i 're[2537-a millionaire] [a millionaire]2537-a millionaire - " one of the best " , [I]0-i believe . [One]277-one often sees articles on and interviews with [millionaires]406-millionaires , which describe [[their]406-millionaires [private railroad cars]2094-private railroad cars]2093-their private railroad cars , [[their]406-millionaires steam yachts on [the Hudson]129-the hudson]2095-their steam yachts on the hudson , [[their]406-millionaires [marble stables]2097-marble stables]2096-their marble stables , and so on , and so on . ' [I]151-racksole have [a private car]3691-a private car on the [New York Central]130-new york central , and [I]151-racksole have [a two thousand ton schooner - yacht]3692-a two thousand ton schooner - yacht - though it is n't on [the Hudson]129-the hudson . '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole laughed .

' Ah ! '[236-hazell] said [Hazell]236-hazell . ' Now [I]236-hazell can believe that [I]236-hazell am lunching with [a millionaire]2537-a millionaire .[236-hazell]

It 's strange how facts like those - unimportant in themselves - appeal to the imagination . [You]151-racksole seem to [me]0-i [a real millionaire]2098-a real millionaire now . [You]151-racksole 've given [me]0-i some personal information ; [I]0-i 'll give [you]151-racksole some in return . [I]0-i earn three hundred a year , and perhaps sixty pounds a year extra for overtime . [I]0-i live by [myself]0-i in [two rooms in [Muscovy Court]132-muscovy court]2099-two rooms in muscovy court . [I]0-i 've as much money as [I]0-i need , and [I]0-i always do exactly what [I]0-i like outside [office]2100-office . As regards [the office]2776-the office , [I]0-i do as little work as [I]0-i can , on principle - it 's a fight between [us]2102-we and [the Commissioners]2103-the commissioners who shall get the best . [They]2103-the commissioners try to do [us]2102-we down , and [we]2102-we try to do [them]2103-the commissioners down - it 's pretty even on the whole . All 's fair in war , [you]151-racksole know , and there ai n't no ten commandments in [a Government office]2104-a government office . '[151-racksole]

[Racksole]151-racksole laughed . ' Can [you]236-hazell get off this afternoon ? '[151-racksole] [he]151-racksole asked .

' Certainly , '[236-hazell] said [Hazell]236-hazell ; ' [I]236-hazell 'll get [one of [[my]236-hazell pals]3697-my pals]3696-one of my pals to sign on for [me]236-hazell , and then [I]236-hazell shall be free . '[236-hazell]

' Well , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole , ' [I]151-racksole should like [you]236-hazell to come down with [me]151-racksole to [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon . Then [we]2102-we can talk over [my]151-racksole little affair at length . And may [we]2102-we go on [[your]236-hazell boat]3699-your boat ? [I]151-racksole want to meet [[your]236-hazell crew]3700-your crew . '[151-racksole]

' That will be all right , '[236-hazell] [Hazell]236-hazell remarked . ' [[My]236-hazell two men]3701-my two men are [the idlest , most soul - less chaps [you]236-hazell ever saw]3702-the idlest , most soul - less chaps you ever saw . '[236-hazell]

That night , just after dark , [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole embarked with [[his]151-racksole new friend]2105-his new friend [George Hazell]236-hazell in one of [the black - painted Customs wherries]2106-the black - painted customs wherries , manned by [a crew of [two men]662-two men]2107-a crew of two men - both [the later freemen of [the river]2891-the river]2109-the later freemen of the river , a distinction which carries with it certain privileges unfamiliar to [the mere landsman]2111-the mere landsman . It was a cloudy and oppressive evening , not a star showing to illumine the slow tide , now just past its flood . The vast forms of [steamers at anchor]2112-steamers at anchor - chiefly those of [the General Steam Navigation]2113-the general steam navigation and the Aberdeen Line - heaved [themselves]2107-a crew of two men high out of the water , straining sluggishly at [their]2107-a crew of two men mooring buoys . On either side the naked walls of [warehouses]2114-warehouses rose like grey precipices from [the stream]2115-the stream , holding forth quaint arms of [steam - cranes]2116-steam - cranes . To the west [the Tower Bridge]2117-the tower bridge spanned [the river]2891-the river with [its]2117-the tower bridge formidable arch , and above that [its]2117-the tower bridge suspended footpath - a hundred and fifty feet from earth .

Down towards the east and [the Pool of London a forest of funnels and masts]2119-the pool of london a forest of funnels and masts was dimly outlined against the sinister sky . [Huge barges]2120-huge barges , each steered by [a single man at the end of a pair of giant oars]2121-a single man at the end of a pair of giant oars , lumbered and swirled down - stream at all angles . Occasionally a tug snorted busily past , flashing its red and green signals and dragging an unwieldy tail of barges in its wake . Then [a Margate passenger steamer ,]2122-a margate passenger steamer , [its]2122-a margate passenger steamer , electric lights gleaming from every porthole , swerved round to anchor , with [its]2122-a margate passenger steamer , load of [two thousand fatigued excursionists]2123-two thousand fatigued excursionists . Over everything brooded an air of mystery - a spirit and feeling of strangeness , remoteness , and the inexplicable . As the broad flat little boat bobbed its way under the shadow of enormous hulks , beneath stretched hawsers , and past buoys covered with green slime , [Racksole]151-racksole could scarcely believe that [he]151-racksole was in [the very heart of [London]6-london]1239-the very heart of london - [the most prosaic city in [the world]311-the world]2125-the most prosaic city in the world . [He]151-racksole had a queer idea that almost anything might happen in [this seeming waste of waters]2127-this seeming waste of waters at this weird hour of ten o'clock . It appeared incredible to [him]151-racksole that only a mile or two away [people]2848-people were sitting in theatres applauding farces , and that at [Cannon Street Station]133-cannon street station , a few yards off , [other people]975-other people were calmly taking [the train]2130-the train to [various highly respectable suburbs whose names [he]151-racksole was gradually learning]2131-various highly respectable suburbs whose names he was gradually learning . [He]151-racksole had the uplifting sensation of being in another world which comes to [us]2132-us sometimes amid surroundings violently different from [our]2132-us usual surroundings . The most ordinary noises - of [men calling , of a chain running through a slot , of a distant siren]2133-men calling , of a chain running through a slot , of a distant siren - translated themselves to [his]151-racksole ears into terrible and haunting sounds , full of portentous significance . [He]151-racksole looked over the side of [the boat]3225-the boat into [the brown water]2135-the brown water , and asked [himself]151-racksole what frightful secrets lay hidden in [its]3225-the boat depth . Then [he]151-racksole put [his]151-racksole hand into [his]151-racksole hip - pocket and touched the stock of [his]151-racksole Colt revolver - that familiar substance comforted [him]151-racksole .

[The oarsmen]2136-the oarsmen had instructions to drop slowly down to [the Pool]2137-the pool , as the wide reach below [the Tower]134-the tower is called . [These two men]2138-these two men had not been previously informed of the precise object of the expedition , but now that [they]2138-these two men were safely afloat [Hazell]236-hazell judged it expedient to give [them]2138-these two men some notion of it . ' [We]2138-these two men expect to come across [a rather suspicious steam launch]3704-a rather suspicious steam launch , '[236-hazell] [he]236-hazell said . ' [[My]236-hazell friend here]3705-my friend here is very anxious to get a sight of [her]3704-a rather suspicious steam launch , and until [he]3705-my friend here has seen [her]3704-a rather suspicious steam launch nothing definite can be done . '[236-hazell]

' What sort of a craft is [she]3704-a rather suspicious steam launch , [sir]2479-sir ? '[2139-the stroke oar] asked [the stroke oar]2139-the stroke oar , [a fat - faced man who seemed absolutely incapable of any serious exertion]2140-a fat - faced man who seemed absolutely incapable of any serious exertion .

' [I]151-racksole do n't know , '[151-racksole] [Racksole]151-racksole replied ; ' but as near as [I]151-racksole can judge , [she]3704-a rather suspicious steam launch 's about sixty feet in length , and painted black . [I]151-racksole fancy [I]151-racksole shall recognize [her]3704-a rather suspicious steam launch when [I]151-racksole see [her]3704-a rather suspicious steam launch . '[151-racksole]

' Not much to go by , that , '[3233-the other man] exclaimed [the other man]3233-the other man curtly . But [he]3233-the other man said no more . [He]3233-the other man , as well as [[his]3233-the other man mate]2142-his mate , had received from [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole [one English sovereign]2143-one english sovereign as a kind of preliminary fee , and [an English sovereign]2144-an english sovereign will do a lot towards silencing the natural sarcastic tendencies and free speech of [a Thames waterman]2145-a thames waterman .

Chapter Twenty - Seven THE CONFESSION OF [MR TOM JACKSON]191-mr tom jackson

IT happened that [the small bedroom occupied by [Jules]147-jules]2260-the small bedroom occupied by jules during the years [he]147-jules was [head - waiter at [the Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon]2261-head - waiter at the grand babylon had remained empty since [his]147-jules sudden dismissal by [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole . [No other head - waiter]2262-no other head - waiter had been formally appointed in [[his]147-jules place]2263-his place ; and , indeed , the absence of [one man]2264-one man - even the unique [Jules]147-jules - could scarcely have been noticed in the enormous staff of [a place like [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]3515-a place like the grand babylon . The functions of [a head - waiter]2267-a head - waiter are generally more ornamental , spectacular , and morally impressive than useful , and it was so at [the great h"tel]289-the great h"tel on [the Embankment]330-the embankment . [Racksole]151-racksole accordingly had the excellent idea of transporting [[his]151-racksole prisoner]2270-his prisoner , with as much secrecy as possible , to [this empty bedroom]2271-this empty bedroom . There proved to be no difficulty in doing so ; [Jules]147-jules showed [himself]147-jules perfectly amenable to a show of superior force .

[Racksole]151-racksole took [upstairs]1128-upstairs with [him]151-racksole [an old commissionaire who had been attached to [the outdoor service of the h"tel for many years]2274-the outdoor service of the h"tel for many years]2273-an old commissionaire who had been attached to the outdoor service of the h"tel for many years - [a grey - haired man , wiry as a terrier and strong as a mastiff]2275-a grey - haired man , wiry as a terrier and strong as a mastiff . Entering [the bedroom]1185-the bedroom with [Jules]147-jules , whose hands were bound , [he]151-racksole told [the commissionaire]779-the commissionaire to remain outside the door .

[[Jules]147-jules ' bedroom]3745-jules ' bedroom was quite [an ordinary apartment]3746-an ordinary apartment , though perhaps slightly superior to the usual accommodation provided for [servants in [the caravanserais of [the West End]3749-the west end]3748-the caravanserais of the west end]3747-servants in the caravanserais of the west end . [It]3745-jules ' bedroom was about fourteen by twelve . [It]3745-jules ' bedroom was furnished with a bedstead , a small wardrobe , a - mall washstand and dressing - table , and two chairs . There were two hooks behind the door , a strip of carpet by the bed , and some cheap ornaments on the iron mantelpiece . There was also one electric light . The window was a little square one , high up from the floor , and it looked on [the inner quadrangle]3750-the inner quadrangle .[147-jules]

[The room]383-the room was on the top storey - the eighth - and from [it]383-the room [you]2279-you had a view sheer to the ground . Twenty feet below ran a narrow cornice about a foot wide ; three feet or so above the window another and wider cornice jutted out , and above that was the high steep roof of [the h"tel]340-the h"tel , though [you]2279-you could not see it from the window . As [Racksole]151-racksole examined the window and the outlook , [he]151-racksole said to [himself]151-racksole that [Jules]147-jules could not escape by that exit , at any rate . [He]151-racksole gave a glance up the chimney , and saw that the flue was far too small to admit [a man]2659-a man 's body .

Then [he]151-racksole called in [the commissionaire]779-the commissionaire , and together [they]2283-they bound [Jules]147-jules firmly to the bedstead , allowing [him]147-jules , however , to lie down . All the while [the captive]1542-the captive never opened [his]1542-the captive mouth - merely smiled a smile of disdain . Finally [Racksole]151-racksole removed the ornaments , the carpet , the chairs and the hooks , and wrenched away the switch of the electric light . Then [he]151-racksole and [the commissionaire]779-the commissionaire left [the room]383-the room , and [Racksole]151-racksole locked the door on the outside and put the key in [his]151-racksole pocket .

' [You]779-the commissionaire will keep watch here , '[151-racksole] [he]151-racksole said to [the commissionaire]779-the commissionaire , ' through the night . It was then about one o'clock a.m. [The millionaire]414-the millionaire retired to bed - not [[his]414-the millionaire own bed]2291-his own bed , but [a bed on [the seventh storey]2293-the seventh storey]2292-a bed on the seventh storey . Later , when [Jules]147-jules was alone again , [he]147-jules remarked to [himself]147-jules , ' [I]147-jules may get that hundred thousand . '[147-jules]

Chapter Twenty - Eight THE STATE BEDROOM ONCE MORE

WHEN , immediately after the episode of the bottle of [Romanée - Conti]233-romanée - conti in [the State dining - room]2321-the state dining - room , [Prince Aribert]167-aribert and [old Hans]223-hans found that [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen had sunk in an unconscious heap over [his]180-prince eugen chair , both [the former]3510-the former thought , at the first instant , that [Eugen]180-prince eugen must have already tasted the poisoned wine . But a moment 's reflection showed that this was not possible . If [the Hereditary Prince of Posen]3111-the hereditary prince of posen was dying or dead , [his]3111-the hereditary prince of posen condition was due to some other agency than [the Romanée - Conti]233-romanée - conti . [Aribert]167-aribert bent over [him]2320-the man sitting on the bed , and a powerful odour from [the man]442-the man 's lips at once disclosed the cause of the disaster : it was the odour of laudanum . Indeed , the smell of that sinister drug seemed now to float heavily over the whole table . Across [Aribert]167-aribert 's mind there flashed then the true explanation . [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen , taking advantage of [Aribert]167-aribert 's attention being momentarily diverted ; and yielding to a sudden impulse of despair , had decided to poison [himself]180-prince eugen , and had carried out [his]180-prince eugen intention on the spot .

The laudanum must have been already in [his]180-prince eugen pocket , and this fact went to prove that [the unfortunate Prince]2325-the unfortunate prince had previously contemplated such a proceeding , even after [his]3111-the hereditary prince of posen definite promise . [Aribert]167-aribert remembered now with painful vividness [[his]167-aribert nephew]2586-his nephew 's words : ' [I]2586-his nephew withdraw [my]2586-his nephew promise . Observe that - [I]2586-his nephew withdraw it . '[2586-his nephew] It must have been instantly after the utterance of that formal withdrawal that [Eugen]180-prince eugen attempted to destroy [himself]180-prince eugen .

' It 's laudanum , [Hans]223-hans , '[167-aribert] [Aribert]167-aribert exclaimed , rather helplessly .

' Surely [[his]180-prince eugen Highness]2573-his highness has not taken poison ? '[223-hans] said [Hans]223-hans . ' It is impossible ! '[223-hans]

' [I]1882-the other fear it is only too possible , '[1882-the other] said [the other]1882-the other . ' It 's laudanum . What are [we]2328-we to do ? Quick , [man]3084-man ! '[1882-the other]

' [[His]180-prince eugen Highness]2573-his highness must be roused , [Prince]2788-prince . [He]180-prince eugen must have an emetic . [We]2328-we had better carry [him]180-prince eugen to [the bedroom]1185-the bedroom . '[223-hans]

[They]2328-we did , and laid [him]180-prince eugen on the great bed ; and then [Aribert]167-aribert mixed an emetic of mustard and water , and administered it , but without any effect . [The sufferer]2329-the sufferer lay motionless , with every muscle relaxed . [His]2329-the sufferer skin was ice - cold to the touch , and the eyelids , half - drawn , showed that the pupils were painfully contracted .

' Go out , and send for [a doctor]672-a doctor , [Hans]223-hans . Say that [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen has been suddenly taken ill , but that it is n't serious . The truth must never be known . '[223-hans]

' [He]180-prince eugen must be roused , [sire]3397-sire , '[223-hans] [Hans]223-hans said again , as [he]223-hans hurried from [the room]383-the room .

[Aribert]167-aribert lifted [[his]167-aribert nephew]2586-his nephew from the bed , shook [him]2586-his nephew , pinched [him]2586-his nephew , flicked [him]2586-his nephew cruelly , shouted at [him]2586-his nephew , dragged [him]2586-his nephew about , but to no avail . At length [he]167-aribert desisted , from mere physical fatigue , and laid [the Prince]2578-the prince back again on the bed . Every minute that elapsed seemed an hour . Alone with the unconscious organism in the silence of [the great stately chamber]2333-the great stately chamber , under the cold yellow glare of the electric lights , [Aribert]167-aribert became a prey to the most despairing thoughts . The tragedy of [[his]167-aribert nephew]2586-his nephew 's career forced itself upon [him]167-aribert , and it occurred to [him]167-aribert that an early and shameful death had all along been inevitable for [this good - natured , weak - purposed , unhappy child of a historic throne]2335-this good - natured , weak - purposed , unhappy child of a historic throne . A little good fortune , and [his]167-aribert character , so evenly balanced between right and wrong , might have followed the proper path , and [Eugen]180-prince eugen might have figured at any rate with dignity on the European stage . But now it appeared that all was over , the last stroke played . And in this disaster [Aribert]167-aribert saw the ruin of [his]167-aribert own hopes . For [Aribert]167-aribert would have to occupy [[his]167-aribert nephew]2586-his nephew 's throne , and [he]167-aribert felt instinctively that nature had not cut [him]167-aribert out for a throne . By a natural impulse [he]167-aribert inwardly rebelled against the prospect of monarchy . Monarchy meant so much for which [he]167-aribert knew [himself]167-aribert to be entirely unfitted . It meant a political marriage , which means a forced marriage , a union against inclination . And then what of [Nella]155-nella - [Nella]155-nella !

[Hans]223-hans returned . ' [I]223-hans have sent for [the nearest doctor]3821-the nearest doctor , and also for [a specialist]3822-a specialist , '[223-hans] [he]223-hans said .

' Good , '[167-aribert] said [Aribert]167-aribert . ' [I]223-hans hope [they]3822-a specialist will hurry . '[223-hans] Then [he]223-hans sat down and wrote a card . ' Take this [yourself]167-aribert to [Miss Racksole]155-nella . If [she]155-nella is out of [the h"tel]340-the h"tel , ascertain where [she]155-nella is and follow [her]155-nella . Understand , it is of the first importance . '[223-hans]

[Hans]223-hans bowed , and departed for the second time , and [Aribert]167-aribert was alone again .

[He]167-aribert gazed at [Eugen]180-prince eugen , and made another frantic attempt to rouse [him]180-prince eugen from the deadly stupor , but it was useless . [He]167-aribert walked away to the window : through the opened casement [he]167-aribert could hear the tinkle of passing hansoms on [the Embankment below]2337-the embankment below , whistles of [door - keepers]2338-door - keepers , and the hoot of steam tugs on [the river]2891-the river . [The world]311-the world went on as usual , it appeared . It was an absurd world .

[He]167-aribert desired nothing better than to abandon [his]167-aribert princely title , and live as [a plain man]1084-a plain man , [the husband of [the finest woman on [earth]656-earth]2343-the finest woman on earth]2342-the husband of the finest woman on earth .... But now ! ...

Pah ! How selfish [he]167-aribert was , to be thinking of [himself]167-aribert when [Eugen]180-prince eugen lay dying . Yet - [Nella]155-nella !

The door opened , and [a man]2659-a man entered , who was obviously [the doctor]2847-the doctor . A few curt questions , and [he]2659-a man had grasped the essentials of the case . ' Oblige [me]2659-a man by ringing the bell , [Prince]180-prince eugen . [I]2659-a man shall want some hot water , and [an able - bodied man]3824-an able - bodied man and [a nurse]3825-a nurse . '[2659-a man]

' Who wants [a nurse]3825-a nurse ? '[2659-a man] said a voice , and [Nella]155-nella came quietly in . ' [I]155-nella am [a nurse]3825-a nurse , '[155-nella] [she]155-nella added to [the doctor]2847-the doctor , ' and at [your]2847-the doctor orders . '[155-nella]

The next two hours were a struggle between life and death . [The first doctor]2348-the first doctor , [a specialist who followed [him]2348-the first doctor]2349-a specialist who followed him , [Nella]155-nella , [Prince Aribert]167-aribert , and [old Hans]223-hans formed , as it were , a league to save [the dying man]2350-the dying man . [None else in the h"tel]2351-none else in the h"tel knew the real seriousness of the case . When [a Prince]2860-a prince falls ill , and especially by [his]2860-a prince own act , the precise truth is not issued broadcast to [the universe]1010-the universe .

According to official intelligence , [a Prince]2860-a prince is never seriously ill until [he]2860-a prince is dead . Such is statecraft .

The worst feature of [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen 's case was that emetics proved futile .

[Neither of the doctors]2355-neither of the doctors could explain [their]2356-their failure , but it was only too apparent . [The league]2357-the league was reduced to helplessness . At last [the great specialist from [Manchester Square]140-manchester square]2358-the great specialist from manchester square gave it out that there was no chance for [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen unless the natural vigour of [his]180-prince eugen constitution should prove capable of throwing off the poison unaided by scientific assistance , as [a drunkard]2359-a drunkard can sleep off [his]2359-a drunkard potion . Everything had been tried , even to artificial respiration and the injection of hot coffee . Having emitted this pronouncement , [the great specialist from [Manchester Square]140-manchester square]2358-the great specialist from manchester square left . It was one o'clock in the morning . By one of those strange and futile coincidences which sometimes startle [us]2361-us by [their]2356-their subtle significance , [the specialist]2362-the specialist met [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole and [[his]151-racksole captive]2363-his captive as [they]2356-their were entering [the h"tel]340-the h"tel . [Neither]2365-neither had the least suspicion of the other 's business .

In the State bedroom [the small group of [watchers]2367-watchers]2366-the small group of watchers surrounded the bed . The slow minutes filed away in dreary procession . Another hour passed . Then [the figure on the bed]2368-the figure on the bed , hitherto so motionless , twitched and moved ; the lips parted .

' There is hope , '[2847-the doctor] said [the doctor]2847-the doctor , and administered a stimulant which was handed to [him]180-prince eugen by [Nella]155-nella .

In a quarter of an hour [the patient]1608-the patient had regained consciousness . For the ten thousandth time in the history of medicine a sound constitution had accomplished a miracle impossible to the accumulated medical skill of centuries .

In due course [the doctor]2847-the doctor left , saying that [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen was ' on the high road to recovery , '[2847-the doctor] and promising to come again within a few hours . Morning had dawned . [Nella]155-nella drew the great curtains , and let in a flood of sunlight .

[Old Hans]223-hans , overcome by fatigue , dozed in a chair in [a far corner of [the room]383-the room]2372-a far corner of the room .

The reaction had been too much for [him]223-hans . [Nella]155-nella and [Prince Aribert]167-aribert looked at [each other]400-each other . [They]2356-their had not exchanged a word about [themselves]2356-their , yet [each]2375-each knew what [the other]1882-the other had been thinking . [They]2356-their clasped hands with a perfect understanding . [Their]2356-their brief love - making had been of the silent kind , and it was silent now . No word was uttered . A shadow had passed from over [them]2356-their , but only [their]2356-their eyes expressed relief and joy .

' [Aribert]167-aribert ! '[2378-his] The faint call came from the bed . [Aribert]167-aribert went to the bedside , while [Nella]155-nella remained near the window .

' What is it , [Eugen]180-prince eugen ? '[167-aribert] [he]167-aribert said . ' [You]180-prince eugen are better now . '[167-aribert]

' [You]167-aribert think so ? '[1882-the other] murmured [the other]1882-the other . ' [I]1882-the other want [you]167-aribert to forgive [me]1882-the other for all this , [Aribert]167-aribert . [I]1882-the other must have caused [you]167-aribert an intolerable trouble . [I]1882-the other did it so clumsily ; that is what annoys [me]1882-the other . [Laudanum]244-laudanum was a feeble expedient ; but [I]1882-the other could think of nothing else , and [I]1882-the other dare n't ask [anyone]415-anyone for advice . But , thank goodness , it has not been ineffectual . '[167-aribert]

' What do [you]167-aribert mean , [Eugen]180-prince eugen ? [You]180-prince eugen are better . In a day or so [you]180-prince eugen will be perfectly recovered . '[167-aribert]

' [I]180-prince eugen am dying , '[180-prince eugen] said [Eugen]180-prince eugen quietly . ' Do not be deceived . [I]180-prince eugen die because [I]180-prince eugen wish to die . It is bound to be so . [I]180-prince eugen know by the feel of [my]180-prince eugen heart . In a few hours it will be over . Do n't let [them]415-anyone know over there that [I]180-prince eugen poisoned [myself]180-prince eugen . Swear [Hans]223-hans to secrecy ; swear [the doctors]3829-the doctors to secrecy ; and breathe no word [yourself]167-aribert . [I]180-prince eugen have been [a fool]954-a fool , but [I]180-prince eugen do not wish it to be known that [I]180-prince eugen was also [a coward]3052-a coward . Perhaps it is not cowardice ; perhaps it is courage , after all - courage to cut the knot . [I]180-prince eugen could not have survived the disgrace of any revelations , [Aribert]167-aribert , and revelations would have been sure to come . [I]180-prince eugen have made a fool of [myself]180-prince eugen , but [I]180-prince eugen am ready to pay for it . [[We]3832-we of [Posen]167-aribert]3833-we of posen - [we]3832-we always pay - everything except [our]3832-we debts . Ah ! those debts ! [I]180-prince eugen forget , [I]180-prince eugen forget . '[180-prince eugen]

[His]2378-his eyes closed . There was a sudden noise . [Old Hans]223-hans had slipped from [his]223-hans chair to the floor . [He]223-hans picked [himself]223-hans up , dazed , and crept shamefacedly out of [the room]383-the room .

'[1663-the sick man]

'[223-hans]

Chapter Twenty - Nine [THEODORE]151-racksole IS CALLED TO THE RESCUE

AS [Nella]155-nella passed [downstairs]3183-downstairs from [the top storey]2392-the top storey with [[her]155-nella father]386-her father - the lifts had not yet begun to work - [she]155-nella drew [him]386-her father into [[her]155-nella own room]879-her own room , and closed the door .

[[Her]2397-her parents]3425-her parents would n't allow it . [He]386-her father was to have got it from [Sampson Levi]184-mr sampson levi , but [he]386-her father arrived too late - owing to [Jules]147-jules . '[386-her father]

' The point is this , [Dad]174-dad , '[155-nella] [Nella]155-nella continued . ' [He]180-prince eugen 's tried to commit suicide - [he]180-prince eugen 's so hipped . Yes , real suicide . [Nella]155-nella 's item of news was a considerable and disconcerting surprise to [Racksole]155-nella , but [he]2399-i hid [his]2399-i feelings fairly well .

' [I]2399-i have n't the least desire to save [his]180-prince eugen life , [Nell]182-nell . [I]2399-i do n't overmuch respect [[your]182-nell Prince [Eugen]180-prince eugen]3849-your prince eugen . [I]2399-i 've done what [I]2399-i could for [him]180-prince eugen - but only for the sake of seeing fair play , and because [I]2399-i object to conspiracies and secret murders .[2399-i]

It 's a different thing if [he]2399-i wants to kill [himself]2399-i . What [I]0-i say is : Let [him]2399-i .

Who is responsible for [his]2399-i being in debt to the tune of a million pounds ? [He]2399-i 's only got [himself]2399-i and [his]2399-i bad habits to thank for that . ' So [he]147-jules was , '[155-nella] [Racksole]155-nella replied . ' [I]155-nella went up [there]290-there this afternoon , chiefly to take [him]147-jules some food .
