Yet when [I]155-nella entered [the room]383-the room [Jules]147-jules was gone .[155-nella]

[He]2443-he had by some means or other loosened [his]2443-he fastenings ; [he]2443-he had then managed to take the door off the wardrobe . [He]2443-he had moved the bed in front of the window , and by pushing the wardrobe door three parts out of the window and lodging the inside end of it under the rail at the head of the bed , [he]2443-he had provided [himself]2443-he with a sort of insecure platform outside the window . All this [he]2443-he did without making the least sound . [He]2443-he must then have got through the window , and stood on [the little platform]2444-the little platform . With [his]2443-he fingers [he]2443-he would just be able to reach the outer edge of the wide cornice under the roof of [the h"tel]340-the h"tel . By main strength of arms [he]2443-he had swung [himself]2443-he on to this cornice , and so got on to the roof proper . [He]2443-he would then have the run of the whole roof .

At the side of [the building]1519-the building facing [Salisbury Lane]120-salisbury lane there is an iron fire - escape , which runs right down from the ridge of the roof into [a little sunk yard level with [the cellars]3531-the cellars]2447-a little sunk yard level with the cellars . [Jules]147-jules must have thought that [his]2443-he escape was accomplished . But it unfortunately happened that one rung in the iron escape - ladder had rusted rotten through being badly painted . It gave way , and [Jules]147-jules , not expecting anything of the kind , fell to the ground . That was the end of all [his]147-jules cleverness and ingenuity . '[2443-he]

As [Racksole]155-nella ceased , speaking [he]2443-he replaced the linen cloth with a gesture from which reverence was not wholly absent .

When [the grave]2449-the grave had closed over the dark and tempestuous career of [Tom Jackson]191-mr tom jackson , once [the pride of [the Grand Babylon]252-the grand babylon]2450-the pride of the grand babylon , there was little trouble for [the people whose adventures [we]2453-we have described]2452-the people whose adventures we have described . [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer , [that yellow - haired , faithful slave and attendant of [a brilliant scoundrel]2455-a brilliant scoundrel]2454-that yellow - haired , faithful slave and attendant of a brilliant scoundrel , was never heard of again . Possibly to this day [she]149-miss spencer survives , a mystery to [[her]149-miss spencer fellow - creatures]2456-her fellow - creatures , in the pension of [some cheap foreign boarding - house]2457-some cheap foreign boarding - house . As for [Rocco]199-rocco , [he]199-rocco certainly was heard of again . Several years after the events set down , it came to the knowledge of [Felix Babylon]153-babylon that [the unrivalled Rocco]199-rocco had reached [Buenos Aires]145-buenos aires , and by [his]199-rocco culinary skill was there making the fortune of [a new and splendid h"tel]2458-a new and splendid h"tel . [Babylon]153-babylon transmitted the information to [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole , and [Racksole]151-racksole might , had [he]151-racksole chosen , have put the forces of the law in motion against [him]151-racksole . But [Racksole]151-racksole , seeing that everything pointed to the fact that [Rocco]199-rocco was now pursuing [his]199-rocco vocation honestly , decided to leave [him]199-rocco alone . The one difficulty which [Racksole]151-racksole experienced after the demise of [Jules]147-jules - and it was a difficulty which [he]151-racksole had , of course , anticipated - was connected with [the police]673-the police . [The police]673-the police , very properly , wanted to know things . [They]673-the police desired to be informed what [Racksole]151-racksole had been doing in the Dimmock affair , between [his]151-racksole first visit to [Ostend]42-ostend and [his]151-racksole sending for [them]673-the police to take charge of [Jules]147-jules ' dead body . And [Racksole]151-racksole was by no means inclined to tell [them]673-the police everything . Beyond question [he]151-racksole had transgressed the laws of [England]22-england , and possibly also the laws of [Belgium]146-belgium ; and the moral excellence of [his]151-racksole motives in doing so was , of course , in the eyes of legal justice , no excuse for such conduct . The inquest upon [Jules]147-jules aroused some bother ; and about ninety - and - nine separate and distinct rumours . In the end , however , a compromise was arrived at . [Racksole]151-racksole 's first aim was to pacify [the inspector whose clue , which by the way was a false one]3894-the inspector whose clue , which by the way was a false one , [he]151-racksole had so curtly declined to follow up . That done , the rest needed only tact and patience . [He]151-racksole proved to the satisfaction of [the authorities]3215-the authorities that [he]151-racksole had acted in a perfectly honest spirit , though with a high hand , and that substantial justice had been done . Also , [he]151-racksole subtly indicated that , if it came to the point , [he]151-racksole should defy [them]3215-the authorities to do [their]3215-the authorities worst . Lastly , [he]151-racksole was able , through the medium of [the United States Ambassador]3896-the united states ambassador , to bring certain soothing influences to bear upon the situation .[151-racksole]

One afternoon , a fortnight after the recovery of [the Hereditary Prince of [Posen]167-aribert]3111-the hereditary prince of posen , [Aribert]167-aribert , who was still staying at [the Grand Babylon]5-the grand babylon , expressed a wish to hold converse with [the millionaire]414-the millionaire . [Prince Eugen]180-prince eugen , accompanied by [Hans]223-hans and [some Court officials whom [he]180-prince eugen had sent for]2463-some court officials whom he had sent for , had departed with immense éclat , armed with the comfortable million , to arrange formally for [his]180-prince eugen betrothal .

Touching the million , [Eugen]180-prince eugen had given satisfactory personal security , and the money was to be paid off in fifteen years .

' [You]167-aribert wish to talk to [me]151-racksole , [Prince]2788-prince , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole to [Aribert]167-aribert , when [they]2464-they were seated together in [the former 's room]2465-the former 's room .

' [I]167-aribert wish to tell [you]151-racksole , '[167-aribert] replied [Aribert]167-aribert , ' that it is [my]167-aribert intention to renounce all [my]167-aribert rights and titles as [a Royal Prince of [Posen]167-aribert]3898-a royal prince of posen , and to be known in future as [Count Hartz]249-count hartz - a rank to which [I]167-aribert am entitled through [[my]167-aribert mother]3899-my mother .[167-aribert]

Also that [I]0-i have a private income of ten thousand pounds a year , and a château and [a town house in [Posen]167-aribert]2466-a town house in posen . [I]0-i tell [you]151-racksole this because [I]0-i am here to ask the hand of [[your]151-racksole daughter]570-your daughter in marriage . [I]0-i love [her]570-your daughter , and [I]0-i am vain enough to believe that [she]570-your daughter loves [me]0-i . [I]0-i have already asked [her]570-your daughter to be [[my]0-i wife]3394-my wife , and [she]570-your daughter has consented . [We]2469-we await [your]151-racksole approval . '[151-racksole]

' [You]2578-the prince honour [us]2469-we , [Prince]2788-prince , '[151-racksole] said [Racksole]151-racksole with a slight smile , ' and in more ways than one , May [I]151-racksole ask [your]2788-prince reason for renouncing [your]2788-prince princely titles ? '[151-racksole]

' Simply because the idea of a morganatic marriage would be as repugnant to [me]151-racksole as it would be to [yourself]2788-prince and to [Nella]155-nella . '[151-racksole]

' That is good . '[2578-the prince] [The Prince]2578-the prince laughed . ' [I]2578-the prince suppose it has occurred to [you]151-racksole that ten thousand pounds per annum , for [a man in [your]151-racksole position]3901-a man in your position , is a somewhat small income . [Nella]155-nella is frightfully extravagant . [I]2578-the prince have known [her]155-nella to spend sixty thousand dollars in a single year , and have nothing to show for it at the end . Why ! [she]155-nella would ruin [you]151-racksole in twelve months . '[2578-the prince]

' [Nella]155-nella must reform [her]155-nella ways , '[167-aribert] [Aribert]167-aribert said .

' If [she]155-nella is content to do so , '[155-nella] [Racksole]155-nella went on , ' well and good ! [I]155-nella consent . '[155-nella]

' In [her]155-nella name and [my]167-aribert own , [I]167-aribert thank [you]151-racksole , '[167-aribert] said [Aribert]167-aribert gravely .

' And , '[414-the millionaire] [the millionaire]414-the millionaire continued , ' so that [she]155-nella may not have to reform too fiercely , [I]414-the millionaire shall settle on [her]155-nella absolutely , with reversion to [[your]151-racksole children]3902-your children , if [you]151-racksole have any , a lump sum of fifty million dollars , that is to say , ten million pounds , in sound , selected railway stock . [I]414-the millionaire reckon that is about half [my]414-the millionaire fortune . [Nella]155-nella and [I]414-the millionaire have always shared equally . '[414-the millionaire]

[Aribert]167-aribert made no reply . [The two men]399-the two men shook hands in silence , and then it happened that [Nella]155-nella entered [the room]383-the room .

That night , after dinner , [Racksole]155-nella and [[his]414-the millionaire friend]2474-his friend [Felix Babylon]153-babylon were walking together on [the terrace of [the Grand Babylon H"tel]840-the grand babylon h"tel]2475-the terrace of the grand babylon h"tel .

[Felix]153-babylon had begun the conversation .

' [I]153-babylon suppose , [Racksole]155-nella , '[153-babylon] [he]153-babylon had said , ' [you]155-nella are n't getting tired of [the Grand Babylon]162-the grand babylon ? '[153-babylon]

' Why do [you]155-nella ask ? '[155-nella]

' Because [I]153-babylon am getting tired of doing without it . A thousand times since [I]153-babylon sold it to [you]155-nella [I]153-babylon have wished [I]153-babylon could undo the bargain . [I]153-babylon ca n't bear idleness . Will [you]155-nella sell ? '[153-babylon]

' [I]155-nella might , '[155-nella] said [Racksole]155-nella , ' [I]155-nella might be induced to sell . '[155-nella]

' What will [you]155-nella take , [[my]153-babylon friend]2542-my friend ? '[153-babylon] asked [Felix]153-babylon

' What [I]153-babylon gave , '[153-babylon] was the quick answer .

' Eh ! '[153-babylon] [Felix]153-babylon exclaimed . ' [I]153-babylon sell [you]155-nella [[my]153-babylon h"tel]470-my h"tel with [Jules]147-jules , with [Rocco]199-rocco , with [Miss Spencer]149-miss spencer . [You]155-nella go and lose [all those three inestimable servants]3905-all those three inestimable servants , and then offer [me]153-babylon the h"tel without [them]3905-all those three inestimable servants at the same price ! It is monstrous . '[153-babylon] [The little man]2477-the little man laughed heartily at [his]2477-the little man own wit . ' Nevertheless , '[153-babylon] [he]153-babylon added , ' [we]3906-we will not quarrel about the price . [I]153-babylon accept [your]155-nella terms . '[153-babylon]

And so was brought to a close the complex chain of events which had begun when [Theodore Racksole]151-racksole ordered a steak and a bottle of Bass at the table d'h"te of [the Grand Babylon H"tel]840-the grand babylon h"tel .
